reviews.review:
the best temple among all. this was the best temple i've seen in siem reap.
the craft work was amazing.
I was awed.
this place should be top priority.

Small temple but with beautiful carvings. Compared to other temples in angkor wat, this is a much smaller temple but it offers different thing to see. It is known as lady temple and famous for its fine and detailed carvings on the structure. Indeed, they are beautiful to see and actually worth the effort to go to this temple to see them.

small temple. Smaller temples but with fine art work decoration, however a bit of a rive from Siem Reap. Nevertheless there are busloads of tourist there and many tacky souvenir shops which make you question why to go there -you can see better locations nearer to Siem Reap with even less tourists...

Enchanting. A pretty temple some distance from Siem Reap (about 25 miles) and from the main temples of Angkor Wat (15 - 20 miles) also called the 'pink temple' for it's colouring or the 'lady temple' as it's more intricate carvings are thought to have been carved by the more patient hands of women.My wife and I perhaps made the mistake of cycling there as we were feeling pretty athletic and were relishing a different sight-seeing experience. The heat and humidity weren't too much of an issue as we made regular stops for drinks along the way from the few villages that we cycled past, taking in fresh sugar beet and young coconuts where ever we could and the flat roads were generously dressed in shadows of the tall trees of the adjacent jungle so fitness wasn't an issue either....The real problem was boredom, once out of the area of Anghor Wat the more interesting sites of temples, gates and moats soon disappear and are replaced by less inspiring jungle and a few stilted shacks.Banteay Srei's certainly worth visiting but I'd only consider it as part of an organised tour, it's too remote for tuk-tuks and there's nothing much else within the area - there's a pretty but small garden, some market stalls and a couple of restaurants. Also, the temple's much smaller than those closest to Siem Reap and it's walls aren't very high so there's little shade from the Sun. Consider the time of your visit carefully and refuel with fluids when the opportunity presents itself!

It's a schlep to get there!. It takes quite some time to drive out to this temple but, on the other hand, it's a small temple and doesn't take much time. Additionally, you get to see a lot of the area when driving out there, but it's a LONG drive.

My Favorite Angkor Wat Temple. The level of detail and the minuscule size make it an easy to navigate and explore temple. Unfortunately a lot of it is roped off now, so you can't explore it ups lose like some the others. But the red clay, opportunities for a great photo and intricate level of detail make it worth the trip.

Enchanting, ancient. I enjoyed Banteay Srei, formerly known as Ishvarapuram. The coloration on the rocks and the slight curvature to the temple structure are marks of its passage through time. If anything it inculcates a greater sense of reverence.

Pick the right time. This site is around an hour out of the main city but it is best to go early in the morning to avoid the crowds. We got there by 10am and it was already impossible to take any pictures of the architecture without including the crowd.

Small but beautiful temple, worth a trip from Siem Reap. This temple is quite different from the grand temples in Ankgor - much smaller and it has quite a different style of carving. Very very beautiful and not nearly as busy as Ankgor itself. It is a bit of a trek from Siem Reap - about 40 mins in a car. Too far to go by tuk tuk.

Worth driving out to see this smaller temple. The stone used to build this temple differs greatly from Angkor Wat or Thom, and does have a lovely sense of colour about it. Its very easy to walk around but it is a 35 minute drive from the main Angkor Wat temple

Best preserved. Part of temple circuit
Further out but well worth it
Roped off so no up close pics but preservation of detail is amazing

The female temple. All temples have their own uniqueness but this one was different for me. Loved the feel and area surroundings - a little further from town but in my books a must see - then head to Phnom Bakheng for a little hike to a refreshing waterfall... :)
Small but Exquisite. This is a smaller temple with exquisite carvings, one of my favourite temples.Good for children because of its size and clear carvings and statues.
best one. We are very love this temple it was beautiful one .Had very nice caving and pink color but a bit far from city .
Long journey but worth seeing. Very distinct and more intricate carvings. Nice to walk around the grounds. We had this as an add on to the Grand Tour.

Almost all collapsed need better historic conservation . It's quite disappointing that poor historic conservation made on banteay srei. All are collapsed and tourists are allowed to step and touch the monuments.

Temple of Beauty. Make the effort to go a little further to this temple. It's worth it! Smaller and less grand but by no means less beautiful. It's colours and the surrounding beautiful countryside give it a whole different feel!

Fabulous carvings. Had read lots about this temple and, having visited the National Museum in Siem Reap and seen an example of the amazing carvings - so intricate - couldn't wait to see it. Was not disappointed.
Pink Sandstone. This is such a pretty temple! Indian architecture in a pink sandstone makes this temple a little different! This is a smaller temple but well with seeing!
Wow. This temple is not big like Bayon but still nice to see. This was our first stop during visiting temples. Not busy like other temple.

Good one to see if you have time!. Indian style temple with wonderful decoration. Not so big as others but still stands as it was without many damage. Far from the City Centre about 30 min with tuk tuk, very quite and calm as no many tourists go their. If you have time go there.

The Pretty temple, my favourite. This was by far my favourite of all of the temples that I visited. It was the least busy and the sellers all seemed to be well organised and controlled (and so didn’t have an impact on the actual temple itself). This temple is quite a distance from Siem Reap, and the journey in a tuk tuk was half the enjoyment. We wandered, we took photos, and we enjoyed the tranquillity. Although it is challenging to get here this is the temple I would recommend to anyone coming to see Angkor!!As with most of the temples there are stairs, steps, rock falls, and uneven surfaces to be aware of.

The Red Sandstone Temple. From Ta Keo, drove about 30 minutes before arriving at Bantaey Srei. This temple was built from red sandstones in the 10th century dedicated to Shiva (Hindu God of Destroyer).Required to walk about 200 metres before arriving at this temple in the forest. While walking will get an opportunity to see lots of greeneries, possible habitat to some animals. Spotted a buffalo and few dragonfly.There will be a ticket check point before the temple. From the front entrance, will be guided to walk around the temple and exit from the rear. 45 minutes needed to complete touring this site.
The most beautiful temple in town. There are many temples in Siem Reap but it's one of the most beautiful temple cause it remains seem new even its life is very long centuries..
pink lady temple. Beautiful pink lady temple is one of the very old ancient temple in the world. A must visit place. Nice sunset view too.
Nice architecture. Again one shouldn't miss it. It gives a different feeling of architecture in 1000 years ago. Lot of damages have taken place but I must say good restoration has been done.

Another one of my favourite temple. We really enjoyed this temple. The intricate carvings were amazing and so beautifully detailed. It's astounding how beautiful it is here. This temple is also known as the Lady Temple.

Well worth the journey!. Exquisite carvings and the colours of the stone make this an unforgettable temple to visit. The restoration work is amazing and the displays are really interesting and educational. so happy we made the effort to go. Not the largest temple by any means but the best carvings by far.
Sightseeing. This temple has the most details on its architecture and wall carvings. This is a must see if you don't plan to see all the temples.
Away from the Crowds. A really nice small temple away from the crowds (well most of them), take your time time to enjoy and learn about the discovery and history

Each temple so different. I am so very glad i was able to hire Angkor Visitor (Praim hear) for my personal guide. I would have missed most of the fascinating details of this intricate world heritage site. Very worth seeing and ecperiencing. There are so many things thst are different in every temple.
Beautiful temple. Beautiful small temple dedicated to women.Elaborate ornaments and sculptures relatively,close to Kbal spean.

Must Visit. Place can visit for Sunrise. It a historical building with religion and culture of Cambodia.
Should get a tour guide at the place who get share and tell more history info and story about the building and Cambodia.
Tour guide be charged USD 15 for English and USD 25 for Chinese language.

Worth the trip to get to. Banteay Srei is about 45mins from Siem Reap by remork. It's a smaller temple but with probably the best tourist infrastructure around it - toilets, information, small shopping area.Enjoyed walking around the outside of the temple (outside the moat/water) - kids found lots of frogs and grasshoppers to keep them amused.Temple stonework was beautiful - unfortunately we were overrun by large crowd of Chinese tourists who arrived, which made enjoying this visit difficult, due to loud tour guides taking over different parts of the temple.This was the monsoon season, so hate to think how bad it would be in peak season with thousands of people.

Amazing. We loved this temple. It's a bit further out than the main group of Angkor temples, and the road can be a bit bumpy. It took us about an hour with our tuk-tuk driver to get there from Siem Reap. The temple is beautiful. The carvings are amazing. We liked the way the central part of the temple was roped off, preventing people from getting too close (it made it easy to get good photos).Definitely worth a visit.

Another great site. Wow, we took a little time out to relax here and go a little slower after a busy morning at Angkor Wat and we are so glad we did. It is same, same but different than the others and being able to get up close and personal in Banteay Srei was a treat

Real Woman Temple. I love this temple very much because it is small and carving on the pinkish stone and all the carving are clear, It was build in the 10 century by King Jayavaraman V in year 951 very long until now, but it still beautiful and it was also dedicated to the three gods of hindu which I had learn when i was at school. It is the first time for me to visit this temple and I will come to visit again with my mother.I think I am good luck to see this temple.

The "Art Gallery of Angkor". 20kms and a few extra dollars for your tuk tuk driver but your stay in Siem Reap won't be complete without seeing it. Exquisite carvings and a beautiful setting, this place fully deserves its moniker. One of the earliest temples to be built at Angkor and possibly its finest. Best time to visit this place is around lunchtime when most of the tour buses have headed back for lunch in Siem Reap. That's not to say it's the busiest of the temples thanks to its relatively distant location, but you'll be glad of the lack of people if it's unspoiled pics you're after.

It's out of the way but worth a visit . We got a tuk tuk from our hotel to go visit the land mine museum. Our driver and hotel suggested we see this temple too as it's nearby. So glad we decided to, after a fun tuk tuk ride, the heartbreaking land mine museum we got to see this brilliant temple. Beautiful colours and less crowded then all the others we went to.

Smaller than expected.. This place is a bit out of town and is quite small.The carvings are very detailed and well preserved.Nice place but I prefer the other temples.Good place to wander around as there are botanical gardens and a boat ride through rice fields.
The Best temple around the would . Everyone who come to visit the temple should not miss to see Banteay Srey temple because it is the best one and it just only 32 km from the city.

Small and easy walk. This is a smaller temple. It should take about 1 hour, maybe less, to complete. Bring water as you will needed. In comparison to other more popular temples, this wasn't that crowded (low season).

Detail carving. One of my favourite temple, small but pack with the detail carving. The carving here is smoother and detail, comparing with it with angkor wat or bayon, not sure if it's due to different stone they used. The colour of the temple also different, gave it more photogenic vibrant. One of must visit temple, even a bit further away from siem reap.

Pink temples or sand stone temples!. I can't imagine about the amazing of this temples. Very charming temple beside of Angkor Wat. The sculpture on the wall is still new with high decorations by the Khmer ancestors. Can't forget it.

Most intricate temple. The ride here on tuk tuk took almost one hour but paddy field views complete with buffalo, cows, village huts, kids riding bicycles to school made it a fun and educational journey. The temple is as red as the pictures. Although small, there were intricate and extensive details on the red sandstone. Behind the temple complex, you can see more paddy fields. The exhibition building is an interesting set up for such a humid weather.Definitely should not be missed. We started out at 7 and dropped by Angkor Thom after and was done by 1pm (the kids can't manage longer than that!) we paid usd20 for tuk tuk for the day.
wonderful temple. Greet building of temple with the nice Apsara on the wall of temple. I was happy to visit there and I took nice photo of temple.Fantastic!!!!

Banteay Srei requires a long walk.. You need to walk a bit of a distance after you get off from your vehicle. The temple is being restored. There are plenty of photo opportunities. At the end of the temple is a nice resting place under the tree with music by local musicians.

Temple Wonders. The details on these temples are just awesome. I can spend the whole day scrutinizing every details that it has to offer. They have an unbelievable faith for the Gods to build something like this.

Gorgeous volcanic rock lady temple. Very unique and beautiful temple with the pink appearing volcanic stone. Well preserved and different from many of the other temples we saw. Make sure to get a guide so you know where the library was, dancing hall, etc (highly recommend Happy Angkor Wat Tours, ask for Mr. Bun!! )
Worth the visit. We went by tuk tuk and had a good feel for the country side and small villages on the way . A small temple but worth the visit
Sane but different. Once again i feel there are not any words. I am closer to 70 than 60. I foubd the heat almost unbearable. But that said, itvwas still worth every second in that heat. Do it!

Carvings a must see. This has exceptionally fine quality carvings. These cover all surfaces of the lovely pink sandstone. We were told the temple represents a 'jewel of Khmer art.' we found it interesting that this temple was sponsored by a member of the royal court but not a king.
Small one. Compare to the other temples in Siem Reap, this is a small temple. You can use Angkor Wat tickets here.

What an amazing piece of Cambodian history. My darling partner and I toward this fabulous park with the help of a great guide Mr Clean from Happy Angkor Tours in the hot and humid weather of late summer – autumn in Cambodia. The trip was worth every bit of the effort to witness this astounding piece of Khmer's amazing past
Beautiful temple. Banteay srei it was amazing temple very nice stone and nice covering ,Can call temple lady temple ...
Amazing!. It's a must...the drive to the temple via the country road brings you closer to Cambodian countryside. It's a nice change from the main Angkor Wat area...it's a must see!

Very Beautiful temple. The temple is beautiful and nice pinkish color.
The carvings are good and visible.Worth a watch.
Overall very nice experience.

uot of town but worth the visit. This is a awesome temple it begun to be built in 881 The second oldest monument in the world, they have dug this up and used the dirt as pathways to and around the temple. This is a temple that should not be missed due to being a around 1 hr tuk tuk drivre

Amazing and organized temple . The temple was very well organized, the bathroom was also extremely clean.
The artwork and sculpture was really well done, 3D
It's just abit far to get to and also should try to get there before the tour group begin. (They come around 9:00++)

So delicate, so beautiful - MUST see. The Banteay Srei is just beautiful, a miniature in scale with delicate detailed carvings in lovely red sandstone. I think this is my favorite temple in the Angkor area.It's located 37 km from Siem Reap, appr. 45 minutes by car, would guess at least an hour with tuk tuk. But it is really worth the effort.Try to be there early before it gets to crowded.

Pink sandstone temple. way out from the other temples makes it a worth a visit with it's pink sandstone beautifully crafted walls of the Hindu epic. I love the green that surrounded the place.so peaceful n beautiful

Beautiful but a bit far. Its one of the farthest of the lot in Siem Reap but a beautiful one.Include it in your itinerary if you are staying more than 3 days in siem reap. We opted for the package offered by our hotel (22 $ - tuk tuk) but combined it with outer trail (Ta som, Preah Khan etc). You can cover this in the first half and keep the rest for the second off with Sunset at one of the temples. Better to start early to avoid the heat.
Beautiful Carvings. A bit out of the way, but we loved the "Ladies Temple" with its magnificant carvings and pink hued stone. Great place for a picnic outside the walls.

Far but worth a visit. Banteay Srei is farther than the rest of the Angkor complex, but is included in your Angkor ticket/pass. Because of its lack of proximity, you'll find that the tuktuk driver will likely ask for a couple bucks more. Considering the hour long roundtrip travel time, it's worth it. You'll also get some spectacular views of the Cambodian countryside. Our tuktuk driver suggested that we take his car instead (for more money, of course), but the truth is that tuktuks are more fun.As for the Banteay Srei complex itself, the temple is exquisite, but small and may be slightly disappointing when compared to the other sites at Angkor. That's why the journey itself is half the attraction. Also, keep in mind that among the sites you visit at Angkor, this will be on the newer side, open to the general public for less than 10 years.
Do not miss this temple. This temple is far away from the main temples, it takes about 45 minutes or an hour by car to get there, but it's worth the effort.

Preserved and beautiful. As this temple is Abt 15kms out of Siem Reap there are less people. It is a small and well preserved temple surrounded by greenery. Worth the visit if you have the time, calming and less crowded
Wow!. The first temple we visited. It was the smallest one we saw, but that didn't diminish the awe we felt walking among the ruins. Worth the drive!
Stunning!. A must see! Banteay Srei was absolutely beautiful and stunning. One of my favorite temples during my visit.

Fine crafts, only could be done by ladies. This is a temple built by ladies, you will be amazed by all the craft, they are all so fine. It's worth the trip even though it's around 37KM from Siem Reap.

A bit overrate, but still beautiful!. This temple took quite a journey to reach (over 1 hour by tuk tuk) and, although it was totally gorgeous, it was a bit anti-climactic. Maybe because it was our last temple of the day and you literally cannot go inside the temple as its all roped off to preserve the building, but we were a bit disappointed and did not stay long.
Cambodian Holiday. See other review by me. This site is very special with beautiful rose sandstone carvings.12 century carvings grace this temple.Some of the finest work in the region
Small, intricate and beautiful. This temple is a small one that is well worth the visit for the gorgeous colour with astonishingly intricate detailing.

I like this more than Angkor Wat. This is my favourite temple in Siem Reap. The carvings are really beautiful. You can see the faces of "dancers" clearly for those were not damaged. You will be amazed how those people built such a beautiful temple.This temple is a small temple and not close to Angkor Wat. It takes an hour to travel to this temple. However, it is worth it to go. In the hour trip, we could also see the local life of Cambodian. It is heart-broken to see a beautiful and wealthy country changing to the Cambodia nowadays.

Like a mini, pink Angkor - very nice!. I liked that this temple wasn't very crowded. The details were similar to Angkor Wat, and the exterior looks like a mini Angkor from afar. There is a viewing platform to the SW of the exterior wall where you can get a great photo of the entire temple.

A different kind of temple. This temple is all by itself on a different path from the other Angkor Wat temples. We devoted a day to it since everyone said it was beautiful. First of all, the 45 minute tuk-tuk ride in the pouring rain was great fun, though I felt sorry for our driver who was exposed to the wind and rain with a thin rain coat for protection. On our way back we stopped at the landmine museum. Banteay Srei is very different from the main Angkor Wat temples. It's sculptures are better and it has this pink tinge. Lots of nice shops there, selling stuff much cheaper than the Siem Reap market.

Maybe my favorite Temple. This temple is a little past the landmine museum which and we found it. It too crowded on and overcast Monday in rainy season. The outer walls are badly damaged and crumpling but the goddess temple has had some amazing restoration and the detail along with the pinkish stone is gorgeous. I love that it's the beautiful lady temple and goddess temple. It's worth the drive and covered by you temple pass ($20-1 day, $40-3 day)

One other beautiful Shiva temple, badly ruined.. This is very artistic temple, with intricate and a lot of carvings. This is the one Shiva temple where Nandi is still seen in front of the Altar but is half broken, it is heartening to see the loot. Must see temple.

Secluded but beautiful carvings. It took us about 30-45 minutes to get out to this temple on our tuk-tuk so it was a bit of a haul. But because it is so far away from the rest of the complex, it was pretty quiet with very few visitors. It was also probably the best example of the facade carving decorations out of all the temples we visited. Overall, it was a really peaceful visit but not necessarily the most striking of the temples. Also, on the drive out to the temple we pasted several small villages along the road. They had traditional Cambodian houses built up on stilts and we got to see people going about their daily lives. I thought it was interesting to get a peek into their normal lives.

Gorgeous pink lady. This was one of my favourites. Its such a beautifully carved temple in the prettiest pale shade of pink stone. It is a little way out of town but we just hired a car and driver to take us there and we went early -before the tour buses. It is also the best organised temple in so far as info is concerned. Around the actual temple itself there is very little signage but as you walk out (it is set up as a one way circuit) there are some great rooms with a very detailed history and architectural description of the temple which was really informative.

Beautiful, quiet and a bit off the track. A different temple lies a bit off the track - Banteay Srei. It is called "women's citadel" and made of red sandstone. This is why it looks quite different. All the decorations are very beautiful and a lot of effort is put into restauration and conservation. Definitely worth a visit!

First ruin we visited of many. Since it was the first, I was overwhelmed with the history and beauty--having no idea the amazing sites to come at Angkor Wat etc. Good intro to the Cambodian temples and a nice little restaurant on-site.

Amazing carvings. The detail of the carvings make this a unique temple, a definite must in a visit to the area. Although not a large temple, the detail and preservation of the carvings on the "lady temple" are not to be missed

Pretty in Pink. Banteay Srei is just wonderful. It's a little way out if the Siem Reap, but the countryside on the way is lovely too. They say that this place was built by ladies as it is very intricately carved. They call it the ladies temple accordingly. It's not huge and will only need 30 mins to take it in.You just have to go here, it really is lovely and is so different from anything else you'll see in Angkor Park...you won't regret it!Two small bits of advice...don't follow the exit signs out as it is a long walk and just opportunities to flog you things. Double back on yourself instead. Also, if you're a lady, don't wear shorts or have bare shoulders/tops of arms as you won't get in.
Our favorite!. The major temples we went were amazing but this is our favorite. So much intricate carvings and the pink sandstone were of a different sight.

Even more beautiful than the main temple in my opinion. people tend to do the shorter circuit but this is worth the trip. the structure and design planning were very lavish and gorgeous. Loved this probably more than all the other temples

Super impressive. At the suggestion of our fabulous guide, Ratanak, we visited Banteay Srei. It's a smaller ancient temple than the great, expansive Angkor Wat, but it is not to be missed. The colours of the buildings and the level of detail that remain after hundreds and hundreds of years is just plain cool. The newly built visitors center is well designed and adds a bit of frame to the location, while not over powering it. Highly recommend a visit.

Beautiful and Fairly Quiet!. I would highly recommend going to this temple as it was pretty quiet when we went in July. Yes it poured down in rain for half of our time there, but it made for stunning photographs. Banteay Srei, Bayon, and Ta Prohm were my favorites hands down!

One Of the Must See Temples. Although a wee out of the way, this temple really is a must see. The quality of the carvings are astounding when you consider their age and compare them to other sites. It is also just a truly beautiful place.Although we attended in wet season, it is still extremely hot. Lots of water and a hat will not go astray. Be patient with your photographs, while there are lots of visitors, this is one of the most popular sites to visit, if you are patient, you will eventually get that people free shot you are looking for.This is a temple that really should be on your list even if it is outside of the traditional circuits.
A Shiva temple. Awesome temple. Try to be there when it is not too hot and int he morning sub=n the color of the temple looks really cool.
Go see for yourself. If you liked Angkor, this beautiful and serene Srei, with its intricate carvings is also a "Must See".

Banter Srei - something right out of an Eastern fairy tale. Worth the 39 km drive from Angkor Wat, this beautifully preserved Hindu temple has the best preserved artwork of all of the 80 temples in the area and is made of a pink/red stone. Breathtaking!
Small temple but beautiful. This temple is sma and easy to roam around. The difference is that is build using pink sandstone. Great place for some food photographs.

Not sure it's worth the trek. Good thing about this, it's relative serenity, but there's much less to see here than the big three. You can go for a half hour walk and see a paddy field, or get sold postcards by small kids who say they attend school in the other part of the day. Some beautiful intricate carvings on the temple. Facilities including not very clean toilets, broken mosquito nets, and maybe 10-15 stalls. About 45-60 minute drive from central Siem Reap. August not the best month to visit temples - very hot - but this temple has a fair bit of shade

Small but I really liked Banteay Srei . We went to the 1000 Lingas site and dropped in on Banteay Srei on the way back to Siem Reap, I'm really glad we did a lot of detail and colour great for photographers and helps make a reasonable day trip including the 1000 Lingas. You don't need very long to have a good look around this one, well worth the visit.

Magnificent carvings. One of my top five temples in Siem Reap. Never miss its intricate and detailed carvings. Unlike the other Angkor temples, this is relatively small when it comes to size. But what it lacks in size, it makes up on its superb carvings! Be responsible when visiting this temple. Don't touch the carvings!

Sunset here was spectacular. We reach this one just as rain rolled in. Challenge to walk around, but after the rain passed it offered some great views. Watched the moon appear in the East and watched the Sun set in the West and wrap the buildings in a hue of gold.

Built on a human scale. . An attractive temple, much simpler and smaller than most, but there's something appealing about it being built on a much more human scale. Many of the carvings are surprisingly fresh and clear.

Nice Smaller Temple - Off the Beaten Track. As title says, it's a nice slightly different looking temple that is off the beaten track, i.e., it takes a while to get there. We did this at the on our third day of temple tours in Siem Reap - all by tuk tuk, and were a little templed-out by then. It's a nice ride and you get to see rice fields and nice rural houses. We got to see people making palm sugar candies (and tried some).

Lovely colours and better frescos. Many say this is the best temple in the Angkor Wat area; it's certainly pretty. The sandstone is a reddish colour, different to the other temples. Our guide called it the "Ladies Temple". The carved frescos are in very good condition too and very easy to see. Be aware that to protect these you obviously can't get too close to them, but they are beautiful to see. You need a ticket here, we had a 3 day ticket for $40US which got us into all the temples. The temple is at least 30 mins drive from Siem reap, maybe longer in a tuk-tuk.

Awesome. We decided to do this tour last minute, so glad we did. This temple is well preserved it is mind blowing to see. Do your self a favoure if you are into history and architecture go and check it out

Beautiful, but you can't get very close to most of it. This temple is cool in that it's almost a miniature version of the other temples in Angkor. It almost has a fairy tale feel. Because of its size, it can easily be visited in under an hour (although you could spend more time, if you wanted).The problem is, the thing it's famous for - its incredibly intricate carvings - are hard to get close to because of all the barriers set up all over the place to protect it. I understand the temple needs to be protected, especially to preserve the delicate carvings, but it's sort of self-defeating when you have to strain to see them. Not as many photo ops as a lot of the other temples, either. I think the problem was my expectations were too high. Go there with lower expectations and you'll probably love it. As it was, I still really liked it there.
Beautiful. This is a beautiful temple made of a reddish sandstone . It is different than some of the other temples and interesting to hear the history from our wonderful guide Long

Detailed carvings. The entrance has the usual eager sales stalls, but once at the temple you will be in awe of the detailed relief carvings in this smaller temple. Worth the drive out of the main complex to view.

Exquisite and worth the 34 km trip. Given the distance, we kept this visit for our 3rd day of temple-hopping. We also decided to use a tuk-tuk instead of a car, in order to have a better view of the countryside along the way. Both decisions did work well for us. The amazing quality of the stone carvings here are the more striking if you’ve already seen the other major temples. The size of the parking lot (and the quality of facilities for tourists, from information booth to cafeteria to toilets) clearly suggest that this attraction can be very crowded at times, but we were among the lucky 20-30 souls who were there at that moment. The garden-like paddy field surrounding the service buildings, complete with grazing buffaloes, is also a pretty sight good for souvenir pictures.

Temple tourist. Well worth seeing , very intricate carvings. make sure you visit the land mine museum as its between Siem Reap and Banteay Srei. It's not much further them Ankor Wat and costs an extra $15 round trip.
Beautiful detail. A lot quieter than the other temples. Lovely detail and good preservation. Small but well worth a visit for the beautiful detail of the carvings.

Also famously known as the Pink Temples. Much smaller in size than the Angkor Wat temples, but equally rich in splendour and significance. If you are interested in souvenirs and basic shopping highly recommend to shop from the various shops near to the complex. Could bargain little but prices are so reasonable that one does not feel squeezing for a better bargain. Really need a tour guide to highlight the depths and insights of the Hindu mythology etched on the temples and stone carvings.

Different, but Gorgeous . If you feel all the temple have very similar style, try another one name Banteay Srei or Lady Temple. It is located the north part of Siem Reap City around 40km. It is nice in decorations

Wheelchair accessible. Perhaps the most accessible temple in the Angkor Archaeological Park. Accessible toilets and reasonable pathways. The real challenge is getting in, with bollards blocking entry into the complex. Recommend combining a visit with the butterfly farm and Landmine museum.

Nice but Not Special, Worth Combining with Landmine Museum. It just rained when we got ther so with water in the yard the temple looked more interesting. Took a stroll around the small complex then went to the outer part where the lilies pond was. Nice view with reflections of the water. Some kids were asking for money but with a firm no they didn't push. They wanted to be photographed so we asked them to smile and showed them the results and that made them happy. On the way back we stopped by the Landmine museum. Not the best but it raised awareness of the seriousness of the issue, victims and people who cared.During our memorable 4 day visit to Siem Reap (3 yrs back), we used the service of a fun and knowledgeable young driver, Sochet (nysochetra@gmail.com, +855 12 331 664, driveangkor.com) who took us around in his sedan or nice tuk tuk incl. from/to the airport. Got him per a TA fellow's recommendation so would like to do the same here.

a bit off the beaten trail but worth it. we traveled there by Tuk Tuk- it took about 50 minutes.... but the natural AC was lovely and seeing the countryside along the way was worth it. The tombs themselves are architecturallly very different from Angkor Wat or other temples.... much more Hindu in feel- but even more impressive. Worth the time

Citadel of women. Not sure if fact or myth, but the saying goes it was built by women. Hence the pink stone and intricate carvings. Small yet a very beautiful temple. Very different to the other temples.

An Enjoyable Drive from Siem Reap. This temple is a 45 minute tut tut ride away from Siem Reap... and it is this drive that made this one of my favorite temple experiences. We really enjoyed seeing life alongside the road -- smelling caramel being made, children riding bikes home from school and fields being tended. The temple itself is beautiful with more intricate carvings than can be seen at the Angkor complex...

My favourite!. Make sure to take the journey out to this one - it is a bit of the way but DEFINITELY worth the trip! It is different than the others and it's stunning. The park is filled with such beauty - I recommend spending 3 days looking at the various temples/wats. I recommend getting a tour guide for at least one of the days so you get more out of the experience.

Very complex carvings, well preserved temple and must visit. We had great pleasure visiting this place, preservation is just perfect. Very complex carvings and detaild work. Small place .. will not take more than an hour. Must visit.

The Lady Temple - Banteay Srei. It is located in the outskirt - nearly 40min Tuk-Tuk drive from the main Angkor Thom circuit. I have to say the travel time is debatably worthwhile. If you are in a rush, you might wanna focus on the other temples rather than gambling time just to visit this one. The complex is small - although the architecture is somewhat different from the standards you see within the Angkor ThomRecommendation: Spare some ample time to visit. Stop at the Cambodian Landmine Museum and local markets to ensure a maximal time spent on the way. You can still enjoy the Cambodian villages lifestyles on the route, but that's about as much that you could benefit from the travel time

The Pink Temple!. The temple of Banteay Srei is a little further out than some of the others, hence it is a little quieter, also known as the pink temple or the lady temple, it is constructed in the traditional was but the sandstone here is more pink. Lovely views over the lake and the paddy fields.

Worth the one hour drive from Siem Reap. This is a much smaller temple, but nevertheless an amazing attraction and a must see if you visit siem reap. It's about an hour by car from siem reap, much longer if you take a tuk tuk! You should be able to cover this temple in about an hour and then head back into Siem Reap for lunch!

Must Visit. This is a beautiful little temple far away from the temple complex. But, you would miss a lot if you decide to skip this temple. The temple has beautiful sculpture engraved on it and the way to temple takes you through paddy fields and villages. Also, the famous landmine Museum is on the way. You need to have the Angkor Wat temple pass to go to this temple. Bit, the security guards might allow if you put a dollar or two.
Not as enjoyable as Angkor Wat or Bayon. The one thing to see in Banteay Srei is the well-conserved carvings on the walls. Aside from that, not such a thrill as Bayon or Angkor.

Too far. The journey to Banteay Srei is approximate 1hr by tuktuk from Angkor Thom, so please plan your journey. The temple is not really huge compared to Angkor Thom temples, but if you want to learn about history why not visit here.

Small but beautiful. This was the last temple we visited. It is a distance from town but a great way to see the country side on the way. Its small but so beautiful, the intricate carvings in the pink sandstone have to be seen to be believed. No wonder they think woman did the carvings. I think this temple is a must see.
The gem of them all.. elaborate carving created by skilled craftswomen? absolutely amazing site. Definitely the best site.

Exquisite temple . This place is totally unlike the more massive and monumentalist structures, however ruined, that you get access to with the basic Angkor ticket. The stone is slightly pinkish, the temple is small and low-lying, and the carvings are generally very delicate. The repair work seems to have been carried out very subtly. Because it comprises a small area, however, it is well worth arriving first thing at 730 so you can see it all in the tranquility it deserves. There is a beautiful walk to be had if you follow the signs towards the boats. The boat ride looked good but I had run out of cash. The visitors' centre is all spic and span and includes a informative display about the temple's history, discovery and repair program. And they do a good iced coffee. You know what they say about early birds and worms....

Jewel of Khmer Art.. Located about 20 kms north of Angkor at the foothills of Kulen mountain, this Jewel of Khmer Art is a temple of great beauty from 10th century,with splendid miniature proportions devoted to Siva and pantheon of Hindu gods. Meaning of Banteay Srei is " Citadel of the Women " or " Citadel of Beauty ". It's also called as Isvarapura. Unlike other major sites at Angkor this is not a royal temple but is built by Yajnavaraha, one of the ministers of King Rajendravarman, who later became guru of future kings. Signage board at the reception is quite informative. I was tremendously impressed by the delicacy of each carving and unique arrangement of central platform that followed cardinal principle of Yama from south and rest such as Kubera, Varuna as per the traditional pattern.Since it's located away from Angkor there are no crowds and I could enjoy fresh breeze and slight drizzle as I walked on causeway to main tower. Lintels and pediments with sand stone reliefs are rich in ornamentation and need to be enjoyed without any hurry. Stories from hindu mythology depicted on carvings are quite exceptional and a treat to appreciative eyes. Same ticket that was for Angkor Wat is valid here. There is also a restaurant and few shops selling souvenirs inside the campus at entrance.One has to plan in advance by hiring Tuk Tuk to reach the place and take you back to the hotel.Not to be missed.
Must have. There's a place where military girl training. Was amazing to see the ruins and their history. Hope to come back again.

The Beauty of ancient Khmer architecture. Although this temple was built around the same time as Angkor, the wall carving had been better preserve. Is worth the visit although is an hour away from the city. Plan visiting early morning or late evening to avoid the crowd as this is not a large temple.

Different and pretty but a bit underwhelmming. This temple is about 45 mins drive from Siem Reap. Very pretty and nicer, better preserved carvings and temple features than anything in the bigger temples but a bit of a let down. It's a Hindu temple and 100 years older than Angkor area temples so different in a few ways. It is very small compared to the temples of Anglor Wat and Angor Thom and even with a tour guide you will struggle to spend more then 30 mins there. We were without a guide and to walk around the inner temple is about 5 mins. Maybe we were just spoilt having just come from Anglor Thom.

Beautiful Temple. After seeing numerous temples, it is possible to get Temple Fatigue. Then this one pops up. The color, size and unique sculptures makes this a stop that is worth the drive. Beside being a beautiful temple, the drive was the most scenic of our vacation. the villages and countryside are picturesque. Between the drive and temple, it was our most photogenic day.
amazing one. lady temple or real name banteay temple it was so amazing for visiting take 37 km from the city but so cute temple with pink stone .

Go early. This temple is part of the big temple circuit. It's quiet far from Siem Reap but it was nice to drive through the country side. Hire a car if you can afford it. I went very early. I was the only tourist there for about 40 mins. The security guard left me get really close- on the other side of the rope for $5. Really beautiful and covered by the temple pass.

I believe this is what the locals call the lady temple. If this is the 'lady temple' it is pretty but average I would say, It about 30 minutes away from the rest of the temples and not really worth the extra money you pay

Well worth the visit to see a different temple. We arranged for a guide who drove us about 1 hour from Siem Reap to the temple area at Banteay Srei, which we found worthwhile. You can rent a tuk tuk for less without the air-conditioned car comfort.The place to purchase your park ticket is on the way and for a one day entrance fee the price is USD$20 per person. Although, the ticketing process is handled efficiently our guide did help with getting a ticket quickly, with a photo taken, and the queues can build up with tour bus loads arriving...so get there as early as possible to beat the crowd. The temples are well worth the visit. Known informally as Ladies Temple because the thought is that the stone carvings are so detailed that only women could have done such fine work. The pink coloured stone makes this temple a must see for a different experience. The site offers easy access to temple area and it is not difficult to walk around this temple. Interesting sights on the road journey along with other places to visit on the trip like the landmine museum.

feeling like seeing those pirctures emerge into a real life. It is a bit far about 30 kilometers from Siem Reap town. it worth the trip with tuk tuk costing you around $40 max last for all day. Tr to go there earl to beat the unexpecting weather during the raining seasons.

Astonishingly detailed carvings and a lovely drive. We are five people and rented a van for the day for $55 to go to this temple as well as the Land Mine Museum which is a few kilometers closer to Siem Reap and on the way. The countryside along the way is beautiful and allows a view of life in the smaller farming villages, and there are also panoramic views of the rice fields from the path to the monument. The temple, included in the temple pass, is relatively small and peaceful, though there is little shade from the hot sun. Definitely worth seeing, as is the Land mine museum, which is heart-breaking.

The most detailed well preserved temple.. This place is out of the way and that is a good thing. It is about 30 kilometers away from the rest of the temples and this allows for better picture opportunities than you can get at the most heavily trafficked temples. Eat before you come as prices at the restaurants are double those in town.

Too far from the city.. They said it was a pink temple. I ask a tuk_ tuk driver, if he could recommend a place that is nice and famous. To my surprise, the temple look still the same colour as the other was. The only thing amazing there is, the shops that sell expensive items and the stall that sell sweet manggoes. The seller are friendly and they did not cheat me with the price they give.

Simply stunning!. Banteay Srei is such an incredible temple! When I read that the temple was known for its detail I didn't expect it to be this amazing! The carvings are so fine its almost hard to believe that this temple is so old. I guess thats why they believe it to be built by women.

A must do!!!. Even though the temple is further away, it is a must do. We went there early. (Beat the crowd!) It's a small place and take a moment to absorb what you see and look at the stories on the tempels. The detail is extremely good. It really is the temple of beauty.

Citadel features. Banteay is given based on the citadel like features. This is slightly smaller than the rest of the temple but because of its pink stone and unique features, it is worth a visit. It is slightly way off from the main temples.

Awesome temple. The stone is a different colour than the others, very neat to see. I would recommend hiring a guide for 2 days as we did (can be arranged through your hotel). He was able to give us explanation as to what everything was used for our meant. It was fabulous

Beautiful, well worth the drive. A bit further out of town, well worth the visit. Practical point: the TukTuk driver we'd used for 2 previous days wanted a major surcharge to go all the way out there, which we saw as a 'warning sign'. We're glad we ended up taking a 'regular' car, enabling us to (comfortably) visit some of the other temples further out of town.
Not to be missed. After Angkor Wat this was my favorite temple. Small in size and easily "conquered" with amazing intricate carvings...it is a must see.
Different from the others. Smaller but a definite must-see temple. The pink sandstone exterior sets it apart. A shaivite temple with all the Lingas missing..sad but needs to be restored!
Not to miss when visiting Angkor Wat. A great exponent of the evolution of the architecture techniques use by the Khmers showing its pinnacle in detailed carvings in Banteay Srei.

Detailed carvings, 37 km from Siem Reap. It was a longer drive from Siem Reap than the rest of the Angkor Temple complex, but our guide told us it was his favorite of them all, and after visiting it, I could see why. The drive there and back was interesting, too, because we could get a look at the surrounding countryside a little bit, and ask the guide questions. The whole side trip was definitely worth doing.Unlike the main Angkor temples, Banteay Srei is made from pink limestone, not gray limestone. Maybe that helped keep things from wearing away as much, because the detailed carvings on the temples seem to have held up better here than at the other temples. The monkey statues were particularly cool. It was a beautiful, interesting temple, and I got some great photos.

Unique from all other temples, more expensive to see. Banteay Srei is further away from the other temples, so you must pay your tuktuk driver / taxi more money to see this one; however, it is unique from the rest (made of red clay with far more intricate carvings). Be sure to carry a bottle of water with you everywhere and have $1 bills for souvenirs.

Intricate detail. Come along here in your tuk tuk or the mode of transport you've chosen for your journeys.Beat the crowds by getting here before 11am.The intricate detail that you'll see will leave you in awe. The beauty that is displayed was for the ladies of ancient Cambodia. There any many reliefs depicting stories of Hindu religion.Take a closer look and marvel in its splendour. The quarry used to build this red stone complex is not known.

Make sure you're dressed correctly!. Nice I guess but I could only look from outside as my shoulders and knees were exposed. The same clothing got me into the rest of the Angkor temples, but for some reason they were really strict here.

Awe inspiring!. This temple was built in 996 or was it 969, i am so full of dates and numbers I get confused. It is out of the city guite a drive but worth every kilometer. Its small but still so intact. All the colours and carvings so vivid and so pronounced. They actually had libraries in those days!! Beautiful. Translation Banteay Srei is Citadel Ladies. Lol a must see!!

Make the visit to this one - so worth it. Driver w car is worth the trip out of Siem Reap to view this monument - unexpected sculpted monkeys, exquisite detailed carvings in pinkish hue stone - a model of ease in walking through and around the monument. Site has perfectly organized WC, souvenir, plenty of drawn out charts and narrative on history of Angkor as well as world comparisons. Be certain to listen to the mine victims' music w a donation. Find the working model of Cambodian farm and paddies on a lookout pier - a stunningly beautiful Cambodia -

Banteau Srei - The Citadel of woman. Probably not as famous as rest of the temples in Angkor Wat, I think this is vastly underrated. Fabulously detailed , intricate carving adorn this place made of red sandstone - this should not be missed

Less Overwhelming, more appreciation. Great, well preserved and restored carvings, more colorful than the usual temples found around SR, quite crowded when we were there but maybe because that was the peak hours to visit. Everyone should see this wgen visiting SR. Small temple BUT ... i say BUT ... very eye catching.

Beautiful. This is further afield than the rest of the sights at Angkor but well worth the drive. Smaller in scale but in very good condition with some great carvings still clearly visible. With stone slightly different in a colour than the other temples it provides a nice contrast. Also much quieter and peaceful when we were there.

Gorgeous temple!. It's a relatively small and charming temple that we loved, don't miss it while in Siem Reap. It's colour is sort of pink / red as it's made of different stones than the other temples in the area. As for the other temples, better if you have a guide for all the explanations.
Citadel for women. Beautiful intricate carvings on the walls .Also Sanskrit writing at one of the gate entrance . Quite an experience ..seeing it for myself and relating them back to history.
Exotic Charm. One of the best temples in Siem Reap. Worth going to especially if you plan to visit just enough temples in a day. Not so exhausting to roam around to unlike the others.

Must see. The temple is small, but the carvings and details are gorgeous. In the rainy season, you can have some amazing photos here. I would also recomment taking the 20 minute boat ride they provide. For 10$, you can enjoy the tranquility and beauty of the place.

Worth the a Extra Trip. Banteay Srei is a bit further from Siem Reap than the other temples. We took a tuk tuk, and added it to the "long tour" of Angkor. It is unique in the detail that remains on the reliefs. The surrounding land is very beautiful. There was a band made up of land mine victims that we sat and listened to when we needed a break from the heat and hiking. Of course, it is important to tip them or buy a CD. You can grab food, drinks, and souvenirs there as well. On the way, stop and visit the Land Mine Museum and the butterfly garden.
Beautiful!!!!. It is incredible to see what mankind have been able to achieve centuries ago. The complex construction is amazing!!!

Pink jewel of a temple, but small. I joined a cheap guided Grand Tour organized by a downtown travel agent for a second day of temples (after the most prominent sites of Ankor Wat, Bayon, Angkor Thom, and Ta Prahm). Banteay Srei was worth the drive to see the small scale Hindu temple with very intricate carvings. The temple is essentially all at ground level with no climbing. The monkey statues guarded the east facing entrances to the main temple tower. The guide had extensive knowledge of history but his English was a bit hard to understand. Our tour stopped at a restaurant south of Banteay Srei, popular for tour stops, with great food including Khmer Amok served in a coconut.

A bit out of the way but worth it. I really liked this temple set away in the jungle. Had the feeling of being in the jungle book meeting the monkey King...I would include it in your temple plan for the area
Great!. This temple features exquisite carvings of pink sandstone, and there is the thought it was done by women. Hence, the unofficial name, "Lady Temple."

Beautiful carvings. This temple is much smaller than some of the others in the area, so it's easy to fit into a day of touring a few different places in the area. It is particularly beautiful due to the rich colour of the sandstone structures and the very intricate, detailed carvings. Absolutely stunning! Don't miss this one.

One of the most beautiful!. This temple complex shouldn't be missed! It's a bit further than the other complexes but the detail and rose colored sandstone is beyond impressive!! The carvings are amazingly detailed.

One of my favorite . One of the oldest temples while also being one of the most well maintained and preserved temples in Siem Reap. This is made of a different stone, which is why this has a different hue than the other temples. Banteay Srei means "Citadel of the Woman", the detail is breath-taking.
Smaller temple, but very pretty. If you have time, definitely stop at Banteay Srei. Quite different than the other temples as this is sandstone.

Jewel of Khmer Art. This temple built with pink sand stone is having the best sample of Khmer art. This temple was renovated by French archeologist Mr. Henri Marchal using anastylosis process, in which the whole is dismantled systematically, the foundations and structures are strengthened and the temple is reconstructed over it. The Barabadour temple at Java was renovated like this.

Lovely rose colour temple . My friend recommended me to visit and it's worth it. Even though on the 2nd day we got already a bit tired after continuous climbing of temples, this one you don't need to climb so is a good relax. The surrounding area with nature is nice too.

Small but delicate. This temple was a bit different than the other ones around Angkor Wat. It took us about 30 minutes to get here and many of the tours would charge you an additional 15 usd for the distance. I think it is quite worth it as it is a small but delicate temple. Unlike some of the bigger temples such as Angkor Wat, this temple is fairly well preserved. You could still see a lot of the carvings and details of the artwork.

Quite a drive out from Angkor but worth it. We visited this place after doing the Angkor Wat sunrise tour. So we got there very early, around 745 AM, with no other tourist in sight! Very serene. Very peaceful. Have a guide to explain stuff to you.We left just as a horde of tourists poured out of a bus. Just in the nick of time I say. Phew!The Cambodian Landmine Museum is located between Angkor and Banteay Srei. So, just ask your driver or guide to make a short pitstop here on your way back. If your itinerary is the typical 2-day or 3-day package, you'll have ample time on day two to fit this in.
Pink and Pleasant. The place was amazing and was made of sandstone. The temple is very different from other temples so worth visting!

Nice temple, good trip going there. It's quite a bit out of the way: 40 km by tuktuk, which was great. We saw lots of the environment: cows, all kind of houses, banana trees, rice, many cambodians resting in hammocks under the trees because it was very hot. The temple itself was not big, but with beautifull details. On the way back we visited the landmine museum and the butterfly sanctuary.
Fascinating. Like this whole area, superb. A gem full of interest, way out in the country and very much worth the trip both for the monument and for the interesting drive.

Cannot believe these carvings. A small temple (as they only had limited supply of the sandstone needed for then highest quality carving). Some 30km from Siem Reap it would be easy to skip - and that would be a mistake.The carvings are amazing - really amazing. Apparently the French justified taking some of the temple back to Paris on the basis no human could have done carving that good. I don't agree with the looting (give the stuff back France) but I can understand the sentiment.Perhaps best summed up by our guide telling us he risked his life as a child to see the temple's beautiful carvings (it was mined by the Khmer Rouge) - and it had been worth the risk.

Very different to the rest, set in Botanical gardens.. A little further away from the main Angkor area, but worth the drive. Pink sandstone used, so quite different to the others. Good information centre, which is lacking at the other temples, plus shop and toilets. Beautiful garden setting
History made. We toured Banteay Srei on a cooler day which made it just so surreal we could not believe all the work that went into these Temples
Beautiful. Beautiful detail and interesting color. A little farther away...but worth it. Be careful of temple overload...so pace yourself.
Must see. Absolutely fascinating and easy to get to if hiring a tuk tuk. On site knowledgeable tour guides will offer their services. They are very polite just agree on a price first.
A different kind of Angkor.... Instead of imposing, it has an airy feel with the pink sandstone and intricate carvings. Do pick the end of the year to go when it's not so hot.

nice temple. each temple is different and banteay srei has something different to offer, it is a bit further away from the main temples but worth making the effort. Known as the ladies temple it is less crowded than the mainstream temples but very impressive
Simply Superb. If you had only 1 day in Siem Reap, I'd tell you to visit Banteay Srei and Angkor Wat Very well preserved, superb and intricate carvings and probably the jewel of the Angkor temples
Gorgeous temple carvings. This temple is smaller than the rest, but it is not to be missed. The. Ravings are more intricate than others and the pink sandstone glows in the light.

Best Preserved of the Temples we saw. This one is a good distance away from the main temple complex, which is probably why it's so well preserved. It managed to avoid a lot of the damage during the wars the other temples were subjected to. The rock color is different and the monkey statues are fun to look at. Different from the other temples figures. Also being further out it was less crowded than the other temples. If you go, try to hike up the hill near by to see the carvings in the river. The old man at the top made me feel like a wimp the way he hopped around up there trying to show us all of the interesting points.

Citadel of the Woman. I did this by tuktuk and it's a long way out but so worth it. I love this place so much that i have visited it twice in 8 years, it is so picture perfect, carvings are so delicate.
Red Color Temple. A must visit temple in Siam Reap. You can see the different in color between Banteay Srei and Angkor Wat. Of course you can snap a good picture here.
Do not miss this. The rock carvings are at their best at this site. The carvings are so delicate as if they are done on plaster. This is a must see site if you are in Cambodia.

A bit off the usual road, but.... A bit far away by tuktuk from the main Angkor site, this is still way worth seeing. Fom an expat point of view the influence of India is there to see in Angkor Watt, but in Banteay Stei it was like a wake up call on Cambodia's ancient culture.

Wonderful View. It is very interesting and awesome to visit this place. It seems a century age of ruins during the this monarchy. Very historic for bhuddist religion believers. It is very impressive how this temple was built. The architecture is superb. Two thumbs up for me.
One of the quieter temples. Banteay Srei was one of my favourite temples because of the open spaces, many walkways and stairs. Also because it was much less popular than the bigger temples.

Worth the drive. Banteay Srei is a 45 minute drive away from the main temple complex. I initially did not want to go because I was tired, but our driver insisted we go and I am glad he did. This small temple in the jungle was built around 900 AD and is dedicated to Shiva the Destroyer (arguably pretty cool). Due to the sandstone used for building, the carvings are as intricate and detailed as they were hundreds of years ago.The drive to Banteay Srei is also an experience itself if you have not left the main drag of Siem Reap. You will see houses on stilts, farms, and a glimpse into daily Cambodian life you may miss otherwise.

Take the time. This temple was great to visit, not only for the intricate designs of the architecture but also the meticulously maintained grounds. There were cafes and shops out as well, didn't realize this was an entire village. The drive out from Angkor Wat was beautiful in the morning.
very beautyfull. small temple, but really beauty just visit 1 hour at all. it may be 1 hour from siem reap city and just 25$ for tuk tuk transfer.

Banteay Srei, The Orange Colored Temple. This temple built in 10th century is attractive since its color is rather orange. It is located about 37 km from the center of Siem Reap. It is equipped by the boating facility and parks. Do not miss to visit this temple.
Worth the trip out of town, my favorite temple. I would recommend getting a tuktuk out of town to visit this temple, it is unlike any of the others we saw while in Siem Reap.
Great carvings. Perhaps the best or at least, most pronounced carvings amongst the temples. A small temple and around 50 minutes from town, but worth considering. The land mine museum is on the way.

Make sure to include this temple in your tour. This is one of the most beautiful temples in Siem Reap. Because it is old the sandstone used in its construction is of better quality, and so it has kept the fantastically intricate carvings phenomenally well-preserved. The temple is dedicated to the Hindu God Shiva, but the temple is also known as the citadel for women.
Great. Lady temple was far way about 40 Km from siem reap city but was very nice temple ,it have caving a lot it amazing .don't forget visiting .

The best of all temples in Cambodia. Don't ever miss visiting this temple. The carvings are so intricate that it will leave you breathless and speechless for a few days. You will only keep thinking of the carvings. There is a carving of Sita being abducted by Ravana and its so tiny above one of the doors but so beautiful. Do visit this temple, its worth the drive.

Small temple that doesnt get enough credit. This temple is a great site despite it being smaller than the rest. It was probably one of the more preserved sites without as must restoration. Great find!
Amazing. For archaeological buffs, this is a great piece of history. The construction of this place will leave you spellbound

Unique temple site within Angkor. Banteay Srei at first seems like a regular temple in the amazing area of Angkor, Siem Reap. However, the carvings at this temple are beyond intricate. They make everything else, including the grand Angkor Wat, seem plain by comparison. Definitely add it to your list when visiting Siem Reap.

My favorite temples in the whole complex. Banteay Srei is 45 minutes by Tuk-tuk each way from the main Angkor complex but well worth the effort. The relief carving is much deeper than at Angkor. Also the pink colored stone makes different from the other places we went to.
Delicate sculptures. This temple is a good 40min drive from Siem Reap but well worth it. The intricate carvings are outstanding.
Our favorite temple!. This temple is very well preserved and has such intricate carvings....EVERYWHERE! The colors were beautiful. Plus it is small and not crowded.

small and beautiful. unlike other temples this is one of Siem Reap's smaller temples. you can witness the intricate delicate carvings and the stunning colour of the stone. The temple has a feminine touch to it. located in a serene environment with beautiful trees and 2 ponds attached to it.

Gorgeous . One of my favorite temples. This temple is located about 40 min away from ankor wat, but is very worth it. The details are STUNNING and well preserved. If you have the time definitely worth the trip out there.

A Little Way Out - But Different to the Others. This temple is a little bit away from the others (I think about an extra 1/2 hour tuk-tuk ride away from the main complex - but covered under the Angkor Pass), but it has it's own unique style. The carvings in particular are a lot more complex and distinguished, and the pink colour is fascinating. Worth the extra time, and you can relax on the way out.

Such intricate engravings and detail at every turn. Fantastic temple whose detail impresses. This place is made of pink sandstone and very well maintained. The beautiful pink sandstone is amazing and it is a very serene site. Also the tourist crowds are usually much lesser than those sites close to town.

Beautiful temple with its own unique charm. This was the first temple we visited in Siem Reap and even if it was raining, we still enjoyed walking around and found it very much worth the trip getting here. As compared to the other temples, this has more intricate carvings and designs.
It very interesting. banteay srei or lady temple was very nice .it make by pink stone and site very nice caving all inside if you are come visiting don't forget get there it was very nice temple .

Amazing History. Part of Angkor World Heritage so your 1 Day/ 3 Day pass covers it. The area takes around 30 mins to walk around. I find the Interpretation at the entrance which talks about the history of how Banteay Srei was found amazing. If you have done Angkor Wat and other major ones already, this is a good choice provided you still want to visit another Hindu temple.

Beautiful temple. This is a must see if you have time during your stay in Siem Reap. It is a bit of a trek by Tuk Tuk to the Lady Temple but it is totally worth it. You get to see much of the country side on the 30km trip to the temple. Stop by the landmine museum along the way.
Temple. Great visit worth the time if with good guide that is knowledgeable about the various time frames that the temple was used & by what people

Beautifully Preseved Carvings - Must SEE. Called the "Lady Temple" - has some of the most well preserved carvings of all the temples in Angkor Wat. Smaller temple than the more frequented ones, so make sure you go during low- peak times (your guide should know the timings/season). Bring a good phone to take pics! One of my fav temples.
Banteay Srei. Something about the color of the stone...everything here looks red...this is one of the oldest shiva temple...an small quite place which is about 45 kms away from siem reap.

Intricate detail. This is one of the very best-preserved temples in Siem Reap, and well worth your time! We didn't know how this temple could possibly be more detailed than the others, but sure enough, it is! Very beautiful. Very special.
Very nice caving . Lady temple was far way but very nice with pink stone .Small then angkor wat but ineresting caving .can visiting on last day .

Beautiful Pink Temple. Banteay Srei (a.k.a. Pink Temple) is different than the rest of the temples in Siem Reap. It has a pink hue and the details of the carvings are still very well preserved.It is a bit of a drive from Angkor Wat complex but the drive along the way is interesting as you can see the way the locals live, visit a few other temples and the Landmine MuseumIt is worth the drive, along with Ta Prom, these two temples are my favourite temples in Siem Reap ... yes, even beating Angkor Wat for me :)
Another amazing temple. Each temple you visit offers something different to the others. Good to read up on each one prior to visiting.

Very far. The temple is small but the journey out there is worth the trip. It takes about 45 minutes by tuk tuk and it is a chance to see how the local people live and work. You don't really need more than an hour at the site as its a small area to cover but the inscriptions are beautiful

A little far, but beautiful!. A little far from from the town, but worth the time going here. Compared from other temples, this attraction has its receiving area, bench for the visitors, nice and clean comfort rooms, Exhibits, and souvenir shop. They are really strict on the outfit and you should wear clothes which is appropriate for a temple visit. What I like about Banteay Srei is its vibrant color from the soil to the ruins, its very photogenic. The temple is not that as big as other temples and easily got crowded by the number of tourists.
Unbelieveable. Pictures don't do these temples justice. So much to take in and all so wondrous. So serene. I would have loved to see these temples in all their splender
nice pink stone. banteay srei temple was very nice have very good caving .and different stone from angkor angkor wat or another temple don't forget if visiting siem reap .
Beautiful temple. Banteay Srei is in great shape and the structure is hauntingly beautiful. Don't miss this one. Smaller than Angkor but fewer tourists.

The Jewel of Khmer Art. With its intricate wall and column carvings the "Jewel of Khmer Art" is undeniably awarded to this temple. What makes it more elegant is the color of the temple which is made of red sandstone. Banteay Srei / Srey is located in Banteay Srey District and quite far from the Siem Reap Proper. Tuk-tuk Tour (One of Cambodia's Mode of Transportations) is one and i think the best option to get there. Take Note: Don't forget or misplace your Angkor Pass coz this temple is afar from the Tourism Center to pay another one.
Very nice one good caving . Lady temple or real name banteay Srei temple stay a bit far way from siem reap city but have to see this it was amazing temple with caving and like pink stone.

The most beautifull temple in Cambogia. This temple was one of the best which we visit. It was small and lovely, without thousand tourists. Water around temple make this place full of harmony. I definitely recommend this place.

Grand and stunning!. Beautiful temple, with a lovely hue to the stones and VERY intricate carvings. Stunning temple with clear, tragic signs of damages inflicted on the Shiva-related symbols like many other temples in the region.Definitely a top 5 temple in Siem Reap (along with Angkor Vat, Bayon, Prea Khan & Ta Prohm).
its 1000 year old Shiva temple. Its around 45 minutes drive from siem reap and is really in ruins, it was sad to see most of the statues of lord shiva & Nandhi broken or cut.
A must visit. If you are visiting Angkor vat then you must visit this place. A very beautiful structure surviving even after 1000 years. Telling the story great king Suryadev Burman

One of a kind! Must visit in the Angkor Wat trip. Though this temple is little outside the inner circle of Angkor Wat complex, this temple is a must visit. The statues and carvings in this temple are completely different from the ones in Angkor Wat, Bayon or Ta Phrom. Banteay Srei is much more intricate and beautiful. I would say this temple was the most intricately designed temple and beautiful in this tour!

Make a Day of It. We visited the Butterfly Farm, Banteay Srei, The Landmine Museum, Banteay Samre, then Ta Som and Pre Rup in one day. The first 4 of these attractions are in the same location. We travelled by tuk-tuk which we loved as you got to see the countryside and got a glimpse of local life in Cambodia. You could easily get a tuk-tuk for $20 USD, but we paid $25 USD as we really appreciated our driver. Banteay Srei is well worth the visit. The carvings are very intricate and detailed and you see different shades of pink depending on the time of day. There is a platform outside the main wall of the temple from where you can get a great view over the wall of the entire complex - you need to follow the track towards the boat rides.This temple complex is like a little village.

Would have been perfect experience without police bribery. Arrived at 5:30pm, got through the ticket control without a problem. Only problem was the police at the site saying it's closed. I was so disappointed since we took the tuktuk for more than an hour. I asked if there is any way we can just look around and come back. He kept saying no. Suddenly another police approaches, asks for $5 tip for a private tour. What can I do? Had no choice since I couldn't come back the next day and otherwise they won't let me in. Was there for about 20 minutes took some pictures. Nice thing was that there were no other people. Highly recommend to visit before 5 at least. On the way back in the tuktuk was a bit scary since there is nothing on the road. Even the tuktuk driver told us to put everything away because he didn't know the neighborhood. Otherwise the temple was worth the visit. So much detailed carvings compared to Ankor Wat

Must Visit. Though a bit far than the Angkor temples, the carvings at Banteay Srei are sharper and more beautiful than those find anywhere else at Angkor, the Pink color further adds to the beauty, we followed the trip to this temple with visit to Thousand Lingas, Mt Kulen.
beautiful temple. Beautiful but small temple. There is also quite a bit of history to this temple, so definitely worth a visit

See my comments on Angkor Wat. This temple is a little further afield from Angkor Wat, etc but well worth the extra effort to get there. Smaller than the others and in beautiful pink sandstone, this temple is sometimes referred to as the ladies temple. The intricacy of the carving is quite beautiful and the carvings at least have survived quite well despite their age. Banteay Srei is one of my favourites.

One of my favorites. Although this temple is a bit further out, it's definitely worth the trip. It is just exquisite. We visited in late afternoon, which was perfect. The light intensified the beautiful pink color of the temple.The carvings are so beautiful, the place was not at all crowded at that hour, so it was an amazing, peaceful experience.I would say this is a definite "don't miss" on your trip.

Small Temple with rare pink/red brick. Banteay means both "beautiful" and "women" in Cambodian. Srei simply means temple. So you can read it as Beautiful Temple or Women Temple. THe name was created when a french archeological team was excavating/looting the temple and noticed all the beautiful carvings of women in the temple. The temple itself is small and often overcrowded once inside. But the carvings are worth seeing. The temple is farther away from Angkor Wat so some people might skip it. HOwever, most people say that if you come to siem riep and do not see Banteay Srei, then you haven't really been to Siem Riep at all.

Pink & Refined Lady Temple. Went to this lady temple on my second day. Took about 45 mins to reach this temple by Tuk Tuk. Fantastic countryside views along the road. The cravings for this temple is very pretty & refined. It's different from Angkor Wat. You should be there to see it by yourself
Best temple . Good caving is lady temple or bandeau srei temple 39km from city same Angkor tickets is was beautiful place for visiting after Angkor wat temple .
Also known as Women Temple. Small temple but the craving was so details. you ca just drunk in it. The design, the craving and the details on the wall.

One of best. A bit of a distance but see countryside on the way..especially on tuk tuk....this place at first looks like a pile of rubble but it soon opens up to an amazing piece of architecture with rooms...sculpture,swings made from vines..and amazing trees

Great temple . I travelled an hour in nearly 40 degree heat to get here. Not a very big place but again a marvellous piece of architecture. Nothing like the scale of Angkor watt but still an interesting place to visit
Gorgeous!!. A beautiful temple dedicated to the Hindu God Shiva. The carvings are intricate and well preserved. It's away from the temple circuit but well worth the visit.

Intricate temple built by a Brahmin minister - carvings of Karaikal Ammayar & Ramayana. You need the Angkor ticket to get in here too. I would get the 3 day pass. This Intricate temple built by a Brahmin minister - carvings of Karaikal Ammayar & scenes from Ramayana - Vali and Sugreeva fighting etc. Please do the research online and skip the boring guides. Being from South India and quite familiar with the South Indian temple architecture, it was pretty shocking when the guides say that the inscriptions on the temples are Tamil.Personally these small sandstone temples seemed more beautiful than the huge granite temples at Angkor.

Most Elaborate. I know people tend to get templed out at this complex but Banteay Srei was the highlight for me of all the temples. The elaborate and intricate carvings are really quite special. I believe this was the women's temple, but I might have misheard. I spent the longest at this temple enjoying the decoration which is surprisingly well conserved given its intricacy.
Awesome. Go in morning or late afternoon.. I really suggest you go here early in the morning or late afternoon. To really enjoy these temples you need to have peace. Not to much noise.
