Probably my favorite temple over all.. It is out of the way and less crowded. The carvings are rich, exquisite and deeply carved. It is also very small and almost no stairs. A long pleasant path takes you in.

Fantastic experience, not to be missed. One could say that one gets tired of seeing ruin upon ruin. But one would be wrong! This is another in a series of incredible temples and you simply cannot pass this up
Intricate carvings. Banteay Srei isn't a large temple but it has some wonderfully intricate carvings and a much different appearance to the larger temples. It is therefore well worth a visit.

Off the usual circuit, but worth it.. A belated review, as I travelled in January and am still catching up.!Further out of Siem Reap than most, but the stunning setting, intricate stonework, and even the slightly different slightly dark rusty colour of the temples themselves, make this longer than usual trip worth it. Still quite busy, but NOT on the scale of the larger Temples.Everyone else has said everything about Banteay Srei, but I will add that behind the complex, to the right as you face it , there's a path that's signposted as 'fishing and boat trip'. Don't get too excited about the boat trip, but head that way..it's 5 minutes, for some spectacular photo opportunities over the surrounding open countryside and distant hill or two. The car park (entrance) is well signposted, you won't get lost.!One other top tip I can certainly give some of you is :If you wear contact lenses, travelling any distance outside of town on the dusty roads is NOT a good idea. For your comfort, and so not to ruin your day, remove them and revert back to glasses. Luckily I had my glasses with me, otherwise it would have seriously ruined my day. Be warned.Also, tie this trip in with a stop at The Cambodian Landmine Museum....a very small but poignant Museum with a big message.!
A bit far from the other but worth to go.. Banter Srei is a bit far from the other (about 37km) but still worth to go. This place is the best place to see the craving on the wall in Siem Reap.

The best temple. Went to almost all the temple in Siem Reap. Bantesy Srei is the BEST! Compare to temples in Siem Reap, Bantesy Srei is untouched and the carvings are more detailed and so so beautiful!!! It's about 40 mins of tuk tuk ride in the heat (37k away from Siem Reap) The day I went was 37c. It was crazy hot but I'm so glad I visited!

Small but worth it. This temple is very far and very small, you'll spend longer to get there than what you spend in there, but it's worth it! It looks like a mini version of the other temples, and the carvings are really detailed, you can't believe how long ago they were done. It is also the one with most information for you to understand what you see. I think out of all the temples this is the best-preserved one (although to keep it this way, they don't let you in close to the structures, you can just look at them from around, but it is close enough to look but not touch)

Beautiful Architecture. Banteay Srei stands out from the other Angkor temples for its detailed architecture. This temple has some intricately carved out apsaras as well as monkeys. The entire temple is pretty well kept and very beautifully made. A little off the track, but a must visit

Beautiful Temple. Angkor Wat temple complex in believed to have some 400 big and small temples in 400 square kilometre area, it is impossible to see all of them in one day, one can purchase 3 day ticket which would help you cover some most of the main temples and distant temples like Wat Bakong and Banteay Srei within these 3 days time period. Wat Bakong is 25 KM south west of Siem Reap on the way to Airport. Banteay Srei is a miniature temple nearly 25-30KM north east of Siem Reap on the way Kulen Mountain/ National Park. Taking tuk-tuk to both these temples is not advisable as one looses time in traveling.

Liked it the most in the Angkor circuit. This temple is far from the popular Angkor temples and is usually skipped by most tourists. But I am glad we did not. We travelled for close to an hour and a half from our hotel in the city centre to reach Banteay Srei and surprisingly I liked it more than the other popular temples in the Angkor circuit. The carvings are mindblowing. Scenes from Ramayana cannot be missed. Must visit place if you have the time.

Do not skip. This is good because it is several km to the NE of the main Ankor Thom area. On the way in your tuk tuk you will see villages and various things along the road. The complex has a style that is different from the balance of Ankor Thom. Do not skip.

My favourite - of all the Temples (in the Siem Reap district). Much smaller than most other temples, I found this one to be the most interesting. Built originally as 'The Ladies Temple' (pink sandstone in colour) I found it intimate and calming in its environment. The carvings were exquisite yet quite delicately executed.For me, this is one 'not to be missed', despite the fact that it's located 'further out' than many of the other temples in the district.Wear VERY sensible walking shoes - no flip-flops or sandals - as the terrain is VERY uneven and in places, quite difficult to navigate!Oh, and get here 'early' before the onslaught of tourist crowds!!

Petite Pink Womens Temple is lovely. This petite pink temple, known as the Citadel for Women, has some of the most intricate carvings. Not a large complex, but definitely worth a stop. And if you buy the multi-day pass, you can stop here easily.It's called pink because the sandstone here is pink sandstone. Lovely.

A little way from Angkok Wat and Angkok Thom but well worth the trip. A Hindu temple that was restored the the '30s. Called the Ladies Temple, it is made from reddish or pink sandstone. The ornate carvings are extremely well preserved. Does not compare to Angkok Wat in size and scope but it is well worth the time to visit. It is about 15 miles from the main temples.
Small but beautiful. This is one of the smaller temples, but is really intricate and a very nice colour for photos. We did a loop and came back through Bayon and Angkor Wat.

Timing is everything . This is probably one of the most delicate temples in Ankor. The carvings were exquisite, and every part of the temple was carved. Unfortunately our visit coincided with Chinese New Year. Trying to see this small temple at the same time as 15 bus loads of people didn't make for a pleasant experience.

Nice. Small but intricate carvings
Pretty and interesting especially when you hear about the potential dangers involved in visiting until not that long ago.

Far and small temple but worth a visit!. It took us around 40mins to 1hour to reach this place. This is a small temple but the carvings are more intricate the the ones around the main tourist spots like Angkor wat. The carvings are very much detailed and most of them are not worn out. This is also the only temple i've been in Siem Reap that's got color because of the stone used. There weren't a lot of tourists when we went there maybe because of it's location, but this is worth a peak.
A gem. This is a jewel of a temple. Smaller than the other temples but beautiful in pink sandstone with stunning carvings throughout.

A smaller temple to round out a day. Even with this being our second visit to Siem Reap, Angkor Wat is overwhelming. We'd intended a quick revisit there with time for a second and maybe third Wat to follow but the morning got away from us. Our guide suggested Banteay Srei, being a small temple from a different period and that worked perfectly. It was interesting but not overwhelming and different from Angkor in most respects.
amazing. all our group,we are amazed, colors,temple, nature,that is famous for the stunning pink hue of its red sandstones
Sacred feminine Temple. Really interesting experience to walk in the Banteay Srei garden and see these ancient temples, called the Lady Temple by the locals.

Must see. If you have the time and want to see a different temple in Siem Reap then I highly recommend Banteay Srei.It is not on one of the two tours as it is outside Siem reap. About 40kms.It is worth getting there before 10am or after 2pm, so you can appreciate the way the sun colours the stone into the pinkish tones. Via Tuk Tuk it is an hour ride. It is not very comfortable but very scenic through the village. There are the big buses doing the trip very frequently if yiu want to join 40 or so people or you can hire a taxi for a little more.

Morning visit was magical with sunlight on pink sandstone. This is about 1/2 hour from the city and takes you through some interesting countryside. We took an a/c car with a private driver and stopped whenever we saw something that caught our attention. Tip: Don't go in a tuk tuk!!! The roads are difficult and you will bounce uncomfortably, be hot, and covered in dust. I am very glad I decided to do this first part of the day (before 8 am) to keep the crowds down and my interest up. It is quite different than the other structures you have or will see. The intricate carvings are beautiful, yes it is smaller but pretty.
The Red Temple. Very nice, not so much tourists, the red sandstone is definitely worth a visit! Go early to avoid the tourists.
Awesome and Ancient. A beautiful Ancient Temple, Again not a massive amount to see but still lovely walking around the site. I was there and it was almost empty, fantastic
A gem!. Also known as the " Lady Temple" this small temple built with pink stone has some of the most beautiful and intricate carvings you will find in the Angkor Wat temple complex

Another favorite!. This temple is about 25 km from town. It is a smaller than the other temples. When I visited in December, there was no water surrounding the temple. I imagine it would be when it's the wet season. A large part of it, is sectioned off so you can't get closer to take photos. I recommend you arrive early as it's another popular spot for tour groups. The temple is beautifully carved in red sandstone with many intricate designs.

Small but beautiful temple, carved pink sandstone, an hour from Siem Reap. We took a tuktuk to Banteay Srei which took about an hour, the trip was wonderful, enjoying the Cambodian rural villages as we trundled past. The temple is very small and when we visited pretty empty, compared to some of the other Angkor temples, the carvings on the pink sandstone have been preserved amazingly for 1000 years. The visitor centre has lots of before & after photos of the restoration process.
MAgnificent Hindu Ancient Temple. Awesome place. Magnificient architecture work. Detailed carving. bring your camera and take some nice pictures

One of the BEST temples. This temple is small but it is so ornate and elaborate that it just takes your breath away. The temples are all raised up like they are on pedestals. The carvings are very well in tact because of the durability of pink and yellow limestones. The pink and yellow colors also really add to the glow of the whole scene.Located a little bit far from Angkor Wat, it's definitely worth the visit to this as well as the other temples nearby.

Delicate, pink hued carvings in lacy abundance. This was my favourite temple. The slightly harder pink sandstone was ideal for creating and preserving wonderful reliefs and carvings, many of which were the best we saw in Siem Reap. Great if you can beat the crowds. Very highly recommended.

A little gem. Banteay Srei is about 35km from Angkor Wat but well worth the trip - built in warm red sandstone with fabulous carvings and statues, it is small in comparison but just as impressive as its more famous cousin. Don't miss this little gem

another beautiful experience. this temple is a little further out geographically than the main temple area and we travelled there with a local taxi... which made it a very relaxed and enjoyable visit... the temple is quite different to the other temples in both design and architecture... but a must see if you get the chance
Temple a long way out . Travelled a long way to get there and found Banstead Srei probably the least interesting of all the places we visited in the Angkor area.
Beautiful. Smaller temple but well worth the visit. We went at lunchtime and although there were crowds, it was still worth going. Breathtaking!

Another great temple . This was another temple we visited with a tour group. I actually don't know how I could have seen all the temples without a local driver and guide. That is something I would recommend since it is not Very expensive and you can have someone take you here without getting lost.

Amazing temple to visit early in the morning. Go as early as possible in the morning to visit this temple. He is so beautiful and so many people come to this temple! You need more than 1 hour, there is much to see in this temple

Quite far from the rest of the temples but worth it. This temple is different compare to the others that you see in Siem Reap/ Cambodia. It's in the middle of nowhere, quite far but taking a tuktuk ride is worth taking because of the sceneries along the way. And, Banteay Srei is kind of special compare to the others as it is pink though it's quite small, we had a great time. Have a look, especially for those temple lovers
Fantastic carvings. Temple is bit far but really worth it. The carvings are the finest you can find of all the temples combined. Small temple but really beautiful.

My favourite. This temple is absolutely amazing!!!! Unfortunately is very crowded, even though it's very far from all the other temple so. If you're spending more than one day in Angkor, make sure you include it in tour list of places to visit!!! You definitely won't regret it
The beautiful Lady Temple!. Small compared to some temples but a must see...beautiful reliefs and definitely one of my favourites!

Nice but too far away. I liked carvings but I read the real ones are in the museum (didnt go there). Its true they are one of the best but is more than 45 minutes ride and more expensive than regular circuits. I wouldnt go again.

Words cant describe the beauty.. Its not possible to describe the beauty of the temple. This is the only temple with such detailed carvings and pink stone. Its simply beautiful and a must do while you are in Siem Reap.Temple is surrounded by a beautiful nature preserve. They have a trail [which is part of the exit of the temple] that will take you through it. Its nice...not great. Nice walk while drinking some palm juice [$0.5 a cup]The temple and surroundings shouldn't take you more than 2hrs. The ride to the temple from Siem Reap is about 1.5hrs on a tuk tuk. You dont need a guide for this temple as its pretty small and easy to navigate. No climbing involved.

My favorite temple!. Worth the visit and half hour travel from Angkor Wat. If you book for what they call "big/grand circuit tour," Banteay Srei is either the first or last stop of the tour. It's my favorite (even than Angkor Wat!) because of the intricate carving details and design as well as its color (it's made from pink sandstone so it glows nicely under the sun!).

Breathtaking!. Although the main focus for all visitors is Angkor Wat, this temple is a jewel all by itself. With it's beautifully carved walls and buildings, it gives off a sense of supreme beauty and peace. If time permits, don't miss this amazing temple.
Beautiful. Still popular but much less crowded than Angkor Wat when we visited. The architecture here is more sandy in colour. A nice walk in through the trees

Pink 'Ladies' Temple. This is one of the smaller ones but worth the trip out to it. (We visited the landmine museum on the way back). Banteay Srei has a pinkish tinge to its stone and has the most intricate carvings.

Ladies' Temple. We had booked a half day tour, which started at the silk farm, and then finished at Banteay Srei. The temple is quite small compared to other temples we have visited around Siem Reap. It took about half an hour to reach it by car. Our guide explained about the construction and the history of the temple, which was subsequently dedicated to women. Some of the carvings were well preserved.

Intimate and delicate temple. A wee bit out of the way but well worth the visit. This was probably my favourite of the temples. Beautiful delicate carvings in a small scale area. It can get very hot walking between the stone walls which seem to radiate heat. We hired a Tuk Tuk which is very inexpensive and stopped to see other places on the way back to Siem Reap. I think it is a must see

Pretty pink temple. A little further away from Siem Reap but worth it. A very small Hindu temple which is pink in colour and has very intricate and elaborate carvings.We visited at 7.30am and were pretty much the only people there. The low sun also made the pink colour stand out even more.There's also a small "nature trail" with some nice views over the countryside.
Exquisite. This temple is smaller then the others we visited , but it is so intricate. We enjoyed the wonderful carving of Apsara dancing.

Banteay Srei. After breakfast leave the hotel at about 8 am. drive about 40km toward Banteay Srei, the 'temple of the woman' which was built in the 10th century, dedicate to Hindu Gods Siva, Vishu and Bramma. This temple is the only one pink sandstone structure of the fine sculptures. Need to get close to see the details. Return from this temple stop at local shop to see people cook sugar palm and hand-made crafts
35 kilometers from anghor wat but worth the trip. Beautiful small rose colored temple in the jungle. Try to arrive early to avoid hoards of tourists. Make it first destination of the day.
A gem of a temple. Different from the Royal temples, this small sanctuary with its intricate wall carvings is worth the longish drive out of Siemens Reap.
Divine. Outside the archeological zone and you have to buy an entry. Worth it. Very well organized visitor centre. The temple itself is beautiful and fascinating. Go early to avoid the heat
Oldest of the temples in this area. This is a small site so there is not a lot of walking like Angkor Wat, a lot of details preserved relatively nicely.

Lovely lady temple . This temple stands out from the rest due to the unique pink sandstone that was used for the walls. The lady temple as the name suggests is really a gorgeous, exquisite and well maintained temple that oozes with feminine charm and grace. Highly recommended place to visit
Yes, its awesome but crowded.. The fine detail of carved sandstone is the best in Angkor, but it's also over crowded with tourists that arrive by the bus load. Get there early.
pink temple. love color temple, love the way to temple, love the history, love the natural, love architecture. highly recommend
Beautiful intricate carvings. The carvings at Banteay Srei are my absolute favorite. They are so intricate and clear and quite breathtaking. It's far to get to, but definitely worth the trip.
EXO Tours. We hired EXO Tours to provide us with a large air conditioned car, driver and very knowledgeable tour guide for five days. EXO is great. My wife and I highly recommend them.

A bit further out but worth the time and effort. We were initially reluctant to travel the distance to visit another temple, but this one did not disappoint. We went in the late afternoon for sunset and loved the afternoon warm light for photography.

Best preserved temple but may not be worth the ride. The best preserved temple in the area is in Banteay Srei. However, it is considerably smaller and we were done in under an 40 minutes. Unless you're really excited about admiring the different architecture among hordes of tourists who have learned to arrive as early as you, it might not be your cup of tea.
Wonderful!!!. We were recommended by our tour guide to visit this great temple. The art carving on the stone wall told us details about the great history of the living style and others at that time.

Pink sandstone with amazing carvings, the Jewel of Kmer Art!. Banteay Srei. While some of the temples are impressive because of their sheer size, Banteay Srei stands alone in the quality of its construction and decoration. Its pink sandstone wall are decorated with what some consider to be the best carving of all and in an amazing state of preservation. Built in 967 and dedicated to Brahma it is located twenty five kilometers North of Angkor Wat.Another great temple well worthy of the travel to get there and time needed to explore. Unique in its own respect as well, this temple is built from more volcanic like rock and features bass reliefs and carvings to gain your imagination. It is a fairly large structure and affords many photo opportunities. Overall, one of the top 5 temples of the complex, don't miss it!
Beautiful. The first one we visited, magnificent as are all of them! Grand, peaceful, beautifully preserved carving amongst some in ruins. Ancient and impressive!

Similarities of culture . Happy to witness the similarities of the deities and the pattern of construction. Also the culture and the way of living is similar. Happy that we visited the place and thoroughly enjoyed.

fascinating carvings. This temple is smaller compared to the other temples and is located a bit distant from the other temples. But it's worth the visit since this temple still has a lot of carvings well preserved.

Ladies temple (pink sandstone). We travelled as a group of four. We paid usd$20 each for several temple visits at the area and this is one of them (Ta Phrom, Ang Kor Wat & Banteay Srei). Intricate carvings on the red hue sandstone. It is amazing that the carvings are so well preserved despite its age - it is even older than ang kor wat. It is worth the visit!
Banteay seri. One of my favorite smaller locations. It just keeps going, the entire ruins of this area are so amazing.

provide good service and happy with friendly guide during trip in Cambodia. I'm had been working in tourism company around 15 years ago and specialist inbound tour and can offer you a best competitive rate and good service for your trip in Cambodia

My favourite temple!. This temple is worth going out of your way to see. It's smaller than most of the other temples in the Angkor area so it may not seem as impressive at first. However, the lovely pink hue of the stone and the well preserved reliefs give this temple a grandeur all of its own. Also, if you are a nature lover, do the boat ride! There is an insight into the ecology of the area and a serenity not found in most tourist attractions. The boats are sort of like a cross between a row boat and a canoe and there is a single paddler so it takes about 20 min. Relax and enjoy!
Fascinating temples different stories to tell. I did not get temples out. The differences with temples are intriguing and immersing yourself in the stories is fascinating.

Faest temple but nice place. Nice temple and there're many tourist as well. A little hot for me but it a nice place to see with your friend or family.it a bit far 40km i think but you should see this place

Beautiful- should be higher on the list! . We visited here first on our 2 days of exploring Angkor Wat and it was a fantastic first stop. It takes a while to get there (about 45 minutes tuk tuk) but the journey is worth it. It's lovely to see the scenery and and small villages on the way.We arrived at about 8.30- it wasn't too busy at that time. There's so much to see (as well as the fantastic carvings). A nature walk, lake, fields etc. You really must make the journey out there!

Ride your bike here!. My boyfriend and I rented bikes on our second day in Siem Reap and we managed to visit so many temples. This was one of my favourites and I really like the red hue of the structures.
Worth the drive!. Gorgeous temple, a bit out of the way, but more than worth the drive. Intricate carvings and beautiful color- do not miss!

Beautiful pink stone "lady temple". Beautiful smaller and unique temple. A little further out so much fewer people.
Do stop at the pavilion/cafe area to the left on the way OUT as there is a really well done display area that outlines the temple re-discovery / reconstruction timeline as well as the fight to preserve these iconic treasures from treasure hunters throughout history.

Beautiful carvings. This temple is about an hour drive outside of Siem Reap. We stopped at a palm sugar stand, rice patties, & the land mine museum after our visit.
The carvings at this temple are beautiful. The temple is made of pink sandstone.
If you have 2 days in the area- this is worth the trip.

Go here as a warm up for Angkor Wat. Slightly further out from Siam Reap, the journey was worth it and is a good introduction to the temples. You can climb over the tumbled down bricks as if you are a true explorers. There are lots of Naga snake heads along the entry points and their significance becomes clearer as you go to the museums etc in other place in Cambodia.

A small temple beautifully located in the jungle on a small "island".. One of the most beautiful and popular temples in the area. Gorgeously to visit early in the morning before crowds of people. Try to be there between 6-9 am or after 4 pm.

Great Citadel. Its one of the smaller ones but it is just as interesting. There are far fewer people than some of the bigger ones meaning that you can end up have parts of it to yourself. Definitely worth a visit.

First Temple I Visited.... Located about 37 kms. away from city center, this was the first temple I visited during my tour on 2.20.2016. Per the advice of my tuktuk driver, we started here first, with the Angkor Wat as the last one for the sunset views.This attraction is small, easy to visit and navigate. Bathrooms are located near the entrance which can be used before starting your visit.Features: Beautiful, intricate carvings, red sand stones/materials used instead of limestones, constructed by a religious person instead of a king, dedicated to women. There is a trail to the lake for those inclined to see it.Tips: If you have limited time such as just a day, skip this attraction due to distance involved. Focus on attractions near Angkor Wat.

Worth the drive!. This is the Citadel of Women...well whichever ways, I quite liked the layout of the place. It was different form the other Angkor Wat temples that we had seen. Its also quite nicely restored. Do take out the time to visit this one.

Beautiful minature temple. It takes about 30 minutes from Siem Reap to reach this temple. Banteay Srey is a 10th-century temple dedicated to the Hindu God ShivaBanteay Srei is a minature temple and built mostly of red sandstone upon which there are elaborate decorative wall carvings. The beauty of this temple is the fact that it is beautifully preserved and very different to the other temples one will visit.You will get great photos with reflections on the ponds.

Small but one of my favorites!. Although this temple was small it made up for it in quality! We found the carvings at this temple much more detailed than the other temples and in better condition. Due to its smaller size this temple was also the most crowded which wasn't very fun during Chinese New Year. It was also sad to see a lot of the temple roped off but once you see how some of the Asia tourists completely disregard the signs and ropes so that they can get 15 selfies of them with a monkey statue you realize that if not protected this places would be destroyed. Make sure that this temple is on your list!

Different from the rest. This beutifully preserved temple is worth the journey. The carvings are stunning and so detailed, it's wonderful to see them. The temple is also set in beautiful grounds so make sure you have a proper wander around.

Review of Banteay Srei. This is a small temple; in fact, there are quite a few small temples in the compound. The temple is made out of red sand stone with intricate relief works depicting stories from Hindu scriptures. The work is so delicate, it is said that those could only have been made by the hands of women.This is about 40 km from Angkor Wat and well worth a visit.
Beautiful cavings. You cannot fail to be totally amazed at the magnificent craftsmanship, created hundreds of years ago, awesome.

Banteay Srei - Citadel of Women. A beautiful miniaturized, enchanting 10th century temple complex dedicated to the Hindu God Shiva. A unique series of temples built of red sandstone. The sandstone surface enabled the Khmer craftsmen to fashion magnificent intricate detailed carvings on the walls, lintels and pediments of the temple structure. Many carvings are 3 dimensional. It is not a big temple area to explore and there are no awkward stairs to climb. It is a very popular site with tourists. Visually stunning and breathtaking. Enjoy!
Small but Very Interesting. We enjoyed this small temple - Citadel of Women - and all the carvings of monkeys and elephants. Dedicated to Shiva.
Cool, different from other temples. We enjoyed this temple because it was very different from the other temples we went to. It was less crowded, and it was very well taken care of.

Beautiful, but quite small. The temple itself is quite small and is in a half-ruined state but the attraction here is the intricacy of the stone carvings. The craftsmanship is superb, and over 1000 years old. It's a little bit out of the way and doesn't take long to go round but well worth seeing. We combined it with other remote sites on a day car trip. It's not too far from Kbal Spean (although you need to be in the rainy season to make a good visit here) and works well with Beng Mealea, albeit about an hours' drive.
Temple of woman. The reason why it is called so is not because it has figures of women but the sculptures are good and not destroyed all together.
Highlight of Siem Reap. Wow, this place is an absolute must. Started our Angkor Wat visit with this, and was let down to a certain point with Angkor Wat. Amazing ruin...

Unmatched Detail at the "Lady Temple". My guide said this is called the "Lady Temple" because of the delicate details that you can see on most of the buildings; it also has a pinkish hue. The detailed carvings are still deep and distinct because the stone used is more durable than the softer stone elsewhere in Angkor Wat where many details have worn away or dulled. The beautiful carvings are visible from a distance as well as up close in many of the passageways. It takes a little time to drive to, but it's uniqueness makes it well worth the trip.

My favourite temple by far!. It's so intricate, lots of amazing reliefs and sanscript. More rundown than others but the finer details make up for it. And the colour is stunning. Out if the way but worth the trip. If you want to make a day of it the ACCB and land mine museum are out this way and worth a look.

Pink Temple Glorious. Slightly different to the other temples in Angkor, this temple is slightly off the beaten track but well worth it. The pink stone makes it a very beautiful temple. Make sure to go with a guide who can point out all the great vantage points.
Must see.. This temple is further away but any Tuk Tuk driver will take you there for an extra couple of dollars. The details of this temple are some of the best.
Small but worth the visit. Compared to the main Angkor temples, Banteay Srei is small. It's a 40 minute tuk tuk ride north of the main complex but well worth the visit and not as busy.

My favorite Temple in Siem Reap. If you make the effort the get here before 7am you will be rewarded with a small temple site surrounded by lush forests and water and very few other tourists. It is special because it is the only one made of red sandstone and it has such an intimate feel that you linger here for a lot longer than any of the other temples that make up the whole Siem Reap temple complexs. This was my favorite tranquil spot away from the hoards.

A Hidden Jewel. Wow! This out of the way temple really is a hidden jewel! The tuk-tuk ride is wonderful as you travel through the Cambodian village & countryside. The pink stone and the well preserved sculptures of this 10th century temple make it unique among the temples of Angkor. If one could go there first, I think it would be worth it. We did Angkor Wat, Bayon, Ta Prohm and straight out to Banteay Srei, but I wish we could have seen it in the early morning light. A tranquil place, and you can get a nice coffee right there. I wish all the sites were like this one! Worth the $20 even if you don't go to any other temples.
Pretty in Pink. Technically "red" sandstone, this lovely pink temple is well worth the visit. Different in scale and size than some of the larger temples, it's well worth time spent.

The place to start exploring!. One of the absolutely earliest temples in the area. It is also one of the most intricately decorated with amazing stone carvings. Unfortunately a lot of the finer pieces have been removed/stolen over the last few decades but it is still the place to start exploring this wonderful area. Banteay Srei predates Angkor wat with roughly 400 years and Bayon Thom with another 100 clearly showing how master craftsmanship degraded into megalomania over 500 years coinciding with the fall of the Khmer Empire.

Known as the "Ladies Temple"; pink and delicate. Banteay Srei feels very different from the other temples in Angkor Wat. It is located a bit further away from the main complex and takes quite a drive to get there. We liked the beautiful reliefs of goddesses, many of them I think are more intricate than the ones we saw at other temples (or maybe it's just that we get to stand closer to the reliefs as it's a more intimate temple). Recommend going by car instead of tuk tuk.

Known as Lady temple. This was our last day looking around temples and selected this one purely from recommendation. It's quite a distance from Siem Reap, in a Tuk Tuk around an hour!Like Angkor Wat it isn't as crowded and busy and no welcoming sellers vying for your attention.All in all I'm glad we visited Banteay Srei, we also took in the Landmines Museum on our way back as well as Ta Prohm temple.
Exquisite carving.. A lovely small temple built of pink sandstone with exquisite carving. It pre-dates Angkor by 100 or so years.
Very beautiful temple. This is quite a small temple but very beautiful as it has a lot of red sandstone and very fine carving. Do see it if you get the chance.

A great trek out and quite different from the other temples, but best to see the real Cambodia on the way. I loved all the temples and this certainly had some plus points. It was included in the same Temple pass we purchased on the way to Angkor Wat. This has been more commercialised which had the benefit of some more information boards detailing the history and this temple being older than some of the others is different in style. It has cafes and lovely countryside and a boat trip you can take too.It has had a couple of renovation attempts during the last century and has been roped off which helps in preserving, but also allows you to take pictures without other tourists. Make sure you visit Banteay Samre on the way. There was hardly any one there for us unlike Banteay Srei!

Outstanding Artisanship. Banteay Srei, a 10th Century Cambodian Temple dedicated to Lord Shiva. The smallest major temple in the Angkor region, lacked in size in comparison with the other temples, but it made up in its outstanding artisanship. Its statues, bas relief and lintels are amongst the finest in all Angkor temples. It is also the only Angkor temple built out of rose-colored sandstone, which aside from being more beautiful is also more lasting than the gray stones used in most temples. Finely carved on the pediments of temple are scenes from famous Hindu mythologies such as Ramayana and Mahabharata. Look carefully at the combat between Vāli and Sugriva on the scuptures...Sculptures of Devatas filled the columns of the temples.

Worth the ample drive!. This somewhat smaller complex in the Angkor area has distinctive stone work and bas relief not found at the other temples. You will enjoy your visit to a temple somewhat less traveled than the other temples in the complex.

Beautiful grounds. The grounds are magnificent and the water lilies alone are worth seeing and photographing in the beautiful ponds surrounding the temple and I think these formed a moat in old times. The temple itself has many fine lintels and intricate stone carvings.

Unreal History.. In lay and terms a cemetery for a king and his family. Stunning on appearance. But then you learn of the history. Used by the Cambodian Army during the conflict, raising UN flags from the towers whilst using it as a store for weapons and a main army camp housing 1000's of fighters on the outside. This place was heavily mined during the conflict and to this day warning signs and razor wire prevent entry into an area designed to kill. The local school also used as a camp. The locals have very little still their country treats them poorly whilst some through corruption prosper. A beautiful country with a very troubled past. However this really is a visit not to be missed.

Beautiful temple, quite far away, crowded. It was worth driving well out of the way to see this temple, which is unique (pink-ish stone, beautiful details). Unfortunately, they have created quite a tourist park out here, with tons of stalls selling crappy stuff and little restaurants. There are loads of tour buses and the temple itself is too crowded. Still, there is a nice visitor's center with good info and a decent restaurant attached. In the end, I would suggest making the trip to see this special temple.

Pretty in pink. Located north of the complex, you will need to take a tuk tuk or car. Less busy than the other parts of the complex and one of the most beautiful. Detailed carvings in pink sandstone. If you are only going to pick a few places to visit, consider adding this to the list - helps break up all the temples so you don't get templed out.

A beautiful tiny temple -- worth the drive. Don't miss out in this beautiful little gem -- where you will delight in its petite splendor and be thankful every minute that you're finally away from the crazy droves that swarm Angkor Wat and Bayon.
extraordinary places. activity is full of wonders. its a captavating moment. you could not imagine how was it done. so surprising. how do they do not
Well worth the drive - so pretty. Such a delicate, intricate, colourful temple. Able to take some brilliant photos. Never very crowded either. Highly recommended.

second visit to banteay srei in 2 years it is an amazing temple. this is one of the best temples to visit it is out the way a bit but get there before 8am to beat the crowds and get the best photos of an uncrowded temple

Beautiful temple - a little out of the way!. This Temple is beautiful, the stone colour is different from the other temples. The carvings are amazingly intricate. The temple is smaller than most but it is very beautiful. It is a bit of a drive - almost 30 minutes off the usual circuit but worth it!!!
Not just another Temple. The architecture and the sculptures captured at this temple are incredible...although they are not a patch on Angkor Watt they still give an understanding of the people.

The City of Women. This temple is one of my fave temple. it is located at the east of Siem Reap. It is also well known as Lady Temple. Like no other Siem Reap temple, most of the building still exist and you can clearly see the Temple relief. Thus you can also find the Apsara there and paddies view at the outer gate. At this location you can also find the information of world monument include the old one of "Borobudur" Indonesia.To reach this location, you can use bus, private rent car or Tuk Tuk. For best accommodation and low fares tuktuk driver you can try angkorshafie.com << hi is one of the best tuk tuk driver in Siem Reap

Our Favorite Temple. The temple is outside of the cluster near Siem Reap, but it is worth the trip.The level of carving is incredible and well preserved. Get a tour guide to explain the different buildings and carvings.Go in the late afternoon for the best light for photos.It is also one of the least crowded temples.

Different but so far away!. This temple is built earlier than most of the others in the Angkor Wat area. The carvings and symbols are different and I did find them more beautiful than many of the others I've seen on the other temples. It is quite a small temple and the drive there on a motorbike from Siem Reap is about an hour. The roads are alright. The surrounding area is nice with boating tours and a botanical garden. The prices in the food and souvenir stalls are a lot more expensive though.

Beautiful temples attract crowds... . There's no denying why so many people show up at this place. Tons of beautiful, intricate carvings and a very unique stone color when compared to the rest. It's a must see when in Siem Reap but don't expect it to be a spiritual experience... Instead you'll find selfie sticks, glamour shots, tons of gifts shops and tour groups in abundance. Try not to forget it's a temple instead of an amusement park and you'll enjoy the place.
Beautiful Temple. We visited this temple on our last day of a three day temple pass. Temple was beautiful and in the middle of nature. We visited also the land mine museum on the same trip.

Awesome.. This was my favorite temple out of the whole angkor complex. It is relatively small and quiet however the carvings have lasted the test of time excellently. The interpretation centre next to it also has some fantastic information on the construction of the temple and the materials used which for some reason the angkor museum and other temples lack. Its a bit of a drive but definitely well worth it.

Relaxing . The journey is a treat in itself as you see lots of senary and then when you get there lots of viewing spots to see workers in field. Well signposted and good place to eat. Temple really peaceful.

Highly developed for tourists, notable intricate carvings. The ladies temple makes for a nice visit, with built up infrastructure for tour busses and many visitors. Try to go early, as there is scant shelter from the sun and even less protection from throngs of tourists. The pinkish sandstone is intricately and extensively carved, making this a worthwhile visit. Too bad it's impossible to visit every temple at first light. The way the private concessionaire prices tickets, that's just impossible and not cost-effective at Angkor temples, a testament to the power of raw, unbridled capitalism in this corrupt military dictatorship.

Worth a Visit!. Its a 45 min tuk tuk ride from siem reap, but its worth every bit because of the most beautiful and intricate stone carvings.The ride to Bantey Srei will give you a great perspective of village life. Very enjoyable. Make sure to buy the Palm sugar on your way back!!! Its delicious with coffee

Beautiful carvings. Approximately 30km from Siem Reap but certainly worth the visit. Although rather small when compared to the other temples it is certainly the most ornate of them. Temple is dedicated to the god Shiva. Can get crowded so time your visit or hold back so that you can enjoy its beauty.

Don't miss this temple!. By the time we got to Banteay Srei, we had already been to four other temples that day. So, you can imagine our stamina level. However, from the entrance on, we could tell why people are enchanted by this temple. It is lovely, small and manageable. Carvings are exquisite and still very evident. It is a distance from other temples but well worth including.

Less crowd in the morning. I love this place, with the pink sandstones and many walls still in good condition. We stayed for 2 hours, had dinner on the roadside on the way back, buy some palm sugar as a souvenir, and visited Banteay Kdei before lunch and Ta Phrom in the afternoon.
Beautiful. It is a must see temple. Completely different then the other temples. it is small, during my visit it was crowded.
Part of our day visit. We went here with a guide this day. Well worth going with someone who can tell you the history of the temple.

Small temple but beautiful. While this was the smallest of the temples we visited, it was probably my favorite. Because it was smaller and with pinkish stone, it had a charm and beauty that the others lacked.

Beautiful temple with a difference. Remarkable colour of the sandstone, intricate carvings, relatively small, well preserved and restored temple. It is a little far from the popular Angkor temples so it is less crowded making for happier viewing.

It's nice to see if you have the time. The delicate carvings of Banteay Srei were impressive but it was also overrun by large tour groups (as we had read) arriving via bus. Due to the large crowds it was not as easy to walk around and enjoy the details. We felt we would be stampeded by a tour group... It is a good 45 minute drive via tuk tuk from the center of Siem Reap so if you have the time, check it out. The drive itself was nice and we all enjoyed the scenery.

Smaller than other temples but beautiful.. Very atmospheric, smaller and with the some of the more well preserved carvings of Hindu stories. Further away than some of the other temples, about a 45 minute TUC TUC drive away from Siem Reap, but most worthwhile.

Beautiful temple. Beautiful temple. A little further out so you need a driver to take you. Worth the visit as the carvings are so beautiful and well preserved. The colour of the stone is also pretty special. The temple is comparatively small so easy to get around. Photograph don't really do it justice. Worth a visit if you have time.

One of the oldest temples in very good condition. Visited this near the end of the day and while it is one of the oldest temples, the carvings and statues are in very good condition. The colors of the rock come alive with the setting sun. Far less crowded, making it a nice experience.

Different and Worth It. This temple is a personal favorite. It was built by women, it is a lighter sandstone and the carvings are so intricate. It is less over run by tourists. It is out near the landmine museum and worth the drive. Understanding the complex relationship of landmines and the war and who set them and who is trying to remedy the problem is told at this very unusual and telling museum.

the most beautiful temple in the area. Located 20kms from Angkar Wat, the ride with the tuc-tuc itself is very relaxing and funny at the same time. Once you get there the temple has the most impressive sandstone carvings you can see in the area. We also visited late afternoon, when the sunlight was at its best and few people around. Wonderful experience
One of the best for sure !. Stunning stunning stunning! Take your time to enjoy the scenery! One downside - tonnes of tourists, perhaps get there earlier to avoid large groups of tourists.

The beauty is in the detail. We really enjoyed our visit to Banteay Srei, also known as the Lady Temple. Located a 20min drive from Angkor Wat, this temple has some of the most spectacular carving detail that we saw in our 2 day tour with the excellent Siem Reap Tour Guide Services. A smaller temple that feels more intimate than the others. Don't miss this if you are in Siem Reap!

Beautiful!. This is a beautiful temple. But lots of tourists who are more focus on getting the perfect picture for their facebook profile. So sometimes its frustrating as you have to wait on others to get their perfect shot before you get a chance to appreciate the beauty of this temple.Others have mentioned going before 10:30am. I do agree. I got there before 10:30 and had a beautiful view of the temple. After that time the position of the sun do put some of the depictions in yhe shade n harder to seeNote to tourists: if you are there only for a photo op note there are people there who are actually there to see the temple!
Incredible sandstone carvings. Better than angkor wat in my opinion. The carvings here are stupendous. It's a small site but unmissable.

Love this place.. While this temple may not be as vast or imposing as most of the other Temples, it was one of my favourites. Completely beautiful, plant to see & photograph. Pretty easy to navigate, as it's all pretty much on ground level.

Worth the Extra Distance. I'm glad that I went here even though I had to pay more for the travel.I think that this temple site is the most beautiful because of the type of some that was used to build it. You can also go to the landmine museum which is very close by.
Womens temple. Located 20kms from Angkar Wat, this temple has the most impressive cravings supposedly done by women. The only down side is the children trying to sell you postcards etc.

The Most beautiful temple. I have not visited all temple in Angkor complex, but from few of them, Banteay Srei is the most beautiful of them all. The temple is located 30 km from Siem reap. A tuk-tuk drive will take about 30 minutes. The temple is small in comparison to others, but what it lacks in size, it make up in details. The carving on red sandstone is world class, very well preserved and exquisite. I would highly recommend to visit this temple, We just got 1 day pass and manage to squeeze this is.
Gorgeous. Don't miss this one! Be sure to walk all the way around to the reclining Buddha built as bas relief into the rear wall.

Beautiful and Unique . The intricacy of the carvings on this temple is stunning. It is built from a different sandstone than the other temples and so stands out in its pink-orange hues. You get a sense of how the average Khmer person is anywhere up to 50% smaller than the average westerner, and the women more so, because all entrances to this temple are roughly four feet in height. Definitely a must on the Angkor circuit. None of these major temples should be missed, and this one is no exception. All are amazing feats of architecture and quite awe inspiring. If you are visiting in the wet season you might want to space out your temple visits over a few days as it is easy to become tired after seeing two, and you risk not experiencing them to their fullest. Hire a guide for the best experience, the Khmer guides are highly informative and exceptionally friendly, and will show you small interesting intricate elements of the temples you might otherwise miss.
lovely. The sculptures in this temple is so awesome. Really makes you question if such were made by human hands. Just so beautiful.

Beautiful. The ladies temple is much smaller than the other main complexes but it is a beautiful, and if you go in the afternoon when there are less visitors, peaceful ruin. The depth and detail of the carvings is quite incredible.
Amazing. Outstanding carvings that. Are more intricate and delicate than those in the other temples in the area. Well worth the time.

Beautiful temple a bit further afield, worth the trip. Banteay Srei was a total gem. After spending the first few days exploring the closer temples we took a tuk tuk about 45 min to Banteay Srei (definitely recommend this vs a car- a bit longer but you take in the scenery, smells, etc so much better and very much adds to the experience). We got there right as they opened (7:30am) and missed all of the tour buses (9am or so)which made for a great experience. There were local musicians on our way out as well as some shot hiking (flat) trails and even small boats for hire to explore the local river which really added a great component to touring the temple. Would highly recommend, we headed to Pre Rup and Ta Phrom afterwards. Made for a good day.
Worth the drive. it is a smaller temple, but i enjoyed going and it was a really interesting drive to get a view at the local culture. Got to see a wedding, locals living like locals and much more.
Must see in Siem Reap. Highly recommended in SR.. Small temples compared with others, was very hot when we went there so didnt enjoy much. Better go late in the afternoons
The most beautiful one. Among all the temples the most beautiful one in my opinion.Full of fine details work .Dedicated to the god Siva

Amazing Temple. This was one of the oldest temples in Angkor Thom. Location can be travelled with Normal day pass for Angkor Wat. From Pub street, we have negotiated $10 Tuk Tuk return fare. We have combined Bantey Kdei and Shooting Range in this trip. You immediatly notice an organised parking space packed with buses and a real reception center, with bathrooms, ticket counters, souvenirs boots and some information on the site. This temple was my absolute favorite. The sandstone gives it a rich deep pink colour and the carving is much more intricate and detailed than all the other temples, including Angkor Wat.Many historians have asserted that this temple is the highest achievment of art from the Angkor period. There are amazing opportunities for photos here. Easiest temple to walk around with no major climbing and takes less than two hours to see. Not so many tourists at this one when we went in the late afternoon.

A trek out there but worth it. The smaller scale is good as you can build the mental picture of the complete palace more easily than some of the grander and well known temples. The carvings here though are amazing and considered the best. The carvers at this temple were women...thus the local name of Lady temple. Go early to miss the crowds - we were there at 7.30 am and the light was amazing.
Beautiful! Amazing! Fantastic!. Words can't really describe the experience of standing in the presence of these ancient temples. I felt humbled and honored.

Not To Be Missed . Not everyone makes this temple as its a little drive to get there 45-1hr but do not let that discourage you. For me it's the stone carvings were more impressive than any I saw in Angkor Wat. Considering that it's older than Angkor and in my opinion so much better preserved that is saying a lot. The carvings are different as these are deep carvings into to stone not bas relief carvings which are doing in Angkor.
Beautiful Carving Stone. It seem we like this temple the most comparing to other temple in this country. The beautiful carving stone on the wall make this temple amazing.

IS it worth visiting?. This is the only temple outside the main area that I visited. The structures and their intricate patterns are much better preserved there. It is a beauty really. It is about 38km or 45 mins ride away. The place is pretty big but the actual temple is small. So while it is beautiful and unique, whether it is worth the time spent visiting depends on your own judgement. It is not that far and is still quite popular with the tourists, it won't be a quiet time there.

Hot Pink. This was one of the warmest temple treks, though that might have had more to do with the weather. The path and tour are almost completely in full sun, so be prepared. The lovely stone looks especially nice in the sunlight.

The whole area is wonderful. Once you are in Siem Reap, try to explore as much as possible. Every temple has history, different characteristics, is just a wonderful experience to visit and see as much as you can. The place is just gorgeous. We spent 3 days visiting temples, Vietnam Awesome organised everything for us and was great.

Don't Miss. Loved this place, get there early before the heat of the day and the Chinese and Japanese tourists decend! A tranquil Temple can turn into Oxford circus if you time it wrong and get slammed by a couple of tour parties, they tend to arrive around mid-day so adjust your timings accordingly.

A lovely temple but a fair way out..... Only had two full days to tour the temples with our driver so quite selective about where we went. Banteay Srei was the first temple that we visited and although lovely was crowded with bus loads of Asian tourists. Upon reflection think that we didn't need to go that far...so many different temples closer to Siem Reap that you can easily spend two full days visiting.
Another great temple. Perhaps shaded by some of the bigger and better preserved temples, but had the definite advantage of being much quieter meaning we could explore much more peacefully
Lovely. Another great temple that is truly unique and very spiritual. Well worth including in your tour of the top temples in the Siem Reap area.
Explored!. Did the tour here and I cannot believe what my eyes have witnessed. History lives to tell us what happen in the past so keep exploring and learn from the ruins.

A thousand year old slice of history. Our tour group brought us to this site yesterday. It is a thousand year old Hindu temple with many of the walls, carvings and statues intact. It is truly an amazing site. There is no climbing which was a refreshing change from other temples but the walking is on uneven stone so be sure to wear good walking shoes. Bring along water, sunscreen ,a hat and your camera. Be ready for children to follow you in an attempt to sell you postcards and woven birds. If you are so inclined you might want to bring some American dollars.

Different and Unique Temple!. Banteay Srei is 37km away from the Angkor Complex, but the trip is well worth it. The scale is much smaller, but the detail of carvings in stone are exquisite. I was surprised to see many carvings from Hindu Epics on the walls.

this is an unbelievable site. This site is small and a bit further from town, but totally worth the (small) effort to see it. The detail and imagery is unbelievable to have survived with such clarity. This is not a grand, and dramatic site for scale. But special for detail and richness
Average. The journey time to reach this place makes it an average place to visit. The colours of the stones are different and the details are good. But it's lacking the wow factor.

Small but the most beautiful. This is the most beautiful temple I have ever visited. The decorations and carvings are amazing. I do suggest you to visit this small pink temple when you go to Siem Reap,

Nice but small. If you have seen the big area of the temples angkor wat, angkor thom and ta prohm in advance you get slightly disappointed when you see that banteay srei only contains one little building/ ruin. You drive at least one hour from siem reap to get there. At the other hand, the wonderful red colour, the detailed engravements and the spirit at this place is awesome.

The detail is unreal. The fine detail at this temple is amazing and hard to believe one has the patience to do , having said that what else did they have to to do? not like the modern area of stress and making a living...

Beautiful colour. This is a smaller temple site and the reddish colour is beautiful. We visited this in the morning and it wasn't too busy. The carvings are very detailed. At the entrance to the site where there are some shops, there is also detailed information about the area and all the different temples. Well worth having a read and looking at the timelines. It is definitely worth taking the time to see this place, as it is a bit different to some of the other temples such as Angkor Wat, though it takes a bit longer to get there.

A different type of temple in Siem Reap than the famous ones.. Known as the Lady Temple for its pinkish color this site is worth a trip out of Siem Reap. It is much smaller than Angkor Thom or Angkor Wat but it is unique. The monkeys guarding the doors are a fun sight and the entire temple has the same extraordinary carvings you'll find at the bigger temples. Worth the trip.
Delicate, intricate carvings. the carving in this temple was indeed very intricate and delicate, the complex is very pretty - and we had the local palm juice there!

Beautiful wat. This is a miniature Wat but has beautiful detailed and well preserved carvings. It has a lovely reddish colour and you can get good photos over the wall if you turn left out the back entrance. It is 35 ks north of the city so takes a while in a tuktuk but you pass fascinating stalls with palm sugar or mango leather or straw goods.
very beautiful. Very beautiful, colorful. not very big temple, but the sculpture is the best. it's better to visit in the morning

Beatiful Stone Carvings. A short, not as imposing, and smaller temple best seen before noon. The carvings are exquisite and more detailed than the any of the other temples. May not worth the trip if you don't have the time, but beautiful nonetheless.

Breathtaking. The carvings here are in the best shape of any temple we saw in 3 days in Siem Reap. It is about a 1 hr drive outside the city, but the ride is fantastic through many villages where you get to see the real Cambodia. This is MUST SEE!!!!

Banteay Srei. Lovely intricate stone carvings, using pink stone. This is by far the best examples of Stone carvings in the whole of Angkor. I was fascinated by the small detailed pictures carved out brilliantly from the Stone. So different from the other Temples. A real Must to visit
Beautiful!. This temple has so much detailed carvings and has lovely surroundings. I enjoyed this temple more than the Angkor Wat because there's lesser people and more sculptures.

Amazing. It is a bit away from the main temples, but it worth it. Its colour, the detailed carvings are amazing. We went a 2pm and we were alone, after 20 minutes, turists arrived, but for 20 minutes it was only our temple :)

Beautiful temple. This temple is worth visiting just for the ride out in the countryside to get here. From memory it took about 1 hr in tuk tuk to get here but it was so fascinating and interesting ride I could have gone further. It was nice to see daily life for the Cambodians and get outside of Siem Reap town. The temple itself was of course magical. It wasn't as pink as I thought it would be, but I think that is because we did not visit close to sunrise or sunset, but instead it was about 8-9am. Would definitely recommend a walk around the outside of the moat, for lovely mirror images of the temple in the water.

A miniature Angkor Wat. A delightful tuk-tuk ride from Siem Reap brings you to Banteay Srei. We found this a very interesting experience as it is not nearly as commercialised as Angkor Wat, but the preservation of the site and the intricate carvings are stunning.

Most Beautiful Temple in the Outer Loop. Banteay Srei is a beautiful temple dedicated to Shiva. Its made of pinkish/red sandstone. Its small in scale but its beauty comes from its incredibly preserved ornate carvings on the walls. If you have time to visit the outer loop temples, this is a must see temple!

The most beautiful stone carvings in the world. I haven't seen all the stone carvings in the world, but these are definitely the ones to beat. The level of detail and the sheer magnitude of intricate stone carvings are a marvel to behold.
Best Temple in Angkor Park. The carvings on the sandstone are exceptional, so much detail. The temple maybe in disrepair but there is so much quality on the stone.

Another unmissable visit. The Banteay Srei is a smaller temple devoted to the femine entities, it's super cute and features really unique architecture!!
Everything is pink! Really liked it
Combine a 2hour visit with another temple maybe Ta Prohm

Can you guess its origin?. The temple has a beautiful pinkish hue, yet nobody knows where the stones came from. It is amazing to discover such locations and travel through history. Check out the details and discover the beauty of this temple dedicated to Shiva - destruction goddess.

Citadel of the Women. This is one of the most peaceful and also intriguing temple sites in the Siem Reap area, and well worth the cab/tuk-tuk ride. The sculpture has an entirely different character to it and provoides a nice comparison to the sculpture seen in other Angkor-area temples. Would include this as a "must see" temple in your itinerary.
Wonderful. Crowded but well worth the trip. Visited the same day as going to Angkor Wat and Ta Prohm. This held its own. Different than the others and well worth the effort.

Worth the trip. Banteay Srei is further out but worth the trip. There is such delicate artwork which makes this temple unique. I also loved driving through the villages. We stopped at a few and even attended a local wedding. Make your trip there. It's what you came for.
Easy to get around, amazing. We loved this temple area: the avenue we walked along to arrive at the main temple, the detail, the angles, the wonder of it all

Magnificent!. Located a bit outside the main area, this might be one of the best temples in total. Built in a different type of stone and with deep, deep carvings in good condition gives this place a wonderful atmosphere. Possible to hire a tuk-tuk to go here but it will take some time. A car is better and even by car it is a 30-40 min drive from the main Angkor area. Some form of guide to explain the carvings are necessary to enjoy the place. A newly build visitors centre are there too.

A must see!. During our tour in Angkor Wat Area we added also the visit to Banteay Srei and this was one of the most credible temple we saw! the details here are incredible.. (better than Angkor Wat) the temple is incredibly maintained and you have statues and incisions everywhere.. lots of excellent shots for Photographers. Banteay is approx 1.5hrs far from Siem Reap so I would include this stop in case you are visiting Angkor Wat. The visit takes approx 1 - 1.5hrs.

A little gem - don't miss it!. Banteay Srei is approx. 30min car drive from Siem Reap, but it is really worth the time. The temple is quite small, but it has beautiful intricate carvings, created with incredible attention to detail. Its rich ornaments earned it a name of "Ladies' Temple". All the structural details are very well preserved.Plan your visit early on the day or later in the afternoon, and do not forget your camera - as this is probably the most photogenic of all the temples. Once you arrive, you walk past a very smartly developed "visitor centre" with facilities and shopping stalls, where you can peacefully choose your souvenirs. Unfortunately, that is not enough to stop young children running after you and peddling all sorts of things, which can be annoying. It is generally not advised to buy anything from them, as their parents are likely to push them into selling things instead of going to school.Still, you forget all the annoyances once you enter this little gem of a temple.

Our days visited Banteay Srei. It was at the top season our tour guid KAMSAN was so clever to guide us through the tour without getting involved with the crowd. He is so clever to help us to created good picture shot no crowd involved

MUST visit!. This is one of my favorite temple, although it's a bit out of the way (having said that, it's only about 30mins from the small circuit) it's a must visit in my point of view! The ground is pretty, the temple itself is quite small but the colour, the carving and everything about it is just so beautiful!
Temple hopping. It's nice to have pictures here along with the other temples around this. Just dont forget the main attractions!

Temple of Ladies. Banteay Srey, as we were told by our very good guide Mr Tang Sojet (find him if you can, he is VERY GOOD), was not the original name of the place. Banteay Srey means temple of the ladies.I find this temple the prettiest out of all the popular temples of Siem Reap, even Angkor Wat. The carvings of the temple were so intricate. The original color of the temple, which was pink and gold, can still be seen up to this date. Reserve your batteries and memory space as this is where you should take the most picture.

Spectacular Carvings. Banteay Srei is small in comparison with all the other area temples, but the carvings here far surpass anything you will find at those other sites. It further away from the main temple complex than some if the other major sites, but you must find time on your itinerary to visit Banteay Srei.
Beautiful . This temple is at least a 45min tuktuk trip from the main temples but is so worth it. One of the best temples!

Unbelievable carving on sandstone. A long drive that was well worth the time. The carvings and detail are outstanding considering that they were done 1000 years ago. Somewhat crowded but manageable. I am understanding the culture so much more. Buddhism came from Hinduism it appears.

Come here for the carvings. Older than the other temples by 200 years, but the carvings are better preserved because they used more durable stones. We stopped by the temple on the way back from the mountains Khulen, so it was not a big deal that it was a bit out of the way.

Phenomenal. Don't miss this temple, even if it's not in the "classic" package of the main temples. The carvings are simply unbelievable. It's hard to imagine how on earth they did this, and what devotion it must have taken. Beautiful and unforgettable. Get a good guide!

Pink Limestone Temple. This was one of the oldest temples in Angkor Thom. The stone was carved deeply to bring out the pink color of the stone, so the carvings are some of the best preserved. Definitely plan to see it.

beautiful temple worth seeing. We rented a car to see this temple due to how far away from town it was. Worth seeing but since it is so small try to see it first thing in the morning or around 1-2 when the crowds are less. Easiest temple to walk around with no major climbing and takes less than an hour to see. Also has a good restaurant to have lunch.

Visit early morning or end of the day to avoid crowds. This temple is so small that any visit that allows you to truly enjoy the beauty of the site is seriously hampered when you're in a herd of people moving along the designated path. Try to visit very early or very late in the day and pause to take in the beauty of the carvings and the delicacy (in stone!) of the site.

Not the largest, but one of the most delicate. Commonly known as "the Lady Temple", although not designed or built by one, this has the most beautiful carving. Difficult to go at the quiet time it deserves - try early. Some way out of siem Riep, but covered by the main temple ticket, and worth the journey. Negotiate your cab fare, and try to combine with other attractions on the way, e.g. Butterfly House.

Beautiful. The carvings at Banteay Srei were so intricate and detailed - very reminiscent of Indian temples. However, the large tour buses would make this destination unbearable. Luckily we managed to just beat them to it. This temple would certainly be enhanced with restrictions on visitor numbers.

Lovely art on every single of the temple. This is one the nicest temple in Siem Reap, Cambodia. We had few times visited here and keep exploring all the magnificent sites, natural and cultural here. We love them

Magical . The beautiful carvings in this temple are awe inspiring as is the pink sandstone which makes this temple stand out amongst the others. We went in the early afternoon and there was hardly anyone there which was fantastic as you could just meander your way through the place without falling over people. This temple is a little way out from the major temples but certainly worth the visit.
Interesting!. Visit the place during the sunset light for best view of the red sandstone carvings. Thrilling experience!

Smaller beautiful temple - find a spot to stay for a while. Don't miss this temple. And find the right time of the day to visit for pictures and to avoid the crowds. In the afternoon it was overcrowded. All of these temples should be visited a little more at ease if you can. Most people try to see all in 1 or 2 days. Take 3 or 4 days if you can - bring a book - you won't be disappointed.

Unique temple well worth visiting. Although not as well known and Angkor Wat and Angkor Thom this temple is well worth the visit. Beautifully preserved delicate carvings in unusual red sandstone structure.

Don't lose sleep if you do not see this during your visit. This is my third time back to Siem Reap and I was keen to see some new temples.So...after hiring a scooter and spending over 70-90 minutes driving out to see this temple, it really was not worth the time, money, petrol, parking ticket and being hassled by small children to buy postcards of other temples that were already seen during the previous days.There was a lot of commotion over something that was of no comparison to the other temples closer to Siem Reap.Again, if you don't have the time to see this in person. Google it!

Great photos. This temple is worth visiting - along with many others. It has great carvings and is fascinating to walk around. Not so many tourists at this one when we went. Make sure you have plenty of water as it can get hot!!!

Well preserved Intricate details. Well preserved, intricate details. Must see, even if it is farther from the hotels. Take lots of pictures. I recommend to start the day with this shrine to avoid the crowd.

out of the way temple but worth visiting. This temple is really out of the way, which makes it less filled with tourists, and allows you more privacy. The temple itself is beautiful and well worth the trip.

Beautiful Carving Telling the Ramayana Story. We are very glad to have a capable guide with us when we went to Banteay Srei Temple. David or Sovann was the guide we commissioned to take us around Angkor Temples for two days. He is very knowledgable on the temple. His detail explanation of the various structures within the complex either still visible or simply imagination gave us the deep understanding of the temple. He emphasized certain carving above each entrance and point out the figures in telling the story of the Ramayana added excitement to the whole sightseeing. All-in-all it is a beautiful temple worth spending 2-3 hours to enjoy the place.

Most beautiful of all the temples at Siem Reap. This temple was my absolute favorite. The sandstone gives it a rich deep pink colour and the carving is much more intricate and detailed than all the other temples, including Angkor Wat.
So many great sights!. An amazing place, The details are incredible. Plenty of pictures to be taken. Don't miss this place.

Amazing detail on carvings. A smallish temple but absolutely exquisite carvings. There are amazing opportunities for photos here as parts are roped off to protect them and you can simply study and photograph them to your hearts content.The kids enjoyed the monkey gods. Lots of different carvings to enjoy here. Best I have seen in all the temples baited in Siem Reap

Beautiful Temple and Boat Tour. Banteay Srei is definetely a good visit for many reasons:- It is located approx 40 Km from Siem Reap and you can enjoy a nice tour in TukTuk out of the city and the busy roads- The temple itself is very nice (apparently best in the morning)- We had a beautiful "boat tour" from the temple to the parking. We first did it for the kid but it ended being one of the best things we did in Cambodia. This is managed by the local village. affordable price, very nice people, beautiful scenary

One of the smaller and quite beautiful ancient temples. There are so many similar, but quite different, ancient Khmer temples in Siem Reap that it's difficult to keep them all straight in your mind after visiting several. This is one of the best preserved...or, at least, restored. Very photogenic.
I not you average temple. Not as busy or as big wat or thom and whilst not as overpowering as the big temples,,it is more beautiful.

Not so pink but beautiful intricate carvings. Some websites promote this as the pink temple due to the fact that it is largely made out of red sandstone and while the colour is different to other temples in Siem Reap it did not appear pink in early morning light. The beauty of this temple lies in the detail of the carvings. The skill of the 10th Century artisans is absolutely amazing.

Just beautiful. This Temple is one of the more distant travel wise within the Angkor Complex and is best visited first thing in the morning - it is a MUST SEE for the sheer beauty of the carvings and colour of the Temple itself
Must go. The beautiful temple with layers and layers of rooms halls. Must go and see the 4 budha faces building that covered every where on the top of the temple

An old temple which is a bit far from Siem Reap, but worth a visit.. This temple is located about 75 km from Siem Reap. It is a relatively small temple compared to others in the Angkor complex. Although out of the way, it is still worth a visit.
I LOVE. Small temple but very nice , don't miss this kind of temple just only 37kilo metter from Siem reap city .

Loved this "women's temple". The pink sandstone structure was truly beautiful. If you cannot visit all of the temples in the Siem Reap area, be sure to put this one in your top four. It really was not one of those "you've seen one, you've seen them all" experiences.

Crowded with visitors. Went here early morning. The location is quite far from the rest of Angkor Complex.
It's beautiful temple with a lot of cravings. The size is quite small compare to Angkor Wat or Bayon.
There was a lot of visitors & I didn't really get to enjoy the place because it was crowded and difficult to move around.

A gem of a temple. Given how far Bantey Srei is from Siem Reap, I expected to have it in ourselves, but the opposite was the case. Giant tour buses lined the parking lot, disgorging hundreds of visitors. And no wonder, because the temple is gorgeous, and on a much more human scale than the more famous Angkor Wat, for which it might have been a model. The bad reliefs are remarkably well preserved since they were deeply carved.
Red Sandstone Temple. What a beautiful temple with great frescoes. It is relatively small, but with delicate engravings. Do not miss!

Amazing Temple. A very old temple with a lot of character. You can visualise what it would have looked like in its day. Parts of it are stunning. You will need suitable footwear and temple clothing. Camera and water are a must .you will take lots of photos. There is a lot of attention to detail in this temple.Tip: angkorwat pass required, sunscreen, sunhat, water, camera, suitable footwear, knee length clothing, go early to avoid crowds of tourists , avoid heat of the day

Lovely Temple Tucked in the Countryside. Banteay Srei is quite small but it packs a lot of beauty into it's small walls. The carvings are exquisite and the temple color and location is beautiful. I also found the drive through the countryside to visit one of my favorite parts of our time in Siem Reap! Visit early to beat the tour buses. We came here immediately after sunrise at Angkor Wat (we had visited the temple the day before and were solely watching the sunrise) and had toured the entirety of Banteay Srei before the first bus pulled in. Stop by the land mine museum on the way back into town to learn more about Cambodia's more recent history as well.

Citadel of Women. Citadel of Women is what the name means. This place was said to be carved and made by a woman because the temples are low and the carvings are so intricate, only a hand as small as a woman can carve such beauty.

Find the time to do this. Its located 30kms away from Siem Reap (long tuk tuk ride). You can combine Banteay Srei with Kbal Spean which another 17kms away from Banteay Srei (total 50kms away from siem reap). Banteay Srei had the most amazing stone craving by far and its the oldest outta the lot (dates back to 10th century). It is simply magnificent. Kbal Spean is of carving on the river bed - there a beautiful 1.5km trek to get to this river bed. Totally worth your time.
