Amazing. Absolutely amazing place. Its not just all about Angkor Wat, there are many other beautiful temples to visit. Could not recommend this attraction anymore. Try not to see all the temples in one day- it's exhausting!
Beautiful color stone!! Worth visiting!!. Beautiful temple with a lot of cravings.. Recommend going in the morning as afternoon periods are very hot.

Temple away from Angkor Wat. We reached the temple around 9am and there were busses of tourist arriving. We didn't really get to enjoy the place because it was crowded and difficult to move around. It's hard to capture photos becuase you'll capture the tourist everywhere. Some of them were loud and made it hard to enjoy the beauty and serenity of the place. The carvings were magnificent and beautiful. It's hard to get the temple without a crowd because as one tour group leaves another will arrive. Food at the temple is expensive. Cost $6 for a simple meal twice the price in the city. Beware of kids tagging along pestering you to buy something from them. A stern no and they will leave you alone.

Day trip to Banteay Srei. We took a Turk yuk to see this templeDid not realise that it is 40km from Siem ReapNot a great idea to go via tuck tuckOverall the temple is a good visit but there are so many around Angkor that you could definitely give this one a miss if you are caught for timeOn the way back we stopped at the land mine mesuem

Hello Ladies (Temple). Incredibly intricate and financed through private channels, Banteay Srei is an amazing example of Cambodian craftsmanship. The pictures can not do this temple justice, its an absolute must see. If you're smart and you go with a private guide, the best of which is Kamsan Sreng (re: Best Angkor Guide - Day Tours), you'll see this temple the right way.

Neat compact structure away from main city. If you go with the flow of temples in and around Siem Reap, this is a temple that you should see but I would not drive all that far if you only have a day to spend in Siem Reap. It is relatively intact and not overgrown with Fig tree vines and so you can enjoy the beauty of the structure.

Colorful & Old Ruins of Lady Temple. Attractive and Stunning, definitely a must go. Lots of beautiful carvings in pink ,green and brown sandstone. It will be more interesting if you have some fair knowledge of Hindu Gods and other Vedic epics. Most parts of the temples are in ruins though, but the major aspects are still intact. Really hot if visiting in the afternoon, evening or early morning will be better for sight seeing. Make sure you carry water bottles and wet wipes.
Well worth a visit. This is a beautiful temple with lots of details and loads of amazing photos. The location was beautiful and we really enjoyed being there

Make the effort to see this beautiful temple. We went to Banteay Srei soon after the sunrise viewing at Angkor Wat, and the timing was perfect. The early morning light made the visit somewhat "atmospheric", and having the place nearly to ourselves allowed us to study the pink carvings at our leisure. The temple area is small, so a visit is easily managed as part of a one or two day temple tour. The short drive also gave us the opportunity to see a little of the Cambodian countryside. Don't miss it!

The pink temple or lady temple. This is a small temple in comparison to the others but it is beautiful. The carvings are amazing and you never get tired looking at them. The view of the temple from the edges is spectacular.

Small but the most stunning. This is so worth it, please don't pass this temple by and only go to Angkor Wat. The pink stone and carvings on this temple are absolutely beautiful. I think Banteay Srei and Ta Prohm are my favourites.

Beautiful earthy coloured temple. Small and with only the centre pieces remaining, this is only for the temple lovers and those that will make an effort to travel from Siam Reap centre to see the beautiful architecture, detailed reliefs and history that makes this so memorable. It is very small so don't expect grand buildings and structures. My boyfriend and I thought it was worth the visit.

Lovely stone carvings. It is quite crowded with tourist despite being quite a distance away from Ang Kor Wat. The reception hall is very modernized too probably because it is owned by a private personnel. The carvings and stone colour are indeed unique but the whole temple is actually very small.

Don't Miss It!. Banteay Srei is a big farther from the main Angkor sites, pehaps 25 km away, but it is very easy to get to on a nice paved road. The site itself is smaller than many others, but the carving and detailed work are absolutely exquisite. This was the favorite site for my wife of all the Angkor sites.

GO as EARLY in the morning as you can.. Beware the crowds!!This temple is relatively small and is placed a little further than the bulk of temples in Angkor. It takes maybe an extra 40 minutes to get there by tuctuc.You immediatly notice an organised parking space packed with buses and a real reception center, with bathrooms, ticket counters, souvenirs boots and some information on the site.The temple itself is beautiful, not too big, with very fine engravings and statues (only to discover that the originals are kept safely into a museum somewhere).However, it is extremely packed with organised tours; more than in other wider settings, people line up to take pictures and selfies at the best spots. I was personally overwhelmed by a crowd of at least 30 old ladies that took pictures on a one-by-one basis in front of each piece of interest... but there was no way to escape without falling into another group with a guide, a colourful umbrella and a loudspeaker.

The Lady Temple. It is called Lady Temple. It fits the name just right. It is small, refined and sophisticated. It is like a boutique. The colorful sandstone crafting is simply beautiful. The temple is kind of small so it makes it very handy to roam around, without worrying getting lost (like in Beng Mealea).

Beautiful. Very nice temple, lots of work still remains, You need a car to visit here. Tuktuk is not powerful enough for that long drive. Hotel can arrange a car. It costs about $60.00 US dollar. Totally worth it. There are two other temples on the way or 1000 lingas and the mountain in the same trip.
beautiful. this was my husbands favorite temple , its also known as the pink lady temple the carvings where so beautiful

The highest achievement of art. This temple is situated about 37 km from Siem Reap, but is a must. It was constructed in AD 967, is not very huge, but has intricate carvings. This is the most beautiful temple I have ever seen because of the carvings. Many historians have asserted that this temple is the highest achievment of art from the Angkor period.This temple is really a must and is well worth visiting.Highly recommended.Look for more reviews by MulleEllum.

worth the long drive. It took us more than an hour with a tuktuk from Siem Reap, but it was all worth it! The site had something very Western: nice parking lot, which is payable though; coffee bar; toilets; gift shop; many tourist busses.The temple itself is wonderfull! We visitied this after already two days of temples and we were very amazed by the high quality of the stone carvings.A very must do!!

Deep reliefs on pink limestone. Worth the travel!. I had not planned each temple to visit in Angkor Wat's massive complex, but I am so glad locals recommended this one. Set about 45 minutes from Siem Reap, Banteay Srei is renowned not for its size but for the sheer beauty of its deeply cut reliefs. Extremely beautiful and very unusual!

Very beautiful worth the trip. This temple is located about 30 Kms away from Siem Riep but is well worth the visit. One of the older temples and often called the women's temple it had deeper carvings than any of the others. This temple also remains completely Hindu. I decided to go by taxi and given the condition of the road it is a journey not to be done by a tut tut.
No 3 on my list of most impressive temples. Another amazing site. Unless you are an absolute archeological fanatic, with over 1000 temples to see in Angkor, do narrow it down as we did.

Far off the beaten track!!. The site is a 30 minute drive away from the city centre but worth the drive.The road to the site is not well tarred with potholes along the way.The site has been left in ruins but the carvings on the standing temple are very elaborate - we understand it to have been done by women in that time since the temple is known as the Queen's temple. We visited it in the afternoon when there was fewer tourists there and one can roam around the site more freely as well as take photos of it.

One of my favorites!. This was one of my favorites sites in the Angkor area. It is a women's temple and the color is different from all the others, pinkish. It is father than others but you can get there real fast with a driver. Notice that they charge a bit extra to come to this site because it is a bit father. Anyway, it the drivers follow a default price, so you don't need to worry.
Beautiful. Should be visited as early morning as possible to avoid crowd and be able to enjoy the beauty of the plave
Majestic. A bit of a way out, take a tuk tuk and your bum will know about it, but we'll worth the visit. The distance also means a lot of tourists skip this one, a very welcome relief.
One of the temples around the Angkor. This small temple cannot be missed when going around the temple grounds of the Angkor. This is one of the minor temples around.
Beautiful carvings . The pink stones just buy me over. Whole place is quite small but carvings on the building is worth the visit, much more details and deeper carvings.

One of the most impressive parts of Angkor. Banteay Srei for me is one of the most impressive parts of Angkor.
I suggest to pay close attention to the carvings and read some introduction beforehand as to their meaning.

Beautiful temple. This temple is a bit further out from the Angkor Wat area. We took a tuk tuk in the early afternoon. The ride was bumpy but it the scenery was great. The temple is beautiful, there is a lot of details carved into the stone and definitely worth a visit.
My Favorite Temple, Worth the Drive. This temple was truly worth seeing- to me, probably the most beautiful of all (sorry, Angkor Wat). Amazing architecture and color.

Simply stunning!. Friends told us to visit this temple if you want to see amazing, detailed carvings. They were not wrong!Arrived after a long and fascinating day at the other main temples, and was pleasantly surprised by this temple. The site is smaller than other temple sites (bonus for tired feet!) but you soon forget that when you see the carvings. I even found the stone colors to be rich and warming. My wife took a lot of photographs!On a practically point: The site is well maintained and run. Before the 5-min walk to the temple complex there is a main gate with some seating, usual market, and importantly clean toilets. I would go back to this one!
the best small temple to see, only 37km drive North-West from Siem Reap. beautiful orange curving, best to see before 9 AM for the pic purpose only 37 km drive North-West from Siem Reap,

Nice small temple very different from the traditonal Angkor temples.. This temple is a litttle bit far away from the traditional Angkor Wat and Angkor Wat temples. However it is very nice because it os smal and quite preserved.

A nice temple. It is a nice temple but far away from the rest. If you are in the area to do other visits then it is worth visiting. We went out of the way just to see this one (25 km away from Angkor Wat) and it was not that impressive considering the distance and short visit it took to see it all.
Worth the journey. Further away from Siem Reap than the other temples, which meant that on the day we visited it was a little quieter allowing us to take our time studying the detailed reliefs
Interesting small temple. Brick built with carvings inside a couple of the towers. Worth a short visit as it's not far from other temples and a bit different.

Lovely temple but can be crowded. We took an enjoyable tuk tuk ride out to Banteay Srei. We arrived about 10 or 11AM. Unfortunately the many large tour buses arrived just prior and the place packed out quickly with other tourists. This maybe would not have been such a problem apart from annoying people jumping in front of you and your camera shot to take a selfie of themselves - again and again and again. Banteay Srei is a small temple so 10 bus loads of tourists crowd it out quickly. Since the temple is small and if you have the option of your own transport you can probably wait 15 to 30 minutes strolling around some of the other areas around the temple and let the tours work their way through. Bantay Srei is definitely worth visiting but dont expect large temples - it is about the fine detail in the intricate carvings which are worth taking your time to appreciate.

Small and Special. This site is a bit further away from Siem Reap than most of the other temples but it's well worth the journey. It took us about an hour in a tuk tuk to get there and the drive itself was very pleasant, enjoying a little breeze and seeing all the rice fields as we passed by. The temple at Banteay Srei is carved from pink sandstone and has a lot of very detailed carving. It's a smaller complex than some of the others in the area so possible to see it in less than an hour. Also tends to not be as crowded as the better known sites. I loved it.

Beautiful, but crowded. This is Reallohn an amazing Place, completely different to all other Angkor places. But please to there around 08:00 a.m or later than 03:00 p.m . Otherwise you have to fight with Bus loads of groups.

Red temple with beautiful carvings. Banteay Srei is farther away from Angkor but it worth the visit to see miniaturized carvings on red rock. Unfortunately unsustainable tourism generated such a situation that you can't approach most of carvings to see them in details - they are closed off and you need to see them several meters away.
Worth the Drive. The pink limestone and the remarkable reliefs are the most important features of this temple. The importance of Lord Siva to the temple and Thailand culture is seen here.

Lovely!. Some distance away from Siem Reap and the famous Angkor Wat And Angkor Thom complex, this beautiful temple complex is definitely a must do. Some really intricate carvings and amazing structures here.

Amazing temple. We went templing for 4 days and although this temple is outside of the main complex (about 16 miles north), it was worth the trip. It is fairly small compared with many of the other temples, but the carving was exquisite and the colours amazing in the sun light. One of my favourites.

Worth the drive!. This temple is 27km away from the main ones but it is worth it. The temple is small but the level of detail in the carvings is incredible. Many tourist and probably most of the tours will not drive that far so you will not have a lot of people anytime. probably of my top temples.we took a tuk tuk and it was a pleasant drive, some people might find it uncomfortable since you will be seating one hour each way on the tuk tuk

Red colour temple. The colour of Banteay Srei is not the same as the other temples in Angor. The colour of Banteay Srei is red and not black. This beautiful temple is small but, with beautiful sculptures.

Nice and small. Small but very detailed ruins. Built with harder sandstone so the ruin details are in better shape. Worth stopping ay land mine museum on way. Pretty far out of town for tuk tuk ride, would take taxi.

Bantesy Srei. it a bit out of town, but worth visiting. I believe it's called the pink temple. The structures are different from the Angkor Wat, much smaller in scale, but the carving seems more detailed. Visit is short and sweet.
Good. Make this part of a visit to the temple complex. You'll need a guide book to explain it's relevance and importance.

Nice but only if you have enough time. Bantey Srey is the "house" of the (French) advisor of the first king. If you not have enough time (because its located +/- 25 km from Siem Reap) you can see the smaller model (15 by 10 m) at one of the 3 tempels of the Group Roluos. You can visit it on the way to Kompong Phluk or Kompong Kleang.
The "Citadel of Women". Although not the most imposing of the Angkor Wat Temples, the pink sandstone and intricate carvings found here merit a brief visit.

Interesting stop on the Grand Circuit. If you do the Grand Circuit this site is a good place to stop (along with Banteay Samre to begin to discover the area. Not the most outstanding but fascinating none the less.
Beautiful & small. Gorgeous sculptures and temples that cannot be ignored once you are in the Angkor vicinity. Superb color of the stones and details of the sculptures.
Different and interesting. It is a bit away from the other places in Angkor Wat, and has a different vibe. Beautiful sculptures. Marshy landscape. Birdwatching posts.

Well preserved and in tact - worth a visit. A really small temple, with head-height access, so you can see all the carvings and statues easily. As it's so small it can get overcrowded so walk around the outside if you get there the same time as a coach because when they leave it's wonderfully deserted and silent.
Beautiful small temple. Go early in the morning, like at 0700hrs to avoid the crowds and heat. The temple is small but well worth getting up early for.
My favorite temple. This temple has the most amazing details and is more scalable than Angkor Wat. The carvings in the walls of this temple take your breadth away.

almost day trip. its a small group of temples much older than the angkor temples - with very fine sculpture. Its around 40 minutes or so out of Siem reap by car so you get a good drive through the country side with rice fields etc on the way. Good to do if you have time as its just these small temples here and nothing else.

Don't take Tuk Tuk to get here. A must visit temple, even if it is quite far away. I highly recommended not to take a tuk tuk as it is a long and bumpy and dusty journey from Siem Reap. At least 40 minutes by car, and 1hr+ by tuk tuk as they go much slower.

About 1 hr 20 min from the city center of Siem Reap. Banteay Srei is further away than the other temples. If you have extra time, I think it's worth it to go. When we were there it was overrun by Chinese tour groups which left us feeling quite irritated because of their lack of manners and general rude behavior. However, the temple is gorgeous.
967 AD. This one is the only major temple not built by a monarch. Built of red sandstone, making nice decorative wall carvings. This buildings is not as big as the other one, but extremely popular.
My favorite temple. Don't miss this one just because it is out of town. It is beautiful and different. The experts are unsure where the stone is from, as it is rose colored. The carvings are amazing.

We loved this place!. Again, nicely combined with a full day in the Angkor ruins. Make sure you have sun glasses, hat and sunscreen! Btw, if they try to sell you an book about Angkor ruins history, remember this is an old version and with negotiations from the initial rate you can buy it for 4-6 dollars tops.

Don't overlook this more distant temple. This temple is more distant from Siem Reap -- about 37 Km -- so definitely requires motorized transportation out to the sight. Because of the distance, the crowds are less. A further side benefit is that you get to see some of the countryside of Cambodia, passing through small villages and by many farms.The temple itself is carved from pink sandstone and has much more detail in its carvings than the other sites. It was built as a Hindu complex and has a different look and feel from the other sites of the Angkor Wat Archeological Park. It is more compact. The main temple is surrounded by a moat which becomes a reflecting pool for the structure. We visited fairly late in the afternoon which made the whole site appear to be a peaceful retreat from the other more famous temples. Don't miss it!
Beautiful. Definitely take some time to see this one! An amazing rose colour with very intricate carvings. Well worth spending some extra time…

Beautiful temple . Beautiful temple but extremely hot. Make sure you take 3 or 4 bottles of water with you but again like any temple in cambodia, watch out for the beggars and endless children asking for money. Temple itself was stunning and very well preserved

Further away from Siem Reap but so nice. It worth the travel of 37km from Siem Reap! It is small and still being restored, but the sculptures are beautiful. Those are more detailed and have more depth than other temples. Some of them are like small 3D statues put the wall !
Well Preserved Carvings. Banteay Srei is one of the small temples in the complex but it has the most and well preserved carvings among the angkor temples.

Another fabulous piece of Cambodian history!. Someone suggested "seen one, seen them all" well I can honestly say that we thoroughly enjoyed visiting this temple even though we had done the rounds of a few.... fascinating history and the realisation of how these historical buildings came to fruition with skill, craftsmanship and belief is all very humbling !

Detailed Carving Amazing, Different than the others. As a historic preservation architect this has been on my list to see for decades. So thrilled to have finally seen it. Even I was unaware of all of the other temples to see in the area. This one is off the beaten path but worth it. Hire a guide and spend at least one day visiting four of them. We used Happy Angkor Wat and we are happy we did so. See my full review at their Trip Advisor page.

Small, crowded and stunning. Banteay Srei is a single small temple located about 35km north of Siem Reap city just outside the northern edge of the Angkor national park. However, you still get in using the regular park ticket. Because it is relatively isolated and much further to travel, tuk-tuk drivers charge extra to come here (about 10$ more than they charge for whole day trips to the park itself). On top of that because of its isolation and small size the crowds have less places to disperse to, and so we found it the most crowded temple that we visited (and we visited them all). It is said in the guide books that the reason to make the trip out to Banteay Srei is the great quality of the carvings there, but the quality actually on display didn’t strike us as being much better than we found elsewhere, although perhaps items now transferred to the national museum may be better than those left on site. To be clear they were stunning - just not particularly more stunning than elsewhere. Unlike other temples there was a nice display area about the restoration work and the ‘Malraux affair’ near to the entrance building which is worth a look. When we got to the temple it was mobbed. In an attempt to avoid the crowds we took a side walk through the woods and came upon a place doing boat rides and so took one (7 US$ for 2 people – refused to barter). It was great and something a bit different and extra to what is on offer elsewhere. We moved along at a snails pace through lotus and lily beds surrounded by dragonflies for about 15-20 minutes, but instead of taking us in a circle back to where we started, the guy dumped us off at the far end of the entrance car park. We attempted to make our way back to the temple without having to trek back through all the shops and the entrance buildings but it must have looked like we were trying to get in without showing our park ticket, since they scrambled an official on a motorbike to intercept us, and ask what we were doing. He was fine when we explained what had happened and showed him our valid tickets and he allowed us to continue back to the temple along the ‘exit’ route. By the time we got back to the temple it was lunch time and what a difference, most of the tour bus crowds had dispersed and walking around the temple was much more pleasant and relaxed. So based on our experience here are 3 tips: 1) if you are not part of an organised tour then aim to visit around lunch time ie 1200 to 1330h, it is way less crowded then. 2) don’t take the boat trip until after you have been to the temple and you intend to leave the complex. 3) if you try to get in without showing a ticket they will catch you. (The fine is 100 US$ apparently)
Best carving temple. It really nice temple even it bit far away but it really wonderful temple. Carving was very detail and color of stone are very nice.My lovely temple in Siem Reap.

Outskirts of Cambodia provide wider perspective of Cambodian life. We spent considerable amount of time to visit this site, 1-2hrs away from the siem reap center. I am happy we did.Apart from the spectacle of this archeological site, i enjoyed most the trip to the outskirt of siem reap. You see by the road the regular cambodian living, the lush greens and wide view of the less inhabited part of the province. I like how in the middle of the woods, on the foot of the mountain, a temple once stood. The restaurant near the site offers cambodian cuisine and the dining feels very local and homey, as if you are having your meal time at your own house.

Underwhelming. Far from Siem Reap and I found it underwhelming compared to other landmarks in Siem Reap area. Unless you're very interested in history, may not be worth making the trip. Better off spending more time at Angkor Wat and other places closer to town.

Citadel of Beauty - righty named. Extravagant pink stone carvings of Hindu stories. Fifteen miles northeast of the major cluster of Siem Reap temples, Banteay Srei is well worth the extra travel to see. This beautiful pink temple, built from red limestone, has such intricate, extravagant and detailed carvings that some think it must have been carved by women. The carvings are incredible - three dimensional in places and so fine - depicting scenes from Hindu stories in flamboyantly ornate style. Fabulous snakes and other animals. Highly photogenic and a great way to spend a couple of hours or so.
Very unique. Visiting more than 5 temples during this trip, this is the unique one, with reddish finishing. It's unique beauty is worth visiting.
Very detailed temple. Some said it was built by women due to the great details on the wall. It is located a bit far north from other temples around Angkor Wat but it is worth the visit.

Detailed architecture. One of a kind in combodia. Extremely gorgeous, colorful and detailed architecture.
It's 45 minutes drive from Siem reap main city and you get to see the beautiful country side of Combodia. I spent there for 4 hours walking around and on the way back was lucky to see a gorgeous sunset in the evening.

Pink Lady, Include this for sure. Smaller and perhaps the most intricate bas relief and ordinate detail are on display here. Not to mention a less traveled reflecting pond, great photo opps and a unique pinkish hue and color. While here it is worth it to go up the Mountain to “Resting Buddha” and definitely see and cool off in the 110 ft waterfall.

The pink temple, a change of pace. This temple is made of pink sandstone, and is quite different to those near Angkor Wat. It is a fair distance out from Angkor Wat/Siem Reap, so if you are planning on going, then get up early, as the trip is at least half an hour to get there, and another half an hour to get back.I saw this temple in 2006, and again in 2016. It is worth going to, after you have had your fill of all the other temples near Angkor Wat. That's because there are so many other temples worth seeing, and so if you have limited time, this wouldn't be my first choice, but as a change up on day 3, definitely worth it. We did travel there via car, not tuk tuk, so that may affect your decision.

Stunning small temple. Quite a trip to get to this place as we went by tuk-tuk; great way to see some real Cambodia on the way though.This is one of the smaller temples but incredibly ornate and very much worth the visit. You can see why the theory is that it was built by women, great attention to detail. The redness of the stone adds an interesting element.Be aware that it does get busy with coach loads of Chinese tourists. Try to get there early.

Beautiful!!. Small but beautiful temple, with lots of well presevered carvings. Definitely worth a visit for a couple of hours. The children really enjoyed the environment as there were also lots of water buffaloes at the entrance...

Well worth the travel time. Went to Banteay Srei as a last-minute decision on our last day and it was well worth the time. A really lovely temple different from the others but due to the distance from Siem Reap would recommend a car rather than a tuk-tuk as would take half the time to reach. Take the time to walk to the river on a loop on the way out for a pleasant walk in the shade. Do visit the Landmine Museum too - we spent over an hour there and it is on the way to Banteay Srei
Beautiful. This area is tucked away in the apsara area. So pretty to drive through and roadside market stalls. Very tropical. Lovely lake.

Temple Combo. Banteay Srei was combined with Kbal Spean and a scenice TukTuk ride to both. Banteay Srei is about 50km from town. Part of the experience for me at least, was the sedate pace of the Tuk Tuk. This was part of the attraction.Banteay Srei is worth visitng. I would not recommend just going there - not enough on its own. However as part of the trip you could include Kbal Spean and a Tuk Tuk trip. Very enjoyable way to see the countryside and spend a day out of town.
Great temple!!!. This was my 2nd favorite temple (first being Ta Prohm)! It is a Hindu temple, and I found all the learning from my guide fascinating! Definitely a must see.

The ladies' temple. I really like this temple for its fantastic bas-reliefs and decorations, which are much more visible and detailed than in other temples. It's a completely different style and it's definitely in my top four temples of Angkor! Even the color is peculiar, it's made of pinkish stones.
Small and Colorful. This is a small temple and lies about 32k outside of Siem Reap. It is small but the unique coloring and reliefs are beautiful!

amazing!. Oh My God!!!!!!!
this is the first response while i reach. this is an amazing place!! you just need 20 dollars of a ticket per day to travel whole angkor thom city. totally recommended!

Do make the effort.... A smaller temple, and much further away from Siem Reap - about 90 minutes each way in a tuk-tuk, so think about a driver, although the journey itself is enjoyable and gives much more of an idea of the rural lifestyle. The crowds as a result are smaller than at the larger temples, but a visit early in the day is still a good idea.The temple itself is smaller and carved from beautiful pink sand stone. It was consecrated as long ago as 967 A.D and unusually was constructed by two courtiers rather than by a monarch. It was only rediscovered in 1914 and was the subject of a notorious art theft by Andre Malraux (who has a restaurant named after him in Siem Reap).The wall-carvings are elaborate, ornate and have led to the temple being called the "Jewel of Khmer Art". Take a sun hat, as it's rather exposed, but do go and see this precious gem.

Female temple. An enjoyable 1.5 hour tuk tuk ride through the country side. Lovely. The traditional music playing by landmine victims is always nice to hear. Please donate to this worthy cause to help their families.

An artist's creation "Pink temple". The bas reliefs at Benteay Srei are absolutely amazing for its detailed beauty. Unlike other temples where the carvings are "mass produced" by craftsman on the walls themselves, the intricate artwork at Banteay Srei are products of the royal designer who spared no time nor expense to express his talent. The temples have a pinkish hue from the rich clay around it. Well worth the hour drive out of the city.
Much better than Angkor Wat. I think this temple is much more grand and beautiful than Angkor Wat. The unique sandstone color gives it a mysterious feel.

Do not miss this visit. A beautiful temple, small but well preserved. Try to arrive before 9.00 am then the tourist buses arrive and the place is a bit crowded.When you walked through the temple turn left to the lake and take a boat. 15 min of plenitude and serenity in wonderful environment. You will arrive at the parking area. Get there with a tuktuk, the landscape is beautiful and a car is too fast. My driver Lon was great and I recommend him warmly : easytuktuk.com

Exquisite. If you like intricate workmanship this small temple doesn't have the grandeur of Angkor Wat but is a must include visit. Do spend some time here and enjoy it at leisure. A bonus if you go early morNing or late afternoon is that its not as badly infested with crowds as the other temples.
Worth the Drive. This is well worth the drive outside of Siem Reap. The crowds are much smaller and the photo opportunities are fabulous.

Amazing Treasure of Cambodian Art. It was quite far from the Angkor Wat. Your tuk-tuk might charge you more to visit this temple. But it is a must temple to visit as it has different colors of stone, carving and setting of the building.This looks more a Hindu Temple than Buddhist one.
Intricately designed temple. Very beautiful and well preserved temple. One of the highlights of our visit. Made even more special by our excellent guide SUN

A beauty site.. Very unique, this site is mainly Hindu and keeps most of that character intact. Great little images run throughout the site and they deserve much exploration. A bit off the main track so you can spend time and make it a site where you can catch your breath and then adventure some more.

Carvings par excellence!. The carvings are of incredibly fine detail and worth a visit, but the long and fairly expensive tuk-tuk ride out to this location is a drawback if you are going here only for this site. But if money and time are no issue, or if you are going to visit the Landmine museum and the Butterfly center, both of which are on the way, and especially if you are sharing a tuk-tuk with 3 others as I was sharing it with my wife and two boys, then this trip is definitely worth it. Take note the butterfly center closes at 4:30 and the landmine museum at 5, so plan accordingly.

Amazingly well preserved carvings. This temple was dedicated to the Hindu God Shiva, with miniature sized buildings compared to the other main temples, so it's fast and easy to navigate in under an hour.We got there around 10am and it was already hot and packed with bus loads of tourists - wished we got there earlier to enjoy it more.

A Gem near Siem Reap. Banteay Srei is a gem of a temple, over 1000 years old, dedicated to Lord Shiva, the Hindu God. The walls are finished in red sandstone and incised with deep, beautiful bas reliefs. Also unusual, are the statues of warrior monkeys, the followers of Lord Hanuman, as guards to some of the temple facilities. Lord Hanuman was a devotee of Lord Rama, who is depicted amongst the episodes from the Ramayana on the temple walls.The temple is only about an hours drive from Siem Reap. It is small compared to Angkor Wat, Bayon, etc. but is a ‘must not miss’ ite

Beautiful Bas-Relief. The scale and detail of the Banteay Srei temple made me appreciate why our guide at Angkor the previous day had described the Banteay Srei temple as one the must see spots. Definitely worth a visit. We combined a stop here on the way back from the Phnon Kulen National Park waterfall which made for a great day (we also hit Ta Prohm on the way back to Siem Reip).
The Lady Temple. It's a temple dedicated to women in mythologyA scared site where the great women of yester years came to seek solace
Visited as part of the Angkor mini Tour. A must see as part of the mini tour we booked with a Tuk Tuk for the day. It's the best way to do it and get the full experience.

Must see. If you go to Siem Reap, go to this place. If isn'nt destroyed by the nature like Anghor Watt, but of course time has done its effect. It is a very attractive place, with many old buildings and well preserved. Especially the stone gravuers on the waals are very şnterestinG.
The jewel in the jungle. This "woman's temple is a true jewel in the jungle. Requires walking and steps. Amazing renovation still in progress.

Banteay Srei Temple. Banteay Srei is an amazing temple and i do recommend all visitors to visit it is a must after your visiting Angkor Wat, but I will suggest you visit the tourist centre before you start the tour in the temple, as you will get to know more on its composition, materials, history and more.
A female temple.. In my opinion, one of the most interesting temples in Siem Reap. The details of the construction are amazing.

Beautiful and Different. In two full days of temple viewing, Banteay Srei was my favorite. With all due respect to the magnificent Angkor Wat and Ta Prohm, the pink glow of this smaller temple made it unique and captivating. The carvings are intricate and very beautiful, while the overall setting imparts a feeling of serenity. An early morning visit only intensifies the impact, as well as allowing the opportunity to quietly enjoy before the crowds show up. Walking through this masterpiece and learning its history should not be missed.
Smal area but nice. This temple is small, but the precision of all structure is amazing. very peace full place. a must ti see.

Amazing details. Long drive to get here but worth the wait. Amazing detail in this red sandstone temple. Very different from the others we saw. Has totally been rebuilt but still confused why they had so many left over pieces stacked up nearby. If you have an extra day go to this place. Very good market near the temple and other good shops along the way. You get to see lots of local culture along the route.

Small but perfectly formed. In comparison with the Angkor sites Banteay Srei is quite petite. Its worth the journey from Siem Reap. The examples of carvings in this exquisitely decorated temple are wonderful. There are also many fine statues of Hindu gods.
Different in style... all red stones.... A bit far away from the Angkor Wat and the Angkor Thom, go in the morning with the sun facing the main side.

Gorgeous red temple. If not mistaken, this is older than Angkor Wat, dedicated to Shiva. It's different from the other temples as it is constructed of red stones. Worth a visit on the way back from Phnom Kulen.

This was my favorite temple in Siem Reap. Banteay Srei is a beautiful, ornate, sandstone temple. It is believed to have been designed by a woman because it was so ornate. The grounds were lovely as well.

Little gem within a small lake. Be sure to arrive at Banteay Srei early morning to avoid the crowds and the heat of around noon. It's a small temple nestled on an island surround by an lake. Looks like the miniature architecture from huge Angkor Wat. Liked all the monkey statues and the quiet atmosphere.
Beautiful temple. This temple is worth the 30 min drive out of Siem Reap. The drive provides views of the local area and the temple is unique.

My favourite temple. I loved all of the temples we saw but this was my favourite. It is about an hour drive out of Siem Reap so you get the chance to see local people going about their daily life in small villages along the way.Banteay Srei is a Hindu temple dedicated to Shiva. It is cut from stone that has a dark pinkish hue. The carvings are very deep so they look 3D and the whole temple, though small, is very well preserved. It is a square temple that has an east and west entrance and it is one of the few temples that was not built by a king. It is believed to have been built by a brahman in 967AD. There are three central towers and these are decorated with male and female divinities and beautiful filigree relief work. There are also many carvings of women wearing traditional skirts and carrying lotus flowers in their hands.Banteay Srei was the first major temple to be restored.Beautiful temple that is well worth a visit.
Must See. Small temple but the best carving of them all. Must to visit, it's crowded but you kinda understand because of its charm and beauty.

Spectacular strickingly intimate carvings. Unlike some sites this was not as crowded, but it is still quite rightly popular amongst visitors.Although it is a small site compared to Angkor Wat (20 miles away), this highly decorated salmon pink sandstone temple gives an opportunity to get close to some strickingly inimate carvings. Although there did not appear to be a single centre / focal point. Useful shops and facilities nearby.
Unique temple. They associate this temple specifically with the goddesses! The original reddish colour of the stones is impressive and some of the carvings are well preserved.

Beautiful and Amazing! . I love this place! Beautiful ruins that has so much History. They have guided tours and it is a lot smaller the Ankor Wat. On the other side of the Ruins, there's a spot you can go fishing and do shopping!

Reddish Pink temple near Siem Reap. It is about 25 kilometres away from Angkor Wat and a lot smaller than the other temples we visited.However considering it is from the tenth century, the design and carvings found within this monument is amazing.

Beautiful carvings and colors. Incredible structure with an amazing past. So lucky to be able to experience it while its in one piece and relatively good condition.The carvings are so detailed and beautiful we could have spent all day looking at each one. The colors were also just spectacular. Definitely one of our favorites.

Limitations meant we were unable to visit. As only 300 people are allowed to the temple at a time we missed out on visiting the monument which was very disappointing. A better system needs to be in place as some tourists spend so long up there waiting for sunset that others don't even get a chance to see it at all. Not worth the ten minute hike at all.

Not worth the visit. It's located far from the other temples, not worth the visit as it is much smaller. However, the red soil gave the temple an interesting look.Recommended to visit as early in the morning as possible to avoid the crowd.

Drop some others and add this to your one day tour after lunch. This temple interested us so we asked our guide if we could add this after lunch and skip another. For a bit of an increase in cost they did it. It isn't as far out as it seems it might be and it is an enjoyable drive. This stands out because it was built for a god so is smaller in scale. Also the carvings are truly awesome. How they are in such amazing shape seems impossible. i would say this is a must see.
Stunning. This is stunning temple, very well maintained! Very well preserved and off the standard crowded route! Must do!
Very beautiful and lots of small details. Very beautiful temple, lot of history and nice statues. If you visit Ankor you should visit this temple too.
Ancient. Again another amazing architectural works done so long back with excellent accuracy and amazing design.
like a movie set. This mysterious temple evokes a movie set in comparison to the expansive and bust primary Ankgor Wat site. Definitely worth the visit.
Very nice temple!. One of the temples in Angkor Archaelogical Park, Very impressive, regarding how old the temples are!

Amazing temple!. Banteay Srei was my favourite temple! Whilst only a small temple, the detail is amazing. So worth the drive out. Take a guide with you to explain the history in the beautiful carvings. We had the pleasure of Mr Vannsak Se as our guide....highly recommend this gentleman!
Amazing carvings. This temple is a little further out of Siem Reap but is well worth the trip. It has exquisite carvings which are different from the main temples.

Red Sandstone Temple. Bantreay Srei is about 30 kilometers from the center of Siem Reap. We chose to visit this temple after a day's break from visiting the main temples in Angkor Wat. We had visited the museum and so could appreciate the difference between the temple with the later ones of Bayon and Angkor Wat. The colours of the temple is a rich pink sandstone and extravagantly carved lintels remain in place. Even though it's a 40+ minute drive by car and longer by tut tut it was still very busy and hot.

Beautiful!!. Gorgeously detailed temple. Our driver called it the womans temple and it actually does seem to have a womans touch! Beautiful pinkish sandstone and such small, detailed carvings. Great stop to include on a day tour of Angkor.

Beautiful. The ride out to Banteay Srei is well worth the trip. It is so much different from the other sites to see at Angkor Tom. It is smaller and the carvings are different, more intricate. The colors are picturesque and vibrant. If possible, a guide is important. There is so much history to Banteay Srei. It would be a shame to not hear the many stories that can be told of it's architecture and its place in time.
Definitely worth going to. Being made of red sandstone, and allegedly carved by the "delicate hands" of a woman, the carvings were simply mind-blowing - a must-see!

Beautiful and outstanding experience . Loved it, very beautiful but it was very hot and humid but worth it , must visit if u have extra days it's better to book a tour then to do it urslf as it makes it more easy

As petite and charming as ever...... Although in scope and scale this venue is a poor cousin to Angkor Wat however with regards to the quality of the carvings into the stone and the colour of the stone this venue to me is most memorable. I also find that there it is genteel and charming.

One of our favourites. Banteay Srei was a good change of pace from the heat and crowds around Angkor Wat! It was a very pleasant tuk tuk ride out into the country side to visit this and a few other smaller temples! The intricate carvings (by women) of this Hindu temple were just wonderful and the pink hue makes this a very special place to wonder through at a leisurely pace. After a tour group left, we were one of the few tourist there - so bide your time and you will have the place to yourself (for a while!).

Worth the trip out of town!. We were hesitant to visit this temple because it's far out of town. It took us about an hour in a Tuk Tuk. I will say, the ride was wonderful. You see schools, families, animals, artwork, it's really a great drive. The temple itself is small, but the complex it's housed on is bigger. The temple is pretty remarkable because it's made from different stone, and therefore is a different color. It's certainly a change from Angor Wat, The Bayon and others in Siem Reap proper. It was a really nice area, and there are other things to see see within the complex. Visiting this temple pairs really nicely with Kbal Spean.

An exquisite temple. Banteay Srei is just outside the usual tour route, about 15 kilometers from Siem Reap - but worth every bit of your time. To get there, you will pass a very old temple that in itself is worth seeing - but Banteay Srei is the star attraction; it may well be the most beautiful and haunting temple in the area. Sometimes known as the "pink temple" because of the unique color of the local stone it is made of, it sits in an area enclosed by a moat, with the illusion of undisturbed time. The light in late morning causes the temple to glow with a warmth that is beguiling, and the carvings are in good condition. This may sound like heresy, but given only one chance to see any of the temples, I would choose this one above all others.

Stunning temple.. Absolutely stunning temple, so beautiful colours, the details of the carvings are so detailed and intricate and well preserved compared to some of the other Angkor temples.The colour is unusual and quite breathtaking.We really enjoyed visiting this temple and our guide Rany was able to give us the history of Banteay Srei as well as taking us to the best spots for some amazing photographs.It is a bit of a journey, we went in an air con car and it was a welcome relief getting back in from the heat of the day, well worth the ride out, would have hated to miss out on this one.

Amazing small temple!. I think, this is one of the smallest temple here, but it's worth to go with special trip to see it! It looks amazing. Temple of Shiva, women's temple. It has so beautiful wall decor!

Bit disappointed after the hype. Banteay Srei is a bit off the normal circuit but worth a visit if you hire a car for a day tour to several places. A tuk tuk drive over is also great as you see much more of the landscape and houses. The complex is not nicer than some of the others on the Grand Circuit as most guide books tend to believe. Yes some of the carvings are detailed but it is rather open en flat, no levels or high structures. The touristic shops and large car park is a bit of a let down after all the intimate temples you find in the forest less frequented by bustours.Great new white toilet building a couple minutes past East Mebon with a stunning views, worth a stop as it will be another 30-45min yo Banteay Srei.

MUST SEE BEFORE YOU DIE. Ah inspiring structures that leave you with a renewed sense of creativity. Pack a lunch and get there early with plenty of room to get pics without people in them. By afternoon it is packed in high season.
Cambodian temple. Smaller than other temple sites but truly beautiful. Extremely intricate well preserved carvings. Very well spread out.
The only red sand stone temple. This is the only red sand stone temple in Angkor Wat. Some of the sculptures remain very clear and the smile of some fairies are actually quite vivid.

Not worth a special trip. A small site with better preserved and finer repetitive wall carvings, not a site to make a trip for. Along the drive you get to see open, poorly maintained open fields and water buffaloes. It is a trip away from town and remind one of the sights typical of the Third World. Has road side stalls for palm sugar and possible visits to villages on local crafts and extraction of sugar and fruits.

Small but the most intense beauty. The about 40 minutes drive to Banteay Srei is absolutely worth it! If you like richly decorated temples of course. It's famous for the numerous bas reliefs, which are deeply carved into the surface of the pediments and walls. One of the highpoints when visiting Angkor.

Crowded. Amazing.. Beautiful and best organized temple we visited. It takes a while to get there so you must take it into consideration. There is a nice display about renovation and Khmer art as well as small market. Avoid going there between 11 and 1 - there isn't much shade so it might get unpleasant. It is pretty small but definitely worth a visit.

Beautiful but...... Great temple that is very different from the other temples in terms of size, architecture so you need to vary your expectations accordingly. Try to work through different times in the day to avoid major crowds

Female designed temple. Very intricately designed temple with lots of fine detail. The red earth adds to this beautiful temple. Get a tub tuck to take you great ride out into the country side and make sure you stop at the stalls on the way.
beautiful temple. My favorite temple, the detail in the carving are so beautiful, sunrise at this temple is very nice, the light with the pink stone is very unique
Small but very beutiful. This temple is quite small but is very beautiful. It's working, it is possible to see the details etched in stone.I recommend

Jewel of Khmer Art. Banteay Srei was located 37 km NE of Siem Reap. It was a temple built of red sandstones that gave the temple a pinkish red colour. The distinctive feature of this temple was the beautiful bas belief carvings on the walls and it was hailed as 'Jewel of Khmer Art'. The cravings told the stories of mythical characters and our guide explained some of the interesting stories to us. Since Banteay Srei was far away from the major Angkor temples, it was less crowded with visitors and we could enjoy the peaceful environment of the temple.

A few temples stand out, this is one. One hazard of visiting Siem Reap is temple fatigue. There are so many that it can be difficult to tell them apart.Banteay Srei stands out from this crowd because of the quality of the carvings - they were of exceptional quality when they were carved and have survived better than many in the area.One recommendation - hire a guide who can discuss the carvings with you. They are beautiful in their own right, but take on further significance as you learn the stories they tell.
Beautiful architecture . Beautiful architecture and design , it is stunning place to learn about this rich culture while in siem reap The road leading to the temple is convenient

The Citadel of Women. This is a beautiful, serene, less visited temple and therefore a pleasant break from crowds. The colors and textures of the temple are beautiful. Made me want to sit down and plein air paint.
Older site with Hindu art. Mr. Try took us to this site our last day. The architecture and art is entirely different than Angkor Wat, or later sites, more Hindu influence than later Buddhist.

beautiful site.. Beautiful site. We loved the colors of all the stones set against the jungle. wear comfortable walking shoes as the temples require a lot of walking and climbing. Take water! We suggest a took took as the best way to get around.

My preferred temple in Angkor. Magic place even if a lot of tourist groups, just wait a minute they move quickly and you can appreciate. Beutiful pictures inside as the central area is closed you can take pictures without anybody and outside with the water. Incredible stone sculptures like 3D laces. Different from the other temples.

Small lovely teple. It is quite far from the town but is great to visit. The temple is made of pink sand stone. It is one of the hardest sand stone in the world. The carving is stil vivid compare to other temple. The arrangement or decoding of the area is good and green. Great to see again.
Quite small but most of it was closed off .... Due to the ongoing restoration / conservation of this temple, a lot of parts were closed off. All temples start to look the same after a while.

Go around the back of the exit to the "global View" playform. You will get a better photo. We stopped here after our trip to Kbal Spean (you should look into doing that before or after stopping here since you've already driven so far out to see this

All time high. Angkor Wat is impressive, But for me Bantesy Srei was an all time high.This temple is further out of town about 45 or 55 mins from Siem Reap. The detail is just incredible.this temple is a 10 th century Hindu site. the carving all tell Hindu stories , The sandstone has a rose ton or almost Terra cotta look. you can not touch the temples they are roped off. I thought this was just stunning .

Save this for last -- it is delicate and special and worth it. Just before you are "templed out" be sure to go to Banteay Srei. It is delicate and small and special and very very much worth the trip. And if you happen to find my sunglass clip in the Ladies toilet at the entrance, please let me know!!

beautiful carvings but can't get so close. this was definitely different in terms of the carvings, but it is small, quite a trek (we did it by bumpy tuktuk $25 from Siem Reap) and carvings are roped off.

Amazing place during our first Cambodia trip. Banteay Srei is totally a must during your visit to Angkor Wat but I will suggest you visit the tourist centre before you start the tour in the temple, as you will get to know more on its composition, materials, history and more.

Cultural Overload!. This location was lovely, the stone carvings are different than the other Angkor buildings we saw, but just as ornate. Recommend going as early in the day as possible to avoid the hordes.
Beyond Words. This is the temple I rate the best. It was awe-inspiring, so delicate and intricate. A 'must' on your itinerary and well worth the journey from Angkor Wat.
Fantastic. The most detailed and intricate carvings 1200 years old and hardly eroded at all.I cant even begin to understand hon they can have withstood time so perfectly.

The most beautifully decorated of all the temples. If you only have a short time in Siem Reap, this is a really great temple to see the fantastic carvings and bas relief detail. It is stunningly beautiful, pink sandstone and brick. We thought this temple the most beautiful of all.

The pink temple. Well worth the long trip out to this temple, it has been restored, what a huge job, and definitely gives you an idea of the way of live. Exquisitely carved, every surface has something on it, to think this has lasted for so long is amazing. One of my favorites.

Beautiful, but people have no respect. It was a very beautiful experience however it can turn ugly when people are seen being disrespectful to their surroundings, clearly standing where it says "do not stand", or leaning against where it says "do not touch"I just don't know how people can do that
Amazing detail, well preserved. This temple is so much more intricate in the carvings and details than others in the Angkor Wat complex. The temple is small but very lovely- highly recommend.

Small ones, but Beautiful.. Banteay srey temple or Pink temples is far a ways from angkor area 35km and spend about 45mn to reach there. The decoration is very meaning full. Still new and you can see some story on the stones.

Greater photo opportunity next only to the Angkor Wat. 37 Km from Siem Reap, its a half day tour. Full day for us because we combined it with the bigger circuit. This temple is older than the Angkor wat, and degree of preservation is spectacular.
(Restaurants at the site are ridiculously priced, probably because of distance from Siem Reap. )

Exquisitely Carved Temple. I saw many temples in Siem Reap, but Banteay Srei is my favorite. And who can resist those photogenic monkey statues? Not me!
Don’t miss this exquisitely carved Citadel of the Women.

Pretty temple, but very far. This was the furthest temple we visited. It was much smaller than I expected and a little far from the main Angkor temples. It was a little different from the other temples being more pink in color. I enjoyed it and probable would have visited the land mine museum as well had I known it was close by.
Worth the effort . It is worth the effort as it is different to the others. Each temple has something different to offer especially if you are not in rush and pace your days.

So small, but so beautiful. This is a must do in Siem Reap. The area is small, but you could spend a day here just taking in the details of the stone carving and beautiful pink stone. It was hot. No shade here, so bring a hat or umbrella to keep from melting.

My favourite. This Hindu temple is simply gorgeous...the craftsmanship, the fine engravings in this very hard pinkish stone breathtaking. It is a short visit well worth travelling from Siem Reap, I visit every time I am there...nice energy too...

The Ancient Woman's Temple With Gorgeous Carved Stone Motifs. I hired a local personal guide and air conditioned car for our 3 days in Siem Reap. It's hot, and personal guides and A/C cars are very reasonably priced. Banteay Srei is a must-see! The intricate hand-carved motifs are unbelievable. This was my 2nd visit to this majestic Angor Wat temple complex, and my 2 guests were awe-struck at every site. We visited IKKT Silk Factory, a temple and enjoyed an Apsara performance/dinner our first day. On day 2, we toured Angor Wat & Angor Thom, and attended the Phare Circus that evening, day 3 - Tha Phrom, Banteay Srei, and the Landmine Museum, with sunset on a nearby temple pagoda.

A real gem... one of the most delightful temples.. Small in scale, but the red sandstones were carved like wood, resulting really intricate ornaments and delicate statues.Do checkout the rest of the complex, as just behind the temple is a swampy area where (with a bit of luck) one can do some really interesting bird watching…. not to mention the many varieties of dragon-flies. A cool spot for a quick picnic.Best to go early morning, as one could enjoy the drive through the countryside in the morning lights and arrive before the larger crowd of tourists. Normally tourists are advised to combine this trip with a visit to Kbhal Spean… but it could be worth to spend sometime at the nearby Angkor Butterfly Centre too (we missed this one).

Most beautiful temple in Siem Reap. Known affectionately as the 'city of women' or more accurately the 'auspicious city', this Hindu temple is about 35km away from Siem Reap, one of the farthest. Angkor Wat is only 7 km away.Commonly also called the pink temple, this is a small partially restored temple with beautiful pink sandstones. Intricately carved. Well worth a visit. On the way, u can stop by the very poignant Land Mine Museum, entrance USD 5. We skipped the butterfly sanctuary.
Beautiful. The place is amazing. The stones are beautifully carved to it's details. The place is also quiet and big which u can walk around to explore more of each corner

far but beautiful. At nearly 30km of Siem reap, the road to go there is a nice drive in the countryside. Not big as a pyramid, this temple is hidden behind trees and ricefield. It is small but absolutely wonderfull. The sculpture are the finest of Angkor. You can go there by tuktuk or with a scooter you can rent in Siem Reap

The most place to spend sunrise with mam sonondy the most amazing tour guide. . It started at 5am traveling to Banteay Srei. It was wonderful to see the country side coming to life. The farmers were well into their workday and the shopkeepers were getting ready for their business day way before the sun came up. We were one of the first visitors that morning and it was well worth the early morning. The light was magical and the sounds of the morning were crisp.

Unique place to walk around. Banteay Srei (translates to "Citadel of Women") is a unique place to walk around. Efforts have been made to preserve the ruins and you can see wooden beams and structures here and there. The carvings of this temple are intricate and idols are more easily identifiable. Beyond the actually temple, there isn't much to see. There are swampy areas so they do give options for boating and fishing. You can see water buffalo and lotuses when you walk around. The place looks like it's still under construction and needs some clean up. There are many tourist shops, a visitors centre with more information, and a decent restaurant there as well so you can finish and eat there is you want to. Looked good, but we wanted to head out quickly, so we skipped it.
Sandstone structures with monkey statues. What sets this apart from the other local ruins is that it is pinkish-brown sandstone rather than gray. The monkey statues are interesting and unique.

AN AWESOME TEMPLE. Despite being in need of urgent restoration, it is by far the most fascinating temple I've visited in Cambodia. The carvings are breathtaking and it has a fascinating atmosphere. It was a great experience.

Don't miss!. This is outside the cluster of main temples but well worth the effort! It's smaller, more intact, with impressive reddish sand stone carvings (thus the nickname of pink temple) and designs. If they're smart, they will put this all under some protective shield to preserve it, making it harder to admire. So go now!
Beautiful. This was our last temple to visit and once again the craftsmanship of the time was amazing. Detail detail detail. A must see !

Pink Temple. This is very different temple amongst the temples at SIem Reap. This is beautiful pink temple and having great archtectural value. Nice to visit evening time. This is little far from the siem reap.

Temple in red. The predominant features of the temple ruins are the intricate carvings on the walls, pillars and arches and, their color, which is pinkish orange and becomes red when wet thus making it awe- inspiring. Overall effect is feminine, plus the small doors and arches, it makes one think this was a place for women. Dont miss seeing Banteay Srei, you'll love it!

Worths the trip. 32 km from Siem Reap dowtown, this is considered far by Angkor standards but certainly worth the trip. A must see in Angkor temple complex. Never ending voyage! Tips: Obviously the more off the beaten track you go the less people will speak English. You should hire a local guide, or at least, a tutuk driver who is able to contact with locals on site.

Don't miss this one. The beautifully restored intricate carving makes this the most beautiful temple to visit. It is a bit out of the way, but one sees a glipse of the local life and agriculture on the way.

Definately a pretty temple and worth the visit . This is a small but perfectly formed temple with a lovely pink hue and known as the ladies temple. The carvings are intricate and hardly worn. The temple itself is really very nice and is set in a nice area with lots of green. Feels quite off the beaten track too so if there's a crowd hold back for a bit, let them see the temple and then you might just get it nearly to yourself.

Sacred Deatination - Banteay Srei. We when there on 14th November 2015. Althought it's far & out of the way , for hindu & true history lovers won't want to miss Banteay Srei.. We when all the way for 25KM to see this beautiful 10th century Himdu temple , it's same road where you go to Phonum Kulen Mountain & Banteay Samre . We as family feels this place filled with full of mysterious & there is vibration our heart feels if you believe can see miracle . It's build largely of red sandstone .Each and every carvings discribe the story of lord Shiva, Vishnu,Indran,Maha letchumy , Ravanan and lot more ... We feel even if there is another more opportunity definetly we will go again and again to see miracle forest ...

pink temple and soil intensifies the green vegetation around. The women's temple is pink! Surprised?!You might be surprised that the soil is also pink around here--which bring so much intensity to the green vegetation!The carvings are impressive, it's not crowded and less touristy as it's off the beaten track. We went in the late afternoon and it was free of charge

The Pearl of Cambodia. Many pepole consider this temple to be the most beautiful of the entire Angkor complex. It is far out of the way, about 35 km away from Siem Reap, so it takes some planning to go there. It is fairly small, but the wall carving and decoration is the most elaborate and the most stunningly beautiful I have seen anywhere in the world. If you are planning on visiting Angkor, you MUST include this temple on your list of things to see!
If you have time. This is a bit off the beaten track, but that means you have the site to yourself. Just make sure you have an appropriate means of transport to the site or you will regret the trip.
Beautiful. This is a smaller temple with carvings that you can really see. Fewer tourists. A bit out of the way but a must see.
Long Trip. It's a 25km trip, but well worth it. Been there in 2010 & 2015. Think it was cleaner in 2010. One of the best temple sights in the Angkor Wat Area.

Exceptionally interesting carvings. The details on the building carvings are outstanding and must have required exceptional skill. That being said, Banteay Srei is a bit away from the main Angkor Thom city. While the temple of Banteay Srei is interesting it pales in comparison to Bayon or Angkor Wat.

the most impressive carvings at Angkor Wat. A bit of a drive from the other well-known central temples. Has the most detailed and intricate carvings of any of the main temples. Can be combined with the land mine museum and/or the butterfly garden if you're looking for a non-temple activity to balance it.

A pleasant country ride leads to a real gem. Like to take the Angkor Wat complex a little at a time since I come up here fairly often, so we break things up. This time our longtime friend, guide and tuk-tuk driver Phon suggested a longer trek to Banteay Srei, a small temple beyond the main Angkor Wat wonder. Took about an hour along leafy, shaded country roads before we arrived at the mini-park and was it a surprise. (Tip: You must have an Angkor Wat pass to go here, as is true of most of the temples in the area. Since I was going to be in Siem Reap twice in about four weeks, I bought a week pass for $60US. It is good for seven days (a single-day pass is $20) but you can use it any time within a month time frame).Banteay Srei is one of the best facilities I have seen. You are greeted with a clean, attractive reception building adjacent to a nicely organized, extensive area featuring Cambodian crafts and souvenirs. A short walk, much of it shaded by towering trees, takes you to the temple. All along the way you see wonderful carvings, lintels and other delights. You pass by a traditional Khmer band demonstrating their skills (tips appreciated). You will see occasional vendors but they seem less aggressive here than at other sites.The trip was pleasant (and we stopped by Khmer Kitchen, an excellent little restaurant which I have reviewed here, for lunch) and the temple, though fairly small, is stunning. With a lunch stop this can be a very lovely three or four hour excursion and there are opportunities for other stops along the way.

Carved by women for sure . Must see!!!!!!Well conserved temple with its beautiful fine carvings in red stone . As if its carved by women....so fine and delicate .Luckily barriers and ropes stop people from touching and damaging the middle section from the temple and its also better to take pictures this way .

Worth Visiting. Went here January of 2014 sorry late post ( I thought I was able to send my review ) since Siem Reap is known for Temple ruins might as well go to as many as you can right? When we went there some areas if I remember right are being restored. Maybe now they're done in some parts. Nice experience and for photo shoots.
Nicest tiniest temple. Loved Banteay sry than other temples here. well preserved, pink stone, quiet place, more enjoyed as a bit far.

Petit temple with great carving. This temple is one of the most interesting temple in Siem Reap. The carving is still vivid and environment is so clean and nice. Though it is far but it is worth it to visit. Don't forget to visit that temple!!!!

Intricate Carvings. One the most beautiful temples I saw in Siem Reap. Before heading out, I've read that it is believed that women did the carvings on this temple and after seeing it, I would have to agree. Each carving has a story to tell, makes you wonder and quest for more learning on how these temples came about.

Pretty in pink. My wife and I hired a guide to visit this temple dedicated to the Hindu god Shiva. It's a 30-45 minute drive from the Angkor Archaeological Park where Angkor Wat and Angkor Thom are located. The buildings are smaller in scale, and more approachable. The temple is built largely of red sandstone, which makes some of the wall carvings stand out. Combine a visit to this temple with a visit to the nearby Landline Museum.
Worth the drive. Although a good drive from Siam Reap MAKE THE JOURNEY. Red stones and beautifully carved. Beautifully restored. Can do this Banteay Samre and then the northern temples in 1 day.

Small and pretty. After all the great temples we've seen, this was sort of a let down. We were spoiled after being in big jungle temples by ourselves. Banteay Srei is a tourist attraction, busloads of tourists are dropped there. It is a small temple, so it gets crowed quickly. If you have your heart set on visiting, go very early in the morning of sometime during lunch, when there is a hour or so when the morning buses have left and the afternoon buses haven't arrived yet. You only need a hour to visit this temple.

One of my favorite places!. This temple was so cool. About an hour away from Siem Reap but totally worth it. I really enjoyed the drive through the countryside with beautiful rice paddies and villages along the way.

My favorite place in Siem Reap. My friend and I went here on our third day. Hired a tuktuk c/o our hotel (45USD) whole day, and the place is really nice and picturesque. They have a mini museum just before you enter the temples, and that was very educational too.

A must visit place. In a rush for temple hopping, you are bound to skip a few temples after you realise that at some point they all start looking similar..but certainly not this one. Beanteay srei is an hour's drive from angkor wat but a must visit place and certainly a highlight of my trip. This is a hindu temple dedicated to lord shiva and hasnt suffered extensive damage to the artwork unlike other temples and it is stunning. And the best part is you can combine with a trip to landmine museum which is halfway between angkor and banteay srei. On the way you can cover few places which are best enjoyed from tuk tuk like srah srei(a massive rectangular water storage reservoir and another spot for watching sunrise after angkor) and pre rup temple(massive temple but suffered a lot of damage). On your way back, you can cover phimeneakas, elephant terrace and terrace of the leper king. So this circuit has plenty to offer once you are done with big three(angkor wat, ta prohm and bayon).

Love this temple!. A must see! Your trip to the Angkor archeological site is not complete without seeing this beautiful temple. We both absolutely loved this temple. The carvings are incredible. You can even miss out Angkor Wat so long as you see Banteay Srei! We also took a short boat ride back to car park - it was lovely and peaceful. Of course you can just walk back!
Detail. The forest is part of the scenery which has so much duty one can hardly take it all in.Once back at the guest house I found myself going over the details again to take it all in

Very nice temple.. I went to this temple with my friend. This temple about 37 km from the town.I rent a Turk tuk for see this temple. It is cover by the for rest. On the way you can see the riew of the rice field is very beauty full. I saw also the peoples do the saucer palm. We spend about 1hours we arrive to banteay Srei. We see this temple with gold ston. And scuture IIT is so wonder full. this temple small but very nice.
Not so big!. Nice temple here, but not so big, you shouldn't need too long here but it is quite a journey away but a nice one at that, good scenery on route

The most beautiful part of Angkor Archeological Park. For me, this is the most beautiful part of Angkor Archeological Park. The carvings on the statues and stones are intricately designed and it was extensively carved. It is very amazing how people from the 9th to 13th century in Cambodia was able to think about creating a magnificent civilization with such an amazing culture.

The ladies' temple - magnificent. Delicate, precious, refined, in pink sandstone, this temple stands out in the Abgkor Wat region, and is a clear must for all. As we were told, best visiting times are early morning or late afternoon.

Combine the visit with Banteay Samre. This is what the locals called Female Temple.
It is well worth the visit as it displays some of the finest examples of classical Khmer art. The temple is located 38km from Siem Reap. Go early as it is becoming an important tourists spot especially for large tourist group.

Such intricate carvings!. The "Citadel of Women" as it's translated in English is a truly awe-inspiring temple. The carvings here are the deepest of any of the temples we visited. Built in AD967, it is truly a sight to see. Some of the carvings look like they were done within the past decade, not 1000+ years ago!While this is a bit of a trek from Siem Reap City, it is well worth it. A lot of the large tour companies think so, too...so be prepared for large busses FULL of tourists. It can be tricky to get decent landscape photos without a ton of people in the field of view. I suggest heading outside the facility, along the corner of the moat, and capturing some expansive views with reflections in the water. You can also get good close-up shots inside the parameters of the temple.

A Lovely Little Gem!. We visited Banteay Srei as part of our visits to various temples near Angkor Wat recently. Banteay Srei is also referred to as the Ladies Temple, because legend has it that it was built by ladies, because no man could ever manage the intricate artwork.It has beautiful pink stone work, and the artwork is mostly intact, beautiful flowers and carvings adorne the walls. It is smaller than most of the other temples, but nevertheless just as interesting. It is in remarkable condition, having been built in the 9th century.We enjoyed this temple, having been brought there by John Sochheat, our driver, and his guide, Sim Sophath, and Sim brought it all to life with his explanations of the history of the temple.Lyn and David, Brisbane, Australia.

One of my very favorites..the Pink Lady... The locals call this temple the Pink Lady and it's made with sandstone that gives it a pink cast especially in the early morning. It has incredible carvings in it and I thought it was one of the most beautiful temples. This is a little further out than some of the other temples so you may want to go by car instead of a tuk tuk..

Spoilt by the threatening behaviour of police.. The temple itself is beautiful, and we'll worth the visit. I can't tell you more than previous posters have done, but just a word to the wise 're the behaviour of the police at the temple. We were the first there at 7am, apart from a couple of police. One of them offered to give us a closer look at the temple (which is cordoned off) for a donation. The guy was great, very knowledgeable and afterwards we gave him some money, he disappeared and all seemed fine. A few minutes later another policeman came over trying to sell us replica police badges which we did not want. He then became quite aggressive asking us how much we'd paid his colleague. We declined to tell him, and he became quite threatening insisting we had to tell him as he was the police. He followed us around the temple becoming more and more annoyed until we had to leave. Ultimately he spoilt it for us.
Don't miss this one!. Even if this temple is farther, it's worth a visit. We went by tuk tuk from Siem Reap and we combined the visit with Kbal Spean falls.
Remarkable carvings. Not so big and so a long stay is not necessary but look carefully at the carvings which are cut from sandstone in great detail
The Pink Temple. About 40 minutes away from the main temple, this one is well worth the drive. The temple has beautiful carvings and is also very peaceful. The drive too is very scenic.
Architecture similar to Angkor Thom. Similar to Angkor Thom. Less detailed inscrpted carvings but still fascinating. Lots of walking and climbing.

Lady Temple. After the grand temples at the Ankor Wat and Ankor Thom sites, the 'Lady Temple' is a welcome break. It is very endearing and easier to appreciate as it is quite small. If you have the chance to visit, I would recommend it as it is quite different from the other sites.

Great to see if you have few days extra. We had 5 days and great trip to combine out of Siam Reap. We took the tour with Kulen waterfall. Bhutan temple and the lung as river. Banteay Srei as very nice and different style and colour. Easy to walk and smaller temple. Like it very much. Well organised.
