Great trip in country side and noticed many tuk tuk for there only, not the mountain. Good to go.

Amazing sculptures - The original name was Iswarapura - City of Iswara ( a name of Lord Shiva). I was amazed at the preserved intricate carvings/sculptures - very well preserved. These were built by a priest (commissioned by one) and as a token of respect to the royal constructions - made sure that the scale is very tiny compared to the royal projects. Has so many depictions of Indian stories. You can see Indra on Iravata, Lord Narasimha and Many more. Must see!

Temple remains beautiful, we'd go back for lunch. Not our first time to Banteay Srei, its one of our favourites. This trip our guide suggested a restaurant on the road back to Siem Reap, Rong Cham Angkor and the food, service and ambience were great.There's Amok and there is Amok. This is one of the more sophisticated version with a wonderful balance of complex falvours. Beef with peper, salt and lime juice was a revelation, the wonderful bite of lots of fresh ginger with pork, and a great dish of morning glory. Beer was cold and staff were friendly.After a morning of temples, stop of for lunch and recharge your batteries.

Delicate and in really good condition. The quality of the carving at this temple is astounding considering it's age and the minimal restoration that has been undertaken. Be aware that some of the pieces are reproductions as the originals are in various museums.
Small but beautiful. The detail of the stone work is well worth a visit, can get very busy as its a smaller area, but still what's a few minutes waiting for that perfect photo.

Women power. A sandstone temple dominated by intricate carvings done by women. According to our guide this is because the carvings are so detailed and intricate they could only have been done by women. So we did have craftswomen in those early centuries. This is a very small temple and well laid out that you can stand at the entrance and be able to see the exit point.There is very informative display board at the information counter which shows when Banteay Srei was built and compares it to the building of other temples in the world.
Amazing place. Lovely to take your time & wander around getting a feel for the place. Carvings & sculptures amazing. Good walking shoes a must!

Worth the Drive. This "Lady Temple" is outside of the main area of the park, so you have to drive for a bit to get there. The setting, the statues, and the preservation level all make it worth it the drive. There were quite a few people when we were there, making it difficult to get any great photos, and the central portion of the temple is off limits to visitors, so you just walk the perimeter. While that was a little disappointing (there is definitely no exploring to be had here), the beauty was still worth the trip.

Great temple. GO!. Possibly the most beautiful temple we visited. Definitely worth checking out. It's preserved so beautifully and the journey there is an experience in its own right. Make sure to check out the butterflies as well.

Interesting. Even for someone like me who isn´t actually too much into history, architecture, temples ("Have you seen one you have seen them all"-attitute), I really enjoyed spending 1 hour at Banteay Srei.I think 1 hour is enough if you just want to get a feel for the place and "soak up the atmosphere".Well worth a visit although it is a bit further away from town than many of the other temples.

Beautiful detailed carvings. This temple is a lot further away from Siem Reap than the well known ones. There was still a lt of people there on the day that I visited, though.
Banteay Srei is quite a small temple but the detailed and rich carvings make it well worth a visit!

Only if have 3+ days. If you have 2 days only, do not go to this temple. It is far from all the other temples and costs more money to get to... It is not worth the time. If you have a 3rd or maybe 4th day available, try it. If you decide to visit this temple include the landmine museum on the route since it is on the way to the temple and takes 30-40 minutes to visit and is totally worth the visit. Compared to the other temples, there is nothing special in particular to this one.

Dont miss this!. Angkor Wat in miniature? Pretty pink stones? Fantastic carvings? Picturesque setting? Bit of a Schlep to get to from Siem Reap?Well yes, its all of these but definitely a key temple to visit. Compared to everything else which is pretty much close to town, this temple is a long way out and takes planning to get to if your time is limited. I particularly liked how small and compact it is: almost like the planning model for the more elaborate and grander scale versions of what came later. All the usual gift stores abound plus a few reasonable placed to eat. The only annoying but is that you have to walk though the stalls with the rather bored shopkeepers making small talk (otherwise known as touts) to leave the site and head across to your transport.
Beautiful. Again, one of the most beautiful places that cannot be described in words. A bit far from the main town but worth traveling.

Out of the way, but worth it!. Banteay Srei is a bit of a drive from Siem Reap and the Angkor complex, but totally worth it. First of all, you get to see some countryside, and gain some insight into how people live outside of the city. Second, you get to see a temple that is different and somehow better preserved than those at the larger Angkor complex. The crowds are thinner, the carvings are more impressive, and the temple's story is worth learning. Take the trip, its worth it!

Amazing 'kawings'!. While most people are raving to see Angkor Wat, Bayon and Ta Prohm, I would recommend you not to miss visiting Banteay Srei. The kawing or carvings in each temples are all well defined and preserved up to this date. Back in the days, people used pink sandstone to build this place which gives you the pinkish / redish color as you enter the temple. It is a fairly small temple but it is worth the time.

Stunning. It is not called the "Citadel of Beauty" for nothing. This miniature style temple in comparison with the likes of Angkor Wat, has stunningly beautiful stone carvings and ancient script dedicated to Shiva. The colour of the stone lends itself to the lush green surroundings and makes for great photo opportunities. There also used to be a moat on this site. Child vendors will follow you up the entrance of this temple trying to sell postcards and the like and can be quite persistent even when you say "no". There is a very good line of stalls on your way to the exit and vendors sell some very nice clothing, gifts and bags (i.e. baggy summer cotton trousers US$ 3) worth a stop for sure.

Gorgeous. I really enjoyed how detailed the carvings were at Banteay Srei, and it was interesting to see a red (or pink) sandstone temple. The buildings themselves are also relatively small (it's not a huge complex), and it was a good contrast to the other temples I visited.Banteay Srei is a bit of a ways away from the main group of temples, but definitely worth a visit. I combined it with a trip to Kbal Spean, so we rented a car rather than take a tuk-tuk. The air conditioning felt like a blessing when we got back in.Banteay Srei is pretty exposed, and I felt like I was baking in the sun when I was there. So be prepared and bring a LOT of water. Like a comical amount of water. And please cover your knees and shoulders, don't be that person who thinks the rules don't apply to them.
Come if you have time. Both Angkor Thom and Angkor Wat are must visit places even you are not temples crazy people :)But this is a bit far from town, you may skip if you have limited time.
Lady Temple. Gorgeous sandstone with a pink hue encases the best carvings of all the temples...and when the afternoon sun hits, this temple glows the most beautiful colours. A really beautiful place
Wow. The trek out adds about $5 to the cost of the tuk tuk but it is well worth it. There are so many temples to choose from but this one should be on the agenda.

Lady's Temple. I believe this to be a solely Hindu Temple rather than Buddhist. Its location is quite away away from Siem Reap's main area and Angkor Wat but very much worth the trip. We didn't use a motorbike trailer (yuktuk) The carvings are in greater relief than at other sites and more delicate. The site itself is beautiful with many mature trees and water around the temple.

Well preserved vs other temples. Our guide told us that this temple was made by the King for his wife. It is not a huge complex but it is well preserved and indeed very beautiful. Worth a visit for sure... The carvings are very beautiful.
The Prettiest!. I found this temple the prettiest one.. a lot of reliefs and pinnacles surrounded by water... just lovely. Worth the further drive!

Nice red temple - a must see in siem reap. I was amazed by the temple built by pink sand stone. It looked different from the others. The distance is abit far from the main site. But, it worth traveling the distance. The temple is not a big temple. It has it own style that is different from others. One thing I don't like is when we exit from the temple, someone look like a police man trying to offer a ride with 1 dollar, after we rejected him, he counter offer selling police batch. This is a disgrace to himself as a police.
Wet day beauty. A truly beautiful experience even on a miserably wet day. Would recommend good walking shoes and carry an umbrella just in case.

The Jewel of Ankor. The pink "lady built" temple is strikingly different. Some say that Ankor Watt was inspired by this temple, but this temple preceded Ankor Watt by a thousand years. Amazingly carved with great preservation of the delicate work. My favorite. Best seen in the early am because of it's small size, it can get really crowded.

Beautiful but crowded. Wow, given this is a fair trip out from Siem Reap, we were amazed how busy it was. Feels the most 'developed' from a tourism perspective as there is a whole complex of shops, restaurants and a visitor centre. Some may appreciate these additions, but we preferred the less touristy sites. Still worth the trip as the temple is simply beautiful, just be prepared for the crowds!

worth the extra distance. This lovely pink sandstone temple is heavily carved with intricate pattern, script and symbols. Well out of the main temple area but still an easy trip, i think it was one of the highlights for me. If you have the time combine it to the grand tour or make an additional trip with others further out.

Beautiful and delicate. We immensely enjoyed our visit here. It's further from Siem Reap than the majority of the Ankgor temples - about an hour by tuk-tuk. However the journey is picturesque and gave us the opportunity to see more of the Cambodian countryside.The site itself has more organised facilities for tourists than many others, and perhaps fewer (but no less insistent) people trying to sell things.The temple is beautiful. It is smaller than most, the stone is a different, pinker, shade and the level of detail much more intricate. There is a lovely moat surrounding the temple.Definitely worth making the trip.

great temple for people who like red color. everything is in red! full of intricate carvings and tour groups. the temple is quite small, but comes with a botanical gardens and exhibition which we skipped due to a lack of interest.
Beautiful place. It's one of another places I like because it's still not destroyed and you can see the arts on the wall really clear. It's out of the town, so it's still good.
Fantastic Temple. Less popular, but very interesting temple. 3 different types of sandstone used to build it and incredible detail. Highly recommended and easily explored.

Worth the Extra Mile. I've read that Banteay Srei is really beautiful and should not be missed. The other reviews are absolutely right!The extra 1:30 ride going back and forth was worth it. After the Angkor Wat sunrise and tour, we went to Banteay Srei. At first, I was worrying if it was worth our time. When we got there, my heart sank a bit because it's mostly ruins and it's just a little temple compared to Angkor Wat. But later on as we've come to the main area, I noticed what makes it special. Other reviews have mentioned about the carvings. I realized that's what makes it different.The carvings are very intricate and detailed in Banteay Srei. If you look closely, every carvings tells a different story. I just couldn't imagine how they did these from way back. Or how long it took to create it. We are lucky enough that these were preserved. The red sandstone helps this temple to stand out from the rest too.You could have breakfast here as well. They've got eateries by the exit. But the prices are really high. Since we're asians, we got a lower price than what the menu says. Better to haggle. Or some say bring your tuktuk driver with you to get a better price.It was good timing too that we went here early at least not a lot of people were there already.

Beautiful temple !. While most of tourist go to see Angkor Wat ( which is beautiful indeed) I was suprised by the carvings and color of this temple located 1h from Siem Reap. Best moment for visit around 6h30-7 am. I was almost alone in this magic place...Loved it.

Well worth the drive - combine with Kbal Spean for a good day out. By far the smallest of all the temples, but also with the most beautiful carvings. It has a really intimate feel. Good for an hour [two if you really into temples and history]. Worth combining with either hiking Kbal Spean or the Angkor wildlife Conservation Center [ACC], which are just another 10 minutes up the road. On the way back you have the Butterfly center and Landmine museum all on the same road

Beautiful place but a bit overrated.... Most of the travel guide books I've seen call this temple a gem of Angkor architecture and this is fully deserved. However, keep several things in mind. 1) This temple is fairly small and located some 20 km away from the rest of Angkor complex, it is however on the same road as the Kulen mountain, so combining those two things together will save a lot of transportation time. 2) After visiting other Angkor attractions, including Angkor Wat, where people wounder freely and touch anything they want, except for very few particularly delicate carvings or dangerous ruins whicj are fenced, here you'll find many 'do not touch' signs and many fences which not only limit what you can touch, but also what you can see: we were unable to get anywhere close to the famous carvings which are advertised in the guide books. I would also recommend an early morning visit, as there is no shade to hide in. There is also a very nice souvenir market on this site, which has big variety of wood and stone carvings.

This must have been carved by women. Often called "the Lady temple" it is decorated on all its pink sandstone surfaces with exquisite detail and is well preserved. It is mid tenth C and rightly called "the Jewel of Khmer art". It is 34 k from Siem Reap so a car is advised especially if you add on Beng Mealea which is another hour away. Buy the Angkor Guidebook -your essential guide to the temples. Superb reconstructive overlays and a ton of information. A guide is a good idea. We used Prin Sok (Sok) and he is excellent in English and Thai 092228628. You can find him on trip advisor. This is a must not miss

Beautiful Temple Beautiful Carvings. Battery Srei is often referred to as the 'Jewel' in the Angkorian crown and one cannot complain with that description. The carvings are the most delicate and intricate of all the sites and it is amazing how intact and clear most of the details still are.

Beautiful carvings. The carvings at this temple are definitely the most detailed and in tact that we saw (we visited 13 of the Angkor temples in total), it's amazing how clear they still are after all this time! Although still very Angkorian in style, it has a distinctly different feel, this may be because it was the only temple which wasn't commissioned by a Monarch.We passed here at lunchtime on our way to Kbal Spean and the car park was packed, when we returned later in the afternoon it was even busier which meant continuously queuing behind tour groups to get a quick look at the carvings. Maybe if you get there first thing in the morning you could avoid the crowds and really explore it properly.

Lovely but busy. Go early as many tourists buses. I had a private tour, loads of information given. It is known as the Jewel of Angkor. Intricate carvings, fascinating the history. If you don't have the park ticket. No go. I bought a three day ticket that lasts for one week. $40us. This temple has its own souvenir market, which I didn't know about until after my tour. Would have like to stop for a bit longer but the day was very full. This temple is approximately 40 kms outside of Siem Reap. Takes about 1 hour drive.
THE Boutique temple of Angkor. Yes, it is really beautiful. Small temple made of sandstone. Glows in sunlight. Intricate Carvings. Very different from the other temples in Angkor. Worth visiting.

Beautiful. The lady temple. Craving is less harsh, Small but beautiful however it is not everyone cup of tea. I enjoyed the journey there more than the temple itself. You get to see villages, the way of life in various villages in the tuktuk en-route to this temple. I won't allocate a day to visit this site.

The Prettiest Temple in Siem Reap. Banteay Srei is set quite a distance from the main Angkor Complex, but the 40-60 minute tuk tuk ride there is well worth it not only to see the intricately carved temple in pink but also to appreciate the rural landscape in Siem Reap all along the way to the attraction. Set in the midst of greenery, the temple is much more peaceful and less crowded that the ones in the main complex. It has a good visitor centre too with toilets and snack kiosks. The Landmine Museum along the way to Banteay Srei is a recommended stop not so much for the museum itself, but for getting insights into the tragedy that the landmines brought upon the people of Cambodia.

Temple Visit. We booked a car to drive us around for half a day. We made our first stop at the Temple of Women. We arrived at 9.30am. It was already very hot and very busy with large tour groups.I would recommend arriving earlier to avoid the crowds.The temple was beautiful with some of the most intricate carvings and designs. Definitely worth a visit!
It's just OK. Maybe we had already seen too many temples, but it was not as impressive as Angkor Wat and Angkor Thom.
Beauty in pink!. Definitely the most intricately carved of all Angkorian Temples. The bricks give it a pinkish tinge which adds to its beauty. Nice carvings about Shiva and Ramayana!

Also known as Thribhuvana Maheshwara temple. It is one of the recently built temples (meaning after the Angkor wat temples were built). The temple is dedicated to lord Shiva. It is 25kms away from the main temples of Angkor wat but beautiful nonetheless.
Nice temple. It's small temple, but amazing art reflection. I can see the sculptures are still alive along the wall and pillars.It's really nice to see.

Must see if you have a time. Banteay Srei is a bit far away from Angkor Wat area. You have to book Tuk Tuk to reach there. If you have a time I suggest you to visit. It also rock building but it has a pink tint from different material from others. Not only color but their details is more beautiful. Don't miss it!!!

Lady temple, how great it is?. I had 3 full days to explore temples in Siem Reap. There were only 2 for my most favorite temples. Banteay Srei is one of them. It is just about 40 km from Siem Reap to the temple. The details of the base-relief is really touched me. I can not tell how detail it was, but really want to do that again.
Must be seen. The detail and small scale of this site encourages you to slow down and just sit and interpret closely the detail , skill and craftsmanship involved in this temple

Tuk tuk to Banteay Srei. Banteay Srei was my father's favourite of all the temples we visited.I have to say it was one of the best. The carvings there are said to be some of the best on earth and you can see why! They are incredibly well preserved and so intricately detailed.It took us an hour and 20 minutes to get there from Siem Reap in a tuk tuk but the rods are paved the whole way and there is lots of countryside to see on the way. It didn't seem like it had taken a long.It is best to take your time looking around as the temple is only small but there is lots to see.A must visit if you have the time.

Our favorite temple in Angkor. This temple is 2 centuries older that Angkor Vat. It is much smaller and peaceful than other temples around Siem Reap. Most of the temple used to be buried and therefore is well preserved. Totally different feeling from other sites as no tree is expanding on the roofs here. Wonderful bas-reliefs, which reflect the artistic genius of human kind across space and time.Bring hat, umbrella, water.

Nice, but crowded. This site is, by far, the most crowded in the angkor area. Definitely worth seeing for the colors and fine details, but be prepared for the crowds. I hear it's crowded there everyday.

Beautiful but sometimes very crowded. Banteay Srei is a really small temple well outside of Angkor Tome. It has marvelous details and easy to navigate. It is very different from other temples in Angkor. However, when the large tour busses arrive – you may risk standing in line for quite some time as the temple is very small. Not a "must see", but a nice addition when combined with something else.
Temple visit. We came here for sunset! Absolutely beautiful views! One of my favorite temples to see in angkor wat!
Just beautiful. All this carving, red stones.. Its small but very beautiful. Its a bit far from another temples , but must visit

An amazing and intricate work of art!. Banteay Srei was easily one of my favorites. The carvings are so intricate and perfect. The restoration was so well done! Also the drive out to the temple (38km) is a nice and relaxing one, allowing you to see some countryside and pull out more stories from your tour guide on the way!

Bike ride to Banteay Srei. If you get chance hire a bike and ride the 40km out to Banteay Srei. I've been twice, once in a van and 2nd on a mountain bike ride out there, to be honest I got so much more out of the bike ride and found i spent more time reflecting around the temple instead of being mini vanned around temple to temple. So much to see on the way and reward is much more once your there.
Beautiful temple!. Different from Angkor Wat, the carvings are a bit different and yet very beautiful. Though it is a bit far, it definitely worths a visit!
Wonderful Carving. As with all the other temples in the area, the buildings and carvings are a wonder to behold. Just fantastic and breathtaking
Our favorite temple for its high quality pediment carvings!. Tiny in comparison, but this temple offers the best carvings. Check out the pediments on the two libraries!
Early evening viewing. At last, a temple that is different in color. A more 'delicate' structure, not as 'in-your-face' as Angkor Wat etc.

Banteay Srei. Banteay Srei is about 30ks from Siem Reap & is a smallish temple compared to Angkor Wat. It's very easy to walk round as it is all flat ground. Good for people with walking difficulties. It can get quite crowded but it is a beautiful place. It's good to include a stop at the butterfly farm which is only a 10 min drive away. Good to do it in a tuk tuk!

Miniature and full of detail. This is a bit further out of the main cluster and definitely worth the extra effort. It is tiny yet exquisitely carved. There is a also a little lake next to it which makes for pretty photos of the reflection.
Worth the journey. You cannot come to Siem Reap and not visit this site. Truly beautiful. The tuk tuk ride out is through villages and daily life is on display.

Much farther out of the city but well worth a visit!. Initially we weren't going to go to Banteay Srei as its a 45 minute drive from Siem Reap but one of our group was very keen so off we went. Totally different to the other temples as its much smaller and stands alone so it tends to be less busy but the intricate carvings are better even than Angkor Wat. If you can fit this in, you won't be disappointed.
clay rock. It is amazing to see the special clay that turned into very strong rock and also the amazing sculptures on the monument. It is a must visit place.

Beautiful Architecture!. I absolutely loved walking around Angkor Wat and all its splendor. Banteay Srei was one of the best kept architecture there with such a beautiful design. This was one of the most impressive temples I have ever seen anywhere in the World!

Lady temple. This temple is located a bit outside the main temple area. It is not as large as some of the main temples, but it is worth the visit as it offers perhaps the most skillfully carved sculpures and decorations in the entire Angkor area. There is a nice restaurant next to the temple.
So worth it!. It is out of the way and about 40km from Siem Reap but so worth the drive. The best preserved most intracately carved temple we saw.
Small but perfectly formed!. Smaller of the temples, but as others have said...so beautiful...in fact my favourite! Angkor Wat, may be grander, but this little gem is magical.

Outside of Siem Reap, worth a visit. 45-60 minutes by tuk tukSee the beautiful countryside on the waySmall templePink sandstone Minimal restorationWalk around the temple, you can't walk in the main part.Great photos with the temple, trees and reflection in the water.Few hawkers as per all temples in Siem reapClean toiletsFood/water availableHot during the day, minimal shade whilst taking the tour, plenty of trees to sit under afterwards.A few tourist shops/stalls at the main entrance.Go to Banteay Srei first then see Banteay Samre on your way back (also very hot).We passed the landmine museum on the way back (not our thing).You can also loop in part of the "grand circuit" temples on the way back into Siem Reap.Put aside 4 hours to get to Banteay Srei & Banteay Samre and back at a comfortable place.Try early morning before 10am or late afternoon after 2pm to avoid heat and tourist buses.

Just beautiful.. A few kilometres out if town. But definitely worth the journey. This temple has been carved in pink sandstone and restorative works have begun to preserve the integrity of its original structure. The reliefs on the stone predate the Angkor wat temple.

Stunning stonework carvings, beautiful setting. If you are spending more than one day in Siem Riep this is a must do. Stunningly intricate carvings and stonework and a beautiful setting. The drive to the site is in itself very pleasant, past little villages and rice fields as well, which adds to the experience. Much more organised than the other temple sites, with clean toilets, little shops, cafe and visitor centre.

Beautiful. This is my favourite temple because of the beautiful colours and the fine details of the carvings. It is 35 kilometres north of Siem Reap so is about an hour by tuktuk. It is quite small compared to those further south, but delightful. En route you can see palm sugar being stirred or mango leather cooked. It is a lovely ride through villages and rice paddies.

Small but full of charm. Note1: further distance, many prefer cabs and tuk tuks but you can take a bike! They're $1usd and most come with locks, not that you really need them. Some routes/circuits are 10-12km, but you obviously don't have to follow the recommended three day tours. Biking allowed us to observe daily life in the rural areas outside the temples as well as Siem Reap as a whole.Note 2: do not go ticketless! They will fine you. Grab tickets en route to the temple roads, on your right approx. 3km before arriving at a fork in the road. Angkor is to the left of the fork. Note 3: Money is changed in USD, Cambodia uses the reil as change, like cents. Note4: snack stands and beverages available near Angkor Wat - restaurants too, and vendors line up near other temples. Prices slightly elevated but it's not ridiculous inflation.

Very busy but still awesome. This has been the busiest of the temples we have visited. It's a wonderful wee temple with a big moat. Gorgeous carvings. Had to say no to three security guys trying to sell police badges. Also the women in the market were pretty feisty so be prepared to walk through that on the way to your transportation.

One of the smaller temples of Angkor. Banteay Srei is smaller than Angkor Wat or Ta Prohm, but worth a visit just the same. Unlike Angkor Wat or Bayon, this temple is reasonably flat and one that you could tour on a rainy day (the others would be downright dangerous due to slick stones. Banteay Srei has a different look and feel to it than Angkor Wat, Ta Prom, and Angkor Thom, with stone statues of monkeys and warriors, and intricate stone carvings in high relief. I recommend it.

Essential part of visit to Angkor Wat.. Beautiful, stunning architecture like all of the Angkor Wat sites. Good fun for all of the family with elephant rides available nearby. Watch out (listen) for the mahout playing familiar tunes such as jingle bells, happy birthday, etc on kazoo as he rides around the area.

Fantastic detail but a bit of a drive. We did the drive out to Banteay srei as it is known for have some of the most intricate carvings on the temple tour. Whilst the red temple certainly contrasts with many of the other temples, like Angkor Wat, and the details are very good, the temple didn't make as big an impact with the family as some of the other sites. If you d make the trip out i'd suggest stopping off at the landline museum on the way back as you pass it.

It's not the size that matters!. Although a lot smaller than I first thought this temple is just beautiful. Banteay Srei means "Citadel of Women," and features magnificent delicate carvings in deep red sandstone. Not to be missed.
Beautiful place!. After looking the Temple just need going t the River/Lagoon side in Where you can rent a little wood boat. Full or lottus flowers, totally worth it. Very nice experience!
One of the most beautiful stone carvings.. The deep stone carvings make Banteay Srei, one of the must-see attractions when you visit Siem Reap, Cambodia.

The pink temple. The carvings at this temple are much more intricate than at any of the others that we visited. The stone is a beautiful pink colour. The facilities here are more modern than at some of the other temples.

Small in comparison to others in area but a real gem. This was my favourite temple that we visited while in the Siem Reap area. It was smaller and less crowded - with amazing cravings and details. A must see!

A delightful place to visit, and worth the hour trip or so. So this is the "lady" temple and is characterised by its red stone. It is also a good 45min away from Angkor Watt so I would recommend going there on a different day. Maybe do Angkor Watt, Angkor Thom and the surrounding temples in one day, and the Banteay Sreai, the Angkor Animal place and the Cambodian Landmine museum on a separate day as they are all relatively close together.
Little Gem. Thank you my guide for showing me this one without extra charge. It is absolutely incredible subculture on a pinky stone. A must visit together just one day with Angkor Wat.

Busy . It's at the end of the grand tour built luckily we did it at the beginning of the trip and were able to stop off at the land mine museum which is a place not to be missed. The temple itself great and a pleasant walk round it as well to get some different views

Worth going all the way to see. This temple is a long way from Siem Reap, especially by tuk tuk, but you will get to see a lot of the countryside. Even though it is a long way you can still expect a lot of tourists but you will still be able to get some good photos if you are patient. Facilities are very good here. The pink sandstone carvings are amazing and after seeing them it is harder to enjoy the weathered carvings on most of the other temples. This can be combined with visits to the landline museum and the butterfly farm as well as a few other temples on the way back.
Temple of the Women. Called temple of the women because of its intense intricate detailed carvings, believing that only women could have accomplished such beautay.

Another beautiful sight. Beautiful temple. We visited a lot of them during our stay and each had its own special things to offer. The colors here were amazing and we stopped at a small roadside traditional Khmer restaurant on our way to have a delicious lunch as well. Worth the extra drive out to see it.

Very beautiful and stunning lady temple!. This is beautiful! It looks like a pinkish temples from far, it located in a beautiful greenish garden. It's small but has the unique cravings! Walk around and enjoy the sandstone craving, find out the most beautiful lady cravings and it will amazed you!! Tips: Please don't miss any cravings, cheers! :)

A Must See, Mesmerizing, Enchanting, Awesome!. Visited this site which is a 30 km drive from the town of Siem Reap but well worth the visit. The sandstone carvings and temple site is spectacular, and off the beaten path as one would notice no crowds of tourist in sight. No tour buses or vans outside, mostly tuk-tuk's and private cars at this site. Great photo op when visiting early morning or late afternoon.Go see it!
The most beatiful carving in Angkor. The most beatiful carving in Angkor, my husband and i like it very much, and will be back after sunrise next time
Banteay Srei. This was an interesting temple to visit but worth it. Has some beautiful bas reliefs about it and in a beautiful area out through the countryside.We used our temple pass for this entry
Most intricate carvings. Small and intricate temple set out in the countryside well worth the drive out. Has nice visitor center.
Beautiful veiws and quited to visit with friends.. Bantey srey is very beautiful in this temples area that i've known and I really love how is based just in the countryside.

Monument of Love. This Temple was built for a Queen. It is a very small complex and somewhat underwhelming after seeing so many Majestic Temple complexes.I would not make a special trip out to see it.We combined it with a trip to the Army base, rather a contradicting day but we enjoyed both the serenity of the temple and the fun we had with the weapons.I took a bottle of duty free Johnny Green with me to the Army barracks and they shouted me a few clips for the shots we all shared

Small, but worth the effort to see it. The buildings are different from the other temples. The stone is multicolored and the engravings are intricate. The area of the temple is compact.
I like the contrast of this temple to the bigger main Angkor Wat.
Worth the effort to see it.

Ancient grandeur. After a while it becomes difficult to recall the precise details of each of the temples in the entire Angkor complex. The area covered is simply staggering and the work involved quite overwhelming.the pink sandstone carvings of this complex are really well worth a visit. Much quieter than many of the other temples you can get some moments of peace and simply reflect and marvel at the faith, workmanship and sheer organisation to construct such buildings using manual labour. The skill in cutting and dressing stone alone is something which puts European skills to shame in the same era.
Stunning temple. Another great temple visit. If you are into photography, make sure you catch this one very early in the morning for the light.

Beautiful temple. You must visit this temple. It is different from the others in that the stone is a pink colour. The magnificent carving are so detailed that you will have trouble believing that they are so old. This was my favourite temple

One of the Best. About 40km outside of Siem Reap, theis is one Temple not to be missed, called the 'Womens Temple' because of all the beautiful,carvings the still remain on most areas of the Temple. Red clay coloured and surrounded by a small mote. We traveled here first thing in the morning arriving around 8:30, this was good because the tourist busses usually go to Angkor Wat first thing in the morning and ther were. Not to many people here( they did turn up around) 10:00 just as we were preparing to leave.Don,t forget to visit the small display near the toilets that show some photos of the temple work being down in Angkor.

Absolutely beautiful!. It's a little bit far from the city area (about 1 hour by tuk tuk) but you must go to see this beautiful female temple. this temple is older than Ankor Wat and better condition of cavings, I think.

Not worth the long way. A small tempel and it's about 70km extra so if you there with a tuktuk the driver will ask you for about 10$ more and that's not worth it.Beside the temple you can do there small boat tours and as everywhere they have plenty of souvenier sellers.
Great experience. If you are a Hindu Indian do not miss this - and be sure to take a guide and spend lots of time. Take a torch and binoculars

Beautiful, pink stone carvings!. The Banteay Srei is slightly further away than the other Angkor temples (40 km or so), but definitely worth the trip. The stone is a different colour to the other temples and so the carvings are even more extravagant and defined.
Worth the visit. It was very much worth it, despite the longer tuk tuk drive from Siem Reap. Very different temple from the rest of Angkor Wat
Don't miss this temple!. Banteay Srei is 37km from the city, this temple is small size but Its different and made from pink sandstone and the carvings is so nice and details.

it's all in the details. The amount of detailing is incredible. Every aspect was seen too. The beauty and time put into this monument is unthinkable. The fact that those details remain to this day is something to be grateful for.
Beautiful temple worth visiting. Don't miss this temple. It is made from pink sandstone. Has intricate beauty and lovely bas-relief carvings.

Picturesque temple worth the detour. Banteay Srei makes a very strong impression thanks to its charm and relatively small size. It is definitely worth the detour away from the more central parts of Angkor.
Don't miss this charming red sandstone temple with all its detailed carvings.

Touristy temple. Enjoyed the drive to Banteay Srei, through local villages. The temple is the most touristy of all, formed carparks, tourist desk, large market. A lot of hawkers in the grounds.
Beautiful temple but not as WOW as I expected from the reviews
A world heritage site not to be missed.. Another fantastic temple in the Angkor Wat area. Different from the other temples, yet a once in a life time experience. A must see.

A bit far but features the most impressive stone carvings.. If you have half a day spare these small temples with a pinkish sandstone hue are a must visit, particularly to admire the amazing workmanship of the stone carvings, the best in the Park. The temple is however a good 35-40km away from Siem Reap. My recommendation is to get here as early as possible to avoid the tour groups.

Beautiful small temple. This temple is a bit far for the rest but it's very beautiful. It's small and the orange colour gives a nice athmosphere especially if there are not many people as it was our case.

Amazing Ancient Architectural Artwork. This temple located a bit far from Angkor Wat (approximately 30-33km). I personally like the fine architectural artwork of Banteay Srei Temple ..the structure of this temple is a bit different from Angkor Wat ..and there are lots of "frame inside the frame" structures in this temple ..a great spot to take photo ..But I would not recommend you for the sight seeing in the boat provided nearby ..as the water of the lake is bit dirty and smelly..
Worth a Visit. The pink stone is a very beautiful as a backdrop to the intricate carvings. It is worth visiting as part of visiting the other bigger name ruins.

Perfection. Banteay Srei is a piece of perfection, it is a different from all other Angkor temples, the color of it's rocks and the details gives a unique look, over time the Banteay Srei had gotten more beautiful, with its red color rocks bordered by the green trees, plus it is surrounded with a lake and the whole scene is breathtaking.
The beauty of Pink temple. Pretty enough for the Banteay Srei that I visited last 2 months ago. I am still memerizing about it.

Fantastic temple whose detail impresses. Of course Angor Wat is the main attraction but nearly every tour will take you here to Banteay Srei. The smaller scale and relative good condition makes this temple my favorite of them all. Go to an early lunch and see this during lunch time to avoid the large group tours with your guide.

Long(er) drive bur worth it. It's 1,5 hours by Tuk Tuk (USD 30 for the entire day), Nice site seeing on the way and a relaxed way to travel.
The temple is not so big but beautifull restored, broken down and built up again brick by brick and that shows.
Out of all the temples this one is the nicest.
What a place!. Super site! Great landscape and beautiful nature! Nice walk around the ruins. Do not miss this temple! Beautiful trees and buffalo.

Unbelievably intricate architecture. . Although a 25 min drive from the main siem reap temples this place is well worth a visit. Hardly any tourists and possibly the most intricately decorated temple I've seen in the region. Made of pink sandstone it is clearly built for a woman and rightly so. It is smaller than most but has had far more thought put into the carvings. There is also great photo spots with the water pools. We went mid afternoon which was hot, but were virtually alone. Take lots of water and it is worth battling the heat to be alone in this great place.
Intricate and Intriging Bateay Srei. Such intricate engravings and detail at every turn. Not huge, but unique in that carved by women. Definitely on my top 5, temples to be seen in SR.

Beautiful site, with intricate carvings. This place is made of pink sandstone and very well maintained due to the efforts of the Swiss government.It is a 45 min ride by tuk tuk from Siam reap centre, but worth the ride. You would experience the country side of Cambodia and understand more of it.This is one of the few temple sites of Angkor which has intricate carvings and the mythological figures are clearly detailed.

Beautiful & well worth the longer ride. Although this Temple---Ladie's Temple/Pink Temple is a longer ride (40 minutes) from Siem Reap, it is well worth it if you have the time. The intricate carvings, uniquely-colored stone and water-lily pond make for scenic and memorable views. On the way there or on the way back, you might consider a stop at the somber but interesting Land Mine museum.

Marvellous Carvings. The detailed carvings in this Temple are fascinating. This place is a must visit during your trip to Siem Reap. The best carvings you can hope to see in any of the Temples for sure
Stunning. It's a long drive by tuk tuk (over an hour) from Siem Reap, so take an air conditioned taxi. The colours and detail are quite stunning. We called in to the Land mine museum on the way too.

A amazing place with less crowd. a amazing place to visit . very quiet with less people around. a lot of good photography location around. do visit at early morning around 7 am for good photo with sun rise

Not Worthy . My hotel's manager has strongly recommended me to visit this temple which is also known as Lady Temple. However, I find it is not worthy to make this trip as it caused additional USD10.It is a small temple and not worthy to make a 45 minutes from Siem Reap city. I would rather spend this 45 minutes to tour around Angkor Thon area. However, you can see the nice rice field view along the way to this temple and try the ready made sweet palm fruit biscuit.

Amazing. One of the best temples. Although it is abit far off compared to the rest of the other temples, it is an amazing ride to the temple itself- enjoy the countryside and see how the locals live on the way to the temple, and maybe even stop by the Landmine Museum if you're feeling templed out by midday.Indulge in the intricate designs and carvings and if you're hungry you can stop by the many stalls along the way or have a meal at the restaurant on site
A quiet place. It rained when we got there but I still love the place. The colour of the temples is amazing. I highly recommend this place .

Amazing place and the road to go there is also awesome. Though the Temple is around 35km far from the siem reap town but if you have taken 3 days pass then its a must visit place.The tuk tuk guys charges differently for these place.It takes 1 hr to reach and you can enjoy the Cambodian roads and views , prefer to go around 3 pm from siem reap town

Better than the rest. Well worth the extra travel. The carving is the most well preserved out of all the temples we saw and the most beautiful. The site has good facilities like a café and quite good toilets.
Best Temple even Angkor Wat. As you are smaller but too nice with all caving. ans statues. Everyone say wao when see you in a jungle of forest follow by a big tree. We really love to see it.
Amazing . Definitely worth a visit. A tuktuk should cost $25 for the day.Make sure to visit the butterfly farm and landmine museum to make it a day-trip.
Breath-taking. I know this is a bit out of the way but it is a must. The carvings were just SO amazing , beyond words.

Most romantic temple. By far the most delicately carved temple in the entire Big and Small circuit. Even though it's 34 km away from the city center, I definitely recommend a visit to Bantray Srei (Citadel of the Women) is really near the top of my list of favorite temple.
The pink hued stones and green moss covering helps paint picture too.

enjoying view with paddy field n great experience. the location is quite far from the main temple like a.wat n etc. its 2hours return.this temple stil under restored. the main entrance were decorate with the bamboo style.
few of the local people selling fruits n souvenirs.
its only takes 30mins to get around within this temple.

The Reddish Sandstone Temple. of all the Angkor Temples, the Banteay Srei temple has one of the most intricate and fine carvings. The temple is not the same as any of the Angkor method of constructions and has a more finer more reddish pinkish hue to it's sandstone structure. A very much smaller temple built in the 10th century, the temple is dedicated to the Hindu God Shiva. This temple is most definitely worth the visit, Bantay Srei incidentally means Citadel of Beauty.

a little way out.... This temple is a little way out from the rest of the complex and slightly different in color and style..worth the trip out the tuk tuk guys will know all about it and maybe continue on to the landmine museum.
Unbelievable!. This temple was build and carved in 967! AMAZING! And all the work was done by women. The details were fantastic! :-)
The prettiest Temple. Bantey Srei is a small little temple set in the forest, with the most amazing intricate carving on its doorways, lintels, and bas reliefs. Not to be missed.
Banteay Srei. This temple is well worth the trip. The carvings are exquisite. The orange hue of the stone unique and the exhibition centre showing the work done on the restoration is illuminating

Great photo opportunities. This ruin lies near the Kulen mountain is a remarkable place to visit if you have the time as it's a decent drive outside of Siem Reap. The decorations are fascinating and is quite well preserved, and as it's built from pink sandstone. Also the tourist crowds are usually much lesser than those sites close to town.

Banteay Srei - a different era. This place is very nice - the architecture is almost perfect. The walls, pillars are well polished, sharply cut and perfectly aligned The artwork is beautiful and the writings on the walls remain.

Worth the trip. It's a bit of a drive to get there, but hire an awesome tuk tuk driver and the journey will just add to the experience. It's quite different to the other temples, in architecture, colour, and size (it's surprisingly small). If you have the time to go a bit out of your way to see it, you really should.
Small but unique. Slightly off the beaten path, but worth it. Its not a large temple complex by any means, but its quiet beautiful with its intricate carvings.

A very different style of temple. We last visited here 9 years ago and at the time our very small group had the place to ourselves. Unfortunately that was no so today with lots of buses and a very commercial presentation with all the shops however the detail is wonderful and the red stone against the green surrounds makes for good photos.We came out by tuktuk, about an hour, and enjoyed the ride through the countryside with the breeze in our faces.

Beautiful - Great Contrast to Angkor Wat. One of my favorite spots in Siem Reap. Quite delicate, beuatiful and you can clearly see why they call it the "ladies temple". The only downside was that by the time we got there it was crowded...

Charming. My favourite temple in Angkor. Go there early to avoid the crowd.The setting is a bit different than in most temples, smaller, very well maintained. The colours are very nice in the morning light.
Interesting Temple. One of my favourite temples in Siem Reap!Really beautiful and an amazing colour very different to the other temples. Not to far from Siem Reap :)
The female temple. This temple was also awesome. Completely different from some of the others. An archaeological and architechtural marvel. Well worth seeing, bring your cameras!

Beautiful ancient Hindu temple - fantastic carvings. This is one of the oldest temples, well worth the short drive about 20 km outside Siem Reap. Really well preserved with delicate fantastic religious carvings in honey coloured sandstone. We visited it 15 years ago and were the only ones there - now busloads of mainly Chinese tourists - so try to arrive early. Strongly recommended
Smaller and less busy. A real highlight.. Great Temple. Smaller scale. Nice drive in countryside to get there. Good shopping market. Wonderful wall decorations
Breathtaking!. Such an amazing place! I booked my tour with 'Happy Angkor Wat Tour' and would highly recommend them.

Beautiful. Its stone carving is richer than any other angkor temples. It is small and bit far from other main temples. Tuk tuk charges $20 -$22 to take you there. Since I am from India, I have seen these kind of stone carved temples a lot. So I didnt feel that excited. If you are going here, do visit the Kulen mountain waterfall. I couldnt go as we were having a small baby with us and found hard to walk more. I have seen waterfall photos. The stone carvings can be found on the rocks over there. The massive rocks used to construct Angkor Wat had been brought from those mountain through canals. We saw the sunrise at Angkor wat and directly headed to this temple. What I enjoyed more is the en route. It gave the real picture of Siem Reap today.

My favorite but competition is so intense- all temple are OMG. Wish more tourists visit and pay homage to my fave temple. Its not on the "superstar list" maybe bc its sized in mini when compared to the "complex" but this has gorgeous aura. We loved this stop and hope others visit too- this sandstone gem shines!I regretted not purchasing "items" from the young girls selling flowy shirts- I am not a "shopper" but it looked like she could have used the money and her white gauzy shirts were actually really nice!I did contribute to the Landmine Muscians at each temple- they helped set the "stage" and made entry very magical-

Smallest but most intricate - just lovely! - with a girly touch. Banteay Srei, when translated means "City of Women"They believed that women built this place due to the intricate carvings all over this small "city". It's a little bit off the other temples, but it's worth a visit.Again, try to get a tour guide, if not, read up on it. Because it is carved in Red Sandstone, the whole temple is a little more reddish than others. Making it very special.Also, turned out to be one of my favourite :)
Beautiful temple. Away from the hustle of the crowd. A good tuk tuk drive outside of siem reap but worth the breezy trip. You get to see s bit of countryside along the way.
worth the detour. Beautiful carvings- the color is unique and this one id dedicated to women. Out of the way but definitely worth it.
Beautiful Temple a little further out, worth the visit. Loved the red sandstone temple, very beautiful and a little different from the others. Definitely worth the visit.

Unique and interesting. Pretty out of the way but has beautiful carvings. The color is unique compared to most of the other temples in the area. There weren't as many tourists as the other tourists. We visited around 11:00am. It's not a large complex but if you're in the area, it's worth a visit.

Majestic. This temple is dedicated to the goddess of Shiva. It is a small temple with an interpretation centre and a lovely garden lake area to visit and do some bird watching. You should plan to visit for one hour or more and bring some water. Do some reading on topic before hand to help understand the structure of the place.

Another amazing place in this complex of living history. it's another wonder of the world in this amazing complex - it's accessible all in when you buy the $40 ticket which allows you three visits over seven days. The temples are accessible. "Guides" will engage you in conversation and many are worth the tip as they will bring you into the "nooks and crannies" of this living history - but you don't really need one here. It is breathtaking and well run. You definitely need a tuk tuk / about $15 for the short trip or negotiate a rate if you want to travel to the temple around 60km away - all well worth a once in a lifetime trip - bring lots of disc space on your camera - it's breathtaking and an umbrella to shade you from the heat or rain. Eating is at "tourist traps" on site but there is no other choice and they are adequate / drink lots of water and bring good walking shoes as there are lots of Very steep steps to negotiate. A bucket list trip - hard to find its equal worldwide.
Majestic. Just like what the picture shows us. A must see. Bring extra shirt aa things might get a little sweaty.. Thumbs up!!

Amazing. Make you sure you don't get "templed" out & miss this temple very different from the others the colour, the carvings make it very different , we saw this temple on way back from waterfall tour & glad we did

Smallest but the most beautiful. This temple is one of my favorites. The color was beautiful and the carvings, the most intricate.We went here right after watching the sunrise at Angkor and it was the best decision we had all day. We share the whole temple with a few tourist for about an hour before the hoards of tourist buses arrive. I don't know how all those people would fit in there.Definitely worth the drive.

Beautiful temple!!. This would be my favorite temple out of all temples in my opinion. It wasn't that big but the carvings were amazing! When we went there, it wasn't very crowded too and our guide Mr. Lonh knew exactly where to go to avoid the crowd and take good photos! It's around 40 minutes away from Siem Reap town but it was worth it!
Lady temple. this is a great desifned temple, some people call lady temple, but the registered name is Bantreay srey. spend 3 hours you will know how amazing it is.

Banteay - Klein aber Fein (Small but fine :-). I took a day tour to Kulen mountain and Banteay Srei. The temple has the best carving in the Angkor area, but unfortunately some is blackened badly as the fire to burn away the jungle also affected the pink sandstone, as my guide told it. A long drive away from Angkor Wat, so arrange a separate visit by car. I used Happy Angkor tours and was happy with the guide and the price was among the lowest of all tour companies.

Make a day of it. This is a temple you can visit while doing a grand tour of the area. On the way you will see daily life, rice paddies, rivers, children playing, and all those amazing Asian sites you want to photograph and remember. It has excellent carvings and is in a great setting with water and forest. There is a bit of a walk to get to it but well worthwhile. When we were there a band was playing, all of the members were land mine victims. The amazing music they played really made the setting seam like a place from another time. The best time to visit if you want to stay away from the tour groups is early in the morning. Alternatively go in June or July when no-one is there. However be aware June and July can be very hot so an air con car is a good option. You will visit several of these sites in the same day trip as they are much smaller than Thom or Angkor Wat. If you want a go to the sites a wee way away from Angkor such as the Roluos group or this one you need either a good tuktuk or car driver. Try to get Mr Pahna he is the best in the business. Phone him on +855 1286 45 81 or 855 975085708 e.mail and facebook panhachhouk@yahoo.com and arrange him to pick you up from the airport. If you do manage get him as your driver ask him to take you to the local market for a tour, well worth a look and you can get real gems stones there. On your way into Cambodia you are unlikely to have your full quota of kgs of luggage. Most airlines offer 30kgs but most people take nearly empty suitcases into the country and fill them while they are there. Don’t take a half empty suitcase into Cambodia, fill it up with children’s books, educational toys (no battery operated toys), toothbrushes, soap, shoes, technology items and other useful things. The items don’t need to be new, just in good working condition. Please don’t take lollies or sugary stuff and don’t offer religious items, Cambodians have a diversity of religions available to them, let them choose. You can ask your hotel to distribute the items or take them to the Children’s Sanctuary.

Banteay Srie small in size, big in beauty.. Banteay Srei is beautiful in many ways, the colour of the temple adds to its beauty and is due to the red sandstone that mainly used to build it. Makes this temple stand out.The carvings are much more detailed and intricate, you can tell that the queen built this temple (well not her personally), it's very pretty and more feminine than the other temples. Much quieter site, this place doesn't seem to attract as many visitors probably due to it's location as it's further out than the other temples, we stopped off on way out of the site so didn't have to walk there. Beautiful little temple
The one of Angkor. Very Very special place. there have the good natural. You should not believe whom if you still not go there which see by yourself.

Banteay Srei. This temple is bit more of a trip to get to but even so the scenery on the way is worth it. The temple itself is more intricately carved than others, and the carving is also deeper. The stone is also a different colour with hues of pink and red. This is a smaller temple and easy to get around. Well worth a visit.
Fantastic spot not that far away. Underrated! Carvings are best here - well worth the trip out of Siem Reab. Hard to believe this was done 900 hears ago.

Part of the Grand Tour. As part of the Gran Tour itinerary, the Banteay Srei was the furthest temple that we went to. Along the way we saw the rice puddies and the country side. Banteay Srei was a small temple but very intricate design. We took our lunch at Resto 21 but a bit pricey - USD 6.50 per meal.

Beautiful Temple. Banteay Srei its mean citadel of women called by local people because this temple is small beautiful temple and very good carving, the ancient or original name is Thiribuvanamahadeva temple its mean the palace of Siva god stay in Hindu religion. Location is northern of Angkor Wat temple in Siem Reap province about 30 kilo meters on the way to Kulen Mountain ( first Khmer empire and waterfall mountain ) visitor should go to visit Kulen mountain first than on the way back visit this temple.
Carving temple. Small temple but unique carvings. Very compact and made of harder stone so more intact than others. Worth the drive in my top 3 in the area.

Amazing carvings, must see. This is one of my favorite temples in Siem Reap. The intricate bas-relief carvings were beautiful work of art and truly a must see. They did a good job in their restoration work for this place. One must never miss going to this place on their itinerary because this site is truly amazing! Tip: although it can be hot, come around midday (lunch time) to avoid the crowd.

Beautiful Temple. Absolutely beautiful temple! Make sure to stop at the landmine museum on the way. Finally, please don't buy things from any child because they are selling instead of being in school.

Bit of a journey but worth it.. Yet another great temple to visit.This one has been restored a bit more with a few statues and building pieces made recently to rebuild the main areas.Its a fair distance from Siem Reap so a little quieter than other temples which makes getting a good picture so much easier.There are several places to eat as well as the usual wooden art stalls.The trip there is enjoyable as you get to see the locals and their village life.I would recommend combining this with the butterfly park making the journey more productive.
Amazing Banteaysrey Temple. The only temple that build by queen , in cambodia we all Banteay Srey Temple , the stone was nicer than other temple because this temple is pink color
Fascinating Design. It was an outstanding tour which we have been too, it a bit far because from the temple complex but it worth visiting it. This temple most likely be the one which you must see.
Beautiful temple. Very different from Ankor much more atmospheric as a lot less tourists, the carving very detailed a very beautifl
Must see. Absolutely loved it. Work the drive out from Angkor. Older than Angkor so very interesting and awed by its detailed carving

Lower priority temple. While this temple is certainly incredible-- it was probably our least favorite out of Angkor Wat, Bayon and Ta Prohm. A little smaller in scale and therefore feels a little more crowded (but lots of detailed carving). Beautiful-- but if you have to prioritize for time, drop it.

Beautiful temple and must add to list of temple visits. Beautiful temple with detailed artwork on the walls. It is a must visit sight and one should fit it in into the schedule of temples in Siem reap.

Favorite of all!. Of all the ancient temples/cities we visited, this one was my favorite. The color, the way the light plays off the carvings - everything about it was amazing. Make the most of your day and visit this temple and the Cambodia Land Mine Museum on the same day (they are on the same road - its about 40 minutes by tuk-tuk).

Banteay Srei. Banteay Srei is a flat temple located on the site of the old town of Isvarapura, northeast of Angkor (25 km) It was built in the Xe century in laterite and pink sandstone. It has a Khmer architecture, in the form of a racket. To see for: decorations, sculptures. It is surrounded by moats and walls built in dairy and brick. Its buildings are built with pink sandstone. The sculptures are of exceptional finesse and, just for this Banteay Srei deserves the nickname "jewel of Khmer art. It has carved facades of scenes from Hindu mythology motifs and floral patterns. The first steps axial stairs are decorated with lion sculptures - The temple is dedicated to the GodTribhuvanamaheçvara and it was also the former name of the temple,,Modern name means "Citadel of Women", probably making reference to its size, or perhaps "Citadel of Beauty" referring now to the delicate decoration .... A real gem !
Love the structure and the colour. Love the structure and the colour. It was totally different from the rest of the temple. Prepare to climb.

The most beautiful temple. The finest art among all temples in the park. You admire the beauty but also see the cruelty of human beings, even between brothers. The temple is small but tourists are non-stop. A bit pressure but you will be amazed with the high quality of the motif / bas relief. It is far from Siem Reap. So be prepared to pay more for the tuk tuk or taxi.http://hkindependent-traveller-croatia.blogspot.hk/2015/01/banteay-srei.html

The "queen" Banteay Srei. For sure the Angkor Wat is impressive complex and the crowning glory of Siem Reap but I personally like this small serene and intricately beautiful temple. Small but big in terms of beauty as magnified by its intricate architecture and design. Its almost the "queen of temples" in Siem Reap. I suggest a visit midafternoon to sunset as the sun rays relfecting the bricks of Banteay Srei is magical -from orange,red,yellow and a lot of bright alluring colors.

Unique and colorful ruins. The temple was reddish and beautiful compared to the other temples in Siem Reap and the carvings were intricate and well executed. Truly a feminine place of worship, lotus pond with pink flowers add beauty to the already impressive place.

Beautiful.. A stunning, quieter women's temple farther out from the town, this was another favourite. Also we got here early and enjoyed some peaceful meditative time before the crowds caught up with us!
Spend the time. It's a little out of the wat off the main Angkor complex but doesn't mean it's undiscovered but spend the time. Go early to beat the crowds
Another great temple to visit. Another great spot to visit, there are so many to see and none will disappoint you. Take your time, wear appropriate clothing and wear good shoes.

A pink sweet temple far from the. A pink "sweet" temple away from the bustle and whirl of tourists, in the countryside, even if I was a tourist ... the way to get there provides insight into the life of the deep Cambodia, with a smiling and courageous people, a stone color that exudes a certain light, the many sculptures and worked (then he would know more fully the legends and symbols of religions represented, there is often the boudisme and Hinduism which mingle ...) , valiant warriors and guardians goddesses particularly successful tours, a peaceful atmosphere as well. Historical explanations prepared under the "modern" shelters also have a genuine interest (precise and synthetic).

Worth the trip to the coutryside. As others reviwers have mentioned, this temple is different in many ways. The little details in the carvings are really nice and the colors are different. It is a little out of the way, but well worth it we believe. Especially if you take time to enjoy the countryside, admire the rice fields which give you great photo shots. And most importantly, stop along the way and Spend some time with Cambodian in the villages. They are the nicest people. Always smiling and always welcoming despite their very meager livings.
Pretty, but far.. Its beautiful, but the ride takes an hour. Get a car, not a tuk tuk, if you can afford it. Those guides that are being sold at the entrance? Bargain for $2 or walk away.

Citadel of the Women. Banteay Srei which is largely built of red sandstone is a beauty all by its own. Being dedicated to Shiva it is thought to be a citadel for the women - very unique intricate carving and stone works.

Beautiful temple with nice carving but a bit far to visit. This temple lies in 43 km away from angkor wat to the north. I rode bicycle there. The road is a bit narrow. A good suggestion would be using tuk-tuk (three wheel vehicle, local taxi). The taxi fee is a bit expensive so I chose to use bicycle. I think it would be more than 20 dollar for one way since going to airport is around 8 dollars. But it worth visiting. The stone carving are so nice and the architecture of the temple is amazing. You just need to show the ticket of Angkor wat to get access.
Pink Stone Temple. A Temple little away from Angkor wat, Having different temple of Brahma, Vishnu , shiva, Another must see

Love this temple!. When I visit this temple.. It was a bit quiet. Not a lot of tourist visiting.. and I have a lot of time exploring on my own without bumping to other tourist. beautiful structures. I really love it!

worth the detour. We decided to visit this temple the second day of our tour in the archeological site. The first day we made the "little tour" that is all day long and pretty impegnative. The second day we went for the "big tour" but we realize at 11.00 that the tour was already done beacuse the most part of the temples are also in the little one (the most important one!). S we asked our tuk tuk driver to go to Banteay Srei. The temple is really impressive and very different from the one in the major archeological site so i strongly suggest to go for it. Making the trip with the tuk tuk gives you the possibility to se a lot of cambodian life in the countryside, the trip is surely beautiful itself!

A Trip in the countryside... I had a wonderful $22 tuk tuk ride out to Banteay Srei . It took about one hours travel each way..there is lovely scenery and Cambodian people going about their lives to see while you are travelling..it is bumpy in a tuk tuk but worth doing.Banteay Srei is a small site but is in a beautiful setting and has a very good Interpretation centre of information on the site with cafe and toilets.On the way back I enjoyed time visiting Pre Rup Temple.There are more sites to look at on the way.

The Pink Temple. The most outfar reach among the temples of angkor, Banteay is one of the most fascinating though. Very small compared to the big "guys" Bayon and Angkor Wat, this one is well preserved

Great example of how ancient the Hindu religion is.. If you want to see art in great detail, this is the temple. A little further away from Siem Reap, it is worth the travel. This temple is small but has more detailed sculptures than the bigger temples in Angkor Wat.

a fantastic temple in Siem Reap. I've ever been here many times but never had chance to describe how much I love this beautiful temple. the unique curve stone is what I always dream to have in my house, it's really fantastic and I definitely admire the architecture and it absolutely good with this name Srei = Lady.this is the stunning temple where everyone could not miss during your trip in Siem Reap.
Amazing, worth the travel to get there. 30km or so from Siem Riep but absolutely worth it. Well preserved, make sure to come with a guide, lots of opportunities for great photos.Do it by tuk tuk.
Well preserved ruin. Surprisingly well preserved ruin among the other temple ruins. Admired the intricate carvings on the lintels.

My Favorite, the grounds are stunning, nature trail!. The pink temple, this was my favorite! The grounds were stunning and had this nature trail that you could walk through the rice fields, there are many observation points along the way to take photos. The temple itself was nice as it was different than the others within Siem Reap.
Well Preserved. This is a well preserved sight and a must see as part of your trip to Angkor. It is smaller than the other temples but still worth a visit

The most beautiful temple of Cambodia. Temple is small in size after seeing Angkor wat and Angkor Thom. But the beauty of this temple is far more than the others. The carvings of this temple are simply superb. Such a fine carving is really great. And this being one of the oldest temples got naturally destroyed.

Worth the extra effort to see it. This amazing temple is a minature version of the others with some interesting carvings. It's 45 minutes by Tuk-tuk each way from the main Angkor complex but well worth the effort, especially since the drive itself is interesting and pleasant.

Beautiful Temple. Very small temple and quite a way out of the centre of town (allow at least 45 mins) but worth going to! The beautiful designs on the temple are very impressive. Make sure you walk around the path on the outer rim as photos from there are fantastic of the whole temple.

A bit further out, but a little different. Also called the 'lady temple', not sure why but after you have visited all the other temples this one just looks a little bit different. Make it a double stop, here and then another 10kms away to see the falls.It is a great experience

A little out of the way but worth the effort. This temple is located a hour or so out from Siem Reap. Suggest you organise a car and guide for this area. The stone is very intricately carved and pink in colour. We went in the afternoon as the guide said there would be many tourists in the morning. The restaurants nearby are a little limited and expensive.

Small... but worth the visit . Colorful and details ruins....i was surprised when I saw the elephants..
Add this one the list and come see it

the rose temple "female temple. Well worth the go out from Angkor into the countryside because this is different to other temples because of its colour and shape also and it was a great experience to see the country side and the Cambodian houses and also enjoy the way for this temple we like this temple very much high recommended for all

Worth the drive. A beautifully preserved temple in a pink brick.
As usual can be busy and very hot.
It's a bit further out but definitely worth the time.

Small and petit. This one when yuo visit the huge temples of Ankgor Thom and Angkor Watt ppears petit and feminine by its cuteness of size intricacies of art work and red sand stone structures. The temple complex is beautifully decorated and extremely chic in looks. Its a nice day outing for picnic or similar things. The temple complex is huge and has many attractions like lily pools, bird wathcing, boat ridning or just walking along the nature trails!

Temple in Red. This temple is a must see. Unlike most of the temples this one was carved in Red Sandstone. Much smaller than most of the temples, the ornate carving has earned the name "precious gem", or the "jewel of Khmer art, which is richly deserved. A guide here is very useful otherwise you will miss out on the information of the glorious carving. But visit anyway as it is a joy.

Worth The Trip!. We did this temple as a separate day trip with Beng Mealea & it was well worth it! Our very able guide, & now friend, Sopanha Yous charged us $80 for an SUV with air conditioning & $35 for his services. Well worth the expense to get a car as we certainly could not imagine ourselves riding a tuktuk all the way out there.Banteay Srei truly stands out because it is centuries older than Angkor Wat & is built from rare pink sand stone which due to its hardness, allows for deeper & more intricate carving. A true testament to the wonders of man's patience & creativity!

Nice carvings in pink stone. The guide books state this as the jewel of angkor area despite its smaller size. Inarguably, it is worth seeing on a 2-day tour, but it remains somewhat less impressive than the main circuit of Angkor/Bayon/Ta Prohm

Banteay Srei, the Pink temple. A bit far from Angko wat but it worths the trip...this temple is a pure beauty, much smaller than the others but a treasure as it is extremely well preserved! Dont hesitate to visit !
The ladies temple. Smaller sized temple though I believe 200 years older than most of the other temples. Can get busy though. Like all temples it hot!

With tuktuk ... . We visit this temple by tuktuk Booked from our hotel 'Mango Rain Boutique' hotel.Driver explained local life on the way to the temple. We stopped to see production of 'Cambodian noodles' and 'palm sweets' Nice combination! So the 60 minutes tuktuk trip was combined with local life ...Special temple due to red sandstone.No doubt: impressing! Each of them are special

Less crowded equally great than Ta Phrom. This one presents a maze of incredible rooms and amazing perspective for drawings. You will find the same trees invading the ruins than in Ta Phrom but with less people.
Another must. Another treasure that draws large groups off toursit, if you can aviod the tourist groups which is difficult, you can really get a better appreciation of the red walled temples.

Golden place to see.. Not as big as the other temples nor physically demanding, Banteay Srei is one of the most beautiful places in Siem Reap. Dubbed the 'Lady Temple' the temple dates back a long way and remains an important place till today. The carvings are as unique as ever and extremely beautiful. Surely one to be admired.

Less massive than some of the other Ankor wat temple, but has its own unique appeal. Its smaller than some of the other well-known temples in Sieam Reap. However, it red coloured stone and lesser height gives it a different appeal. If you have time and energy after visiting Angkor Wat, Bayon Temple, and Preah Khan and possibly Koh Ker and Beng Melea, then you should definitely it.

Most defined and unique structure of all. A must visit for micro impressionists. It was a consensus with our group that our last temple visit at Bantaeay Srei was the most intricate and well designed of all. While small and petite in size, the carvings and stories were the most elaborate. This temple is for all ages, not steep at all, plain structured and will take a short while. But aside from its beauty are the stories of the past that will make you appreciate how the gods' relationships were.

Sublime!. Stunningly beautiful places if you can avoid the tour groups who crawl all over everything on mass, yes I was a tourist too but such large groups make it really difficult to get around some of the sights.

Worth the 45 min tuk tuk ride. We did this as part of a larger temple tour. It took about 45 minutes by tuk tuk but it was interesting to see some of the country side along the way. We went around lunch time and there was hardly anyone there so excellent for photos. Nicest carving details of any of the temples.We paid 25USD through our hotel for a tuk tuk driver for the whole day, great value and excellent way to see the temples.

Great to see but prob not first stop. While not my favorite one of the whole area, it is definitely worth seeing. The color makes it stand out from the others. It tends to get a little crowded, so if you don't like crowds, go early. You can get some really great pictures no matter what time you go, though!

Go Early; Seize the Beauty. Simply put, this temple is beautiful. The stone is gorgeous, and the carvings are beautiful. This temple is #2 for me of the wats at Angkor--about twenty miles off the Angkor path, but still within the park, the extra fifty minutes it takes to get there is well worth the wait.

Peaceful. About an hour Tuk-Tuk drive from siem reap, also known as Lady's Temple, it is very peaceful and jewel of Khmer art. It was built with pink sandstones and the carvings are very detail and artistic. Since it was remarkably small compare to other temples in the area the carvings are more or less at eye level so that details can be observed. Best to visit around early to mid morning.
Move to visit it. I know it is a liitle far away from the others temples but its a jeweĺ! Discover it was really incredible. The carving its very good and so warriors monkeys very interesting...
